text: Always fresh and incredible delicious. Wide range of selection available for any occasions. It became our must to go every week place :)

If I could give a zero I would. Went in to see the owner of the salon for some blonde bayalage and to cut off the ends of my hair. Came out with brassy hair and my very, long hair was just pass my shoulders. The color I was left with was this brown color with brassy highlights concentrated at the bottom. I called and the owner agreed to have me come back to fix the color and get what I originally wanted free of charge. In my second appointment, he basically spread that brassy, orange color all over my hair. It was horrifying. I had to go spend more money in another salon to try to fix the color I had. The new hairdresser couldn't believe I had paid for such a color. Very disappointed and heartbroken.

Great place to have breakfast during the week but busier on weekends. For a small establishment they have made good use of the space with plenty of tables as well as keeping the place very clean. The food is great with lots of choices. They also recently started offering free wifi so just ask for the password.

This harvey is in the swiss chalet.  Good ample seating!
Clean washrooms.
Friendly staff, clean tables!

Nothing wrong with food. Onion rings and fries were good.

Very happy with this first visit here!

4stars !!

Busy place - excellent coffee - tasty sandwiches - love this Portuguese bakery the breads and rolls are excellent the cakes and goodies are nicely done.  Nova Era was around in little Portugal in Toronto (on Dundas W)...this is just as good. Nice to have this place in the burbs.

You know this place is good when most of the people in queue/line-up are Sri-Lankan and South Asian.....Wow!! thanks to the one person who reviewed this place before me (the first reviewer)... I read your YELP review and headed on over to check it out while I am still in Ajax.  Canbe Food is packed with a steady flow of customers coming and going and why?....cause the food is excellent.  It was only 5:15pm on a Monday and super busy ... excellent selection of food items (overwhelming when you are not too sure what you are in the mood for).  We got the Chili Chicken, Chicken Curry and Chicken Biryani combo - generous portions, excellent spice rating (real deal spice) - busy place, staff super helpful and friendly and go out of their way to describe the individual dishes.  2 Huge servings for $18.08 of combo for 2 people.

Big thanks to the guy from Oshawa in the line-up next to us who was super helpful in what to order (now I understand why he drove all the way from Oshawa for this grub....its very good). Another plus for Ajax having this place ( I am only the second person to review considering this place is the busiest place in the new mall I expect more reviews with good writeup's forthcoming from others)....  absolutely a must try (Ajax just keeps getting better and better "food-wise").  The food is in those buffet style hotplate's that keep food "warm"; so isn't scalding hot by any means - but still tasty none the less.  Most customers were take-out  (there is a seating area with a few people sitting down having food).  There are frozen paratha's and frozen food items in the freezer section (that they have made).

Big plus having so many ethnic places in Ajax that have good food, decent portions, good prices and excellent quality of ingredients.  I noticed reviewers for their other location saying parking is sparse at their other location - note: their Ajax location has plenty of parking btw.

Got the most horrible service from a sales rep and the sales manager.  They were both dishonest and unethical in their sales method.  When I caught them in their lies they both became defensive and aggressive in nature.  They are not professional all.  I would refer to them as snake oil salesmen.  Please stay away from this dealership at all cost.  This is my professional opinion.  If you want to get ripped off come to this dealership.

This place is great!  We came as a group of 5 on a Saturday night and had a fantastic time. 

If you are coming on Saturday, make sure you don't come before 9:30 and plan to spend the WHOLE night here.  For Saturday nights, it is a set menu (we paid $45 per person plus alcohol) and you get loads of excellent food and entertainment.

Around 10:00pm, they brought out a bunch of appetizers (excellent baba ghanoush, hummus, lebneh with mint, Shanklish (which is a middle eastern blue cheese type of cheese ball), tabouleh, Kibbeh nayyeh (which is raw meet so I was pretty skeptical about but was delicious) and lots of pita.  You can keep asking for more of any of these items.

Around 11:00pm a singer came out.  Although I couldn't understand what she was singing, she sounded good to me and people got up to dance which was fun.

Around midnight, they brought out the meat (chicken and beef kabobs and kafta).  By this time of course, you are STUFFED but I had a bit of everything and it was all pretty tasty.  I don't think you can ask for more meat but truthfully, I don't know how anyone could anyway.

Then, a belly dancer came out and I think she gave about a 30 minute show and it was really good.

After that they bring out Turkish coffee and some sort of cheese dessert.  Then the singer came on again and sang until closing.

We stayed until 3:00am.  I would definitely recommend going to this place!  I'm not from a Middle Eastern background and it was a really great way to experience their food and culture.  I was with people who are originally from the Middle East and they all loved it and said it reminded them of home which I think is a pretty good recommendation!
Excellent service... Have used them for years.  Wonderful one man operation by the nicest guy!
Very good breakfast place. Excellent customer service. The reason I only gave it a 4 star is because the eggs are a wee bit too small.
Best Roti I've eaten in Durham!  And I've ate at almost all the places in Durham.  very friendly and their doubles are good.  get there early and many things run out!

You HAVE to try their Portuguese egg tarts or natas. After a great big dinner I was bugged to grab dessert. Sat in on a weekday evening. The bakery has tables for seating and a pastry display that basically smiles at you the moment you walk in. 2 ladies helped me select what treat to grab.

Portuguese nata - baked rich, sweet custard in a crispy, flaky, equally yummy shell. The absolute best I have had. Mum said it was a little on the sweet side for her, I agree only in so much that 1 is enough to satisfy your sweet tooth. $1.30 each

Nutella nata - this I didn't expect. Ordered on a whim because... Nutella. Same as the regular nata but Nutella filled and drizzled. If you want your kid to shut up, get them this. They will be the quietest you've ever heard them, savouring each chocolatey bite with hearts in their eyes. That's how reacted, at least. $1.75 each

I will be back to try more! Great selection and atmosphere overall. 4/5
Cam did a great job, removing wine stains from my light beige carpet, as well very informative in the products he uses, some being all natural, and giving me tips on how to clean my couch

Nice authentic Italian Cafe. The Margherita pizza was fantastic as was the house made cannoli. The Lavazza espressos were perfect. The family that runs it clearly knows their stuff. They were very warm and inviting.
Called with a request, received a timely reply as indicated. The completed job was excellent. I would definitely recommend this company for any carpet cleaning requirements.

A small bakery and Italian food place in Pickering Village with fantastic sandwiches and pastries made on location.  The owner always has different sides and dishes available and clearly makes them with passion.  Very good coffee as well.

Charming cupcake shop in Puckering Village. Started following them in Twitter when I moved to the are a few weeks ago and needed to check it out for myself. 

We ordered a lemon cupcake which was yummy, regular coffee and hot chocolate which were both made to order and just what we needed as it was a chilly day.

We will be back!

I like this spot when I need a quick fix. The two reliable items I order are the doubles and the jerk chicken roti. The double are always hot and fresh. Very cheap as well. I like asking them to add the pepper when they make it to give that extra kick. The jerk roti is nice because their jerk recipe is not very common. It seems like they use a recipe more common in their region.
The only reason I'm giving it three stars is often times I go around 3-4pm  and the things I want to order have run out and will be a wait for more to be ready.
I got amazing service from one if the sales reps. Prompt accurate and made me feel comfortable throughout the buying process. I am going to go back there again when I get my next car.

Burgers are juicey - however the price is a little on the higher side. Monday's they have a 2 for one burger (does not include side or drink though)...however even with that deal it was $17.  Extra toppings are more $$'s cheese, bacon - and even tzatziki sauce is extra (come on already with the extra's a bit much).

Not really a busy place - but steady.

Pricepoint is a bit high - the burger is juice but a bit bland for my liking - so toppings are a must.  Pretty good burger though - homemade and not a cookie cut burger.  Bun is a white boy boring bun though and toppings are run of the mill and tzatsiki cost you if you want anything extra on the bun that is outside of the usual lettuce, tomato and uncooked raw onions etc.

Fries are quite good  - drinks are your boring sugar filled pop from a fountain.  Other people's pictures are a good reflection of the burger - the bun is bland - burger is juicey - good quality meat but a bit on the bland side tastewise.
The food was amazing, large selection to temp every taste bud. I had the veggie samosas, spicy chicken and chicken birani which were all wonderful. Will definitely be back to tey some more!

A very disappointing experience. My stylist was chatting the stylist beside her for the whole duration of my hair cut. Using inappropriate language and my 11 yo daughter was getting her hair done in the chair beside. My stylist addmitted that she was too tired to even wash her hair that day and decided to just wear her track pants.I could tell and would prefer to get my hair done by someone who takes the time to do their own hair.  I felt uncomfortable when the receptionist continued to bad mouth a client after she left the salon. A very unprofessional establishment. How was my haircut? Meh?? And more expensive than Valentino's.
I'll stick with Valentino's in Whitby!

Always very satisfied here!
Service is great!
Always clean! 
Food flavor is consistent!  
Great prices!
Service is extremely slow even when you call ahead. Staff not friendly and some food items are expensive and come in  small portions. Not going back again.

Amazing food and excellent service.  I am always happy when I go there and I feel welcomed.  very clean place and they have weekend entertainment every Friday and Saturday with different famous singers on Saturdays and a live band.

I can't complain at all about this swiss chalet location. Everything goes as you would expect from a swiss chalet chain. Friendly staff, good service and decent food. Nothing bad, nothing wrong, but like a lot of other chain restaurants... there is nothing that stands out.

You know exactly what your getting from swiss chalet and this place does just that.

Mark is a very personable and honest mechanic.  He is very informative in the field and is very thorough.  I have taken my vehicle and friend's and relatives vehicles to him, everyone is very happy.  

The only downside is the receptionist, she is the extreme opposite of mark and seems like does not want to be there.  I wish mark would hire someone personable who actually likes their job.  

All in all great mechanic but horrible receptionist who you have to go through to get anything done, which sometimes is like getting through the berlin wall.  

5 stars for mechanic. 
3 stars because the anguish i get from the receptionsit

John

So far my favourite dessert place in the Durham region.

My husband also agrees.

I'm a fan of their coffee, their cannolis, and cookies.

They also make hot dishes for lunch, such as pizza.

This was our second visit to try out the sandwich (only served on Thursdays and Fridays) and a big table of teenagers snagged all the sandwiches just as we sat down.  Gah!

Disappointed, we ordered our usual pho with rare beef and bun bo hue.  What I love about this little joint is that they serve up pretty decent bun bo hue that is actually spicy.  The broth for both pho and bun bo hue are clean, beefy and unadulterated.  Condiments are served up fresh with a smile.

The service can be slow as this tiny (20 seater) restaurant is served by one lady who serves the hall and mans the counter (presumably the owner).  

Both our first and second visit was good and the location and quality of the food makes VD a go to pho place in Durham region for me.  Sorry Pho Metro, you've lost out by dumbing-down your food in the Ajax location.

Definitely will be back to try out more stuff here!

Amazing! Truly delicious, true Italian family recipe. The taste was so delicious, I ordered a tomato sauce container to-go to!!! Staff and service was prompt, excellent and very friendly..feels like you are amongst friends! The arancini balls were beyond this world, sausage sandwich was cooked to perfection. The deep fried nutella dessert...melts in my mouth! 
This is my new go to spot for sure! Amazing quality!

Excellent Caribbean food. Actually I've found it quite a good value for the amount of food given. It's been here a long long time and as far as I can tell it attracts a loyal following. Definitely worth trying. I just "tried" it over 20 years ago and have to say they've maintained a nice consistency. Could use a reno, but it's only the food that matters really.   I know what to expect when I get food from here. Never disappointed.
Same as the rest of the epic Superstores. It's quiet here late nights in the week so check out is hassle free.
I went to see Anu to have my eyebrows threaded - she is AMAZING!!! So friendly, so informative and knows what she's doing! I have found my new 'threading lady' - you won't be disappointed!!

Food - 5/5
Service - 5/5
Atmosphere - 5/5

My wife and I are regulars at Jazzberry cafe next door, after grabbing some fresh made iced teas we decided to grab some food and were completely surprised at just how good the food here is. Family run, and the completely hand made from scratch pizza is unlike anything in the area, much less the gta. Well done! Will take pictures when we go next time. Was too busy eating!!

Walked into the show room Tuesday 6pm.  Absolutely no service from any sales person.  No one even bothered to say hello.

If you're looking for friendly advice and a welcoming sales people, you won't find it here.

This dealership lost my business forever.

I ate at this place expecting a great experience... Totally not the case.. The food was decent but the veal sandwich was super thin. I've had many veal sandwiches and this one was like eating a bread sandwich .. Thin slices of meat breaded and placed in an over sized bun.. The rice ball  was good but a Similar experience to another reviewer left me with having to choose what the server told me they had. When I asked for one of the choices on the menu I was Rudely told they did not have that choice available and then asked "do you want it or not?" Bottom line.. I don't think the food was worth coming back to deal with the poor service and knowing that I have had better elsewhere I can say I won't miss this place or remember it.
Love this location. It's small but has everything we need for our 2 pups. Staff are always friendly, and they usually have a really good sale/clearance section.

Amazing Caribbean flavours. So good, I can't even. I love how the takeout is served in cute boxes rather than styrofoam or plastic. The jerk chicken is so savoury and smokey and yet it is moist and falls off the bone. The rice and peas with oxtail gravy is perfect and you can taste the fresh spices and scotch bonnet. The plaintain tastes like dessert and the slaw is so freshly made as if it was picked from the garden and tossed. I think of mama's cooking. Can't wait to go back and taste the other offerings! So glad this place exists.

So far one of the best little Roti joints I have been to. Super friendly staff, and they will let you try a bit if you are hesitant to try something. I had the Jerk Chicken Roti. It was definitely the best roti I have had to date. You will NOT need hot sauce for this one. Great combo of both curry and jerk. The size looks a bit smaller than your traditional roti, but let me tell you I could not eat anymore once I finished it even though I would keep trying if there was some still on the plate. Yet another "must return" place in Toronto. That's why I am proud of my hometown. Keep cranking out good eats Toronto, and the same goes for Taste of T&T (Trinidad & Tobago). Sorry for the lack of photos. I couldn't help myself as it was too good.

A little bit of a whole in the wall for decor, tucked in a strip mall way at the back. The food was tasty the portions for the price were fare. One of the better vietnamese restaurants in Ajax. The family run business with just two people working there was excellent. Food didn't take long to come and as it just really tasty!

Simply terrible!  I had learned that they have hot pasta entrees.  So one evening I decided to pop in and get a couple lasagna portion to take home for dinner.  It is advertised as fresh home made lasagna on their menu board - so I assumed this was a good sign.  I placed and paid for my order.  Then as I watched the kitchen through the open window ... I saw the guy open the fridge, and scoop out two pieces of the pasta from a square pan with his BARE HANDS  .... then placed the pieces on a plate and proceeded to warm them up in a microwave; he then placed the pieces in a foil container and a young lady handed me the package.  I was stunned but didn't have the guts to confront the issue, especially since I had already paid.  The pasta did not make it to the dinner plates - it ended up in the garbage instead.

I decided to give this place a 2nd try and thought that breakfast would be better .... but I was wrong!
At 10am in the morning, there was no bread or breakfast food options -- when I asked what was available for breakfast the owner told me that they were still making breakfast.  How is that even possible for a place that advertises breakfast? He pointed out some dessert tarts in the glass case a compromise.

Cafe failure!

Anu works wonders... love how she actually shapes the brow and gives hope that they will one day be full again after being butchered by many before her including from my own trusted tweezers that Im throwing put as soon as I get home!! Thanks Anu, can't wait to see the new place and wish you the best of luck in your new space :)

Came here specifically to order some tiramisu and some donuts which are delicious but the service is sooooo slow. Was standing there waiting to order for a good 5 minutes without anyone acknowledging me. There was a person cashing out and another person making some drinks. No acknowledgment to tell me I'll be right there, so I decided to leave. To be honest, if I'm standing there for more than a few minutes and yet anyone saying hi to me doesn't deserve my business. I love the fact it's a family own business and I truly support family businesses but I highly doubt I'll be returning unless I'm super desperate in need of sweets and everything else is closed. Expect to wait a long time to get service.

I gave this place a one star because I had to give them a rating. It's Dec 24 I understand, but don't open if you are not going to serve quality food. Veal sandwich was very weak! Thin little piece of veal, and very skimpy on the toppings which I played a lot for. This place should just close!!. Why bother? They didn't even have the variety of rice balls that was recommended by a friend.  That dude owes me a lunch. I recommend you give this place a pass!!

OMG!!!  Peoples who gives high scores, are you ever tried anything better then carrot? This place is terrible. Just look around, tables and chairs legs rusty, walls dirty need big cleaning. Their "Famous"  burgers garbage! Meat 100% mixed with  soybean or just plain flour, very bad taste! French fries just bad, fish and chips.. no words. Sorry! Never ever tried  food same as in this place.

Dropped in this evening to pick up some custard tarts and a few other deserts - Custard Tarts are a must absolutely perfect; skip the tiramisu (underwhelming doesn't seem home made); Almond Tart is good too (not too sweet); excellent cannoli's also.

Nice cafe in Pickering Village. We got a prosciutto sandwich, chicken panini, pizza and then desserts to go. Everything was delicious! The owner, very sweet and friendly. Service was excellent. Would definitely recommend.

WOW.

I was so terribly disappointed with my experience at this bakery. 

I ordered a cake for my engagement party here and it was horrible. 
I paid $$$ for this cake and ended up with something that looked like I had baked it myself.
Everyone at my party kept asking me if it was homemade.

When I first arrived my cake topper was tipped over and smooched into the cake.  At first the girl at the counter fixed this by simply straightening the cake topper and stating "there" not doing anything about the messed up icing around it - or the holes in the buttercream. 

After stating how upset I was about the presentation she stated that there were no details written on my order form - even though I spend over half an hour describing to the associate exactly what I wanted the day I ordered it.  The girl behind the counter did make her best attempt to fix it after I expressed my opinion however she stated there were no managers available and that she had little experience with icing. it still looked like something I had created myself - but it was at least decent.

When I got home I discovered that my cake topper was actually broken. Which is why it kept tipping over. The ceramic peg on the bottom was missing - it looked like it had been dropped. 

Yet no one bothered to mention it to me. They also were suppose to use two different types of icing - vanilla on the outside and maple fudge on the inside - yet it was entirely vanilla. 

Other than dropping it, I'm not sure what else could have been more wrong.

I used to go here to have my hair done by Charbel. But I had to move to the US. Since back I decided to go back here even though I live in Toronto it's worth the drive! I saw Stylist Pinky the day before New Years Eve to have my hair highlighted, toned, treatment, blowout and styled. Wow is to say the least... AMAZING!!! She did an exceptional job! I have always left here with nothing but the best. Charbel and Pinky are talented and are fantastic. Thank you!

This is the only place I buy frozen vegetables!  When you walk in, you'll see rows of freezers that are filled with every possible fruit and vegetable you could ever want or need.

Love spinach but can't stand cleaning the leaves and cutting off the stems before cooking it? Try MacMillan's shredded spinach pucks! Throw a bunch in a pot of boiling water, cook, strain and serve. You can also thaw them to use in salads, sandwiches, soups or pasta.

Staples for me are their green & yellow beans, spinach pucks, peaches & cream corn and their sweet potato french fries.

You can also buy a wide variety of frozen prepared dinners, stuffed chicken breasts and desserts of all kinds as well as fresh fruit and vegetables when in season. Oh, and they also have a great selection of jams, sauces, maple syrups, condiments and... wait for it... HONEY BUTTER! Delish! My Mum used to buy honey butter for me when I was a kid but I've never been able to find it in the grocery store. Today I found it at MacMillan's! Happy days!

And for those hot summer days, you can also have a cone of frozen yogurt which they will make right in front of you... just pick the fruit you want in it and you're good to go.

Definitely a hidden treasure in Ajax near the Whitby border.

Tried out this little Gem.  Prices are a steal.  So much so that I wonder about the quality of the food.  $2.95 for chicken and rice.  $2.86 for chicken and fries of fried rice.  NUTS.  They could up the prices and then they could afford to do a renovation.  But I think the daily amount of students coming there from the local high-school wouldn't be able to afford it.   Roti is my test of a place and this place is ok.  at $5.50 its good enough.  I think I would still go to T&T for their ~$9.00 roti.  I would never take someone there to eat, but rather get takeout  which is what I think they want to focus on.  They advertise a live dj on Friday and they have music playing all the time on a loud speaker....  very west indian style.  Not sure how this appears.  I believe it's run by Trini/Guyanese. I might be back if I'm in the neighborhood and I'm wanting a cheap meal.  I'd love to see this place put more effort into their location and their presentation.  I sense they just aim for "acceptable" enough to make some money.

We came here on Boxing Day morning and the place wasn't too busy. 

The waitress came by to take our order a couple of times before we decided and that was the end of her attentiveness. 

One of our guests asked for his meat side to be plated separately (does not eat pork and instead of ordering sausage as an extra we share it from his meal). I also asked for maple syrup with my French toast and another guest asked for water to drink.

After taking our order the waitress did not return and avoided eye contact. I literally did a two handed wave to get her attention for the water. 

When the food arrived it was mediocre and luke warm. 
The meat was plated on top of the eggs and no maple syrup. Then we couldn't get the waitress to understand what we meant about the sausage. She did take the plate away and bring it back with the meat separate, they did not replace the eggs.

Then had to chase down the waitress for more coffee, which ended up not being hot anyway. 

Would definitely not return.

I grew up on Middle Eastern food and this place is exactly what I've been eating at family functions since I started eating.
Nothing bad about the food here, it's as authentic as can be.
Prices are a little expensive, but it IS a nice, large and clean restaurant.
I'm looking forward to their evening entertainment one weekend.
Delicious croquettes and pastries!!  Best portuguese bakery in Durham!
I am only giving 4 stars because I have only tried their rice balls and deserts. I have had a great experience every time I have gone. Great staff, great balls, and delicious toppings.

The best Swiss Chalet period. 

Nobody loves Swiss chalet more than me.  I usually come to this location at least once a week. 

Food is always piping hot, excellent service  (Enza is the best)  and quick.  

See you on Friday

Canbe Foods recently opened their new location in Ajax.  They have Indian and Sri Lankan food prepared and made to order.  We visited here today and were impressed with the cleanliness and the seating area for eating (which was lacking at their older location in Scarborough).  See the photos, it is bright and clean.

We had chicken samosa, kothu roti, coconut roti, rice noodle.  They were delicious and just as consistent as their other location.  Parking was plentiful and service was quick.

I've been a member since January 2016 and it is by far the best gym I've ever been to. All classes are available to you with your membership, there's free towel service, clean bathrooms (that come with shampoo, conditioner, body wash, shaving cream), a clean changing area, eucalyptus sauna, regular sauna, and jacuzzi bath. 

In terms of their equipment, they have a plethora of equipment that range from your standard weights and treadmills to crunch machines and stairs. There's also a court for basketball and indoor soccer field. Haven't been to the outdoor pool yet, but there's a nice water slide for the kids to enjoy. 

Overall, great service and great amenities!

I would have given it 4 stars but I feel like the staff hate their jobs and everything about their lives. I don't think I have seen anybody smile ever and i feel like I am an inconvenience when I walk in. When I ask questions about any item I get short answers and attitude. 

Most of their products are quite tasty which is what keeps me coming back. However, if I find a bakery that has equally tasty treats and nicer staff, I likely won't be back.
Love this place. Staff are knowledgeable and don't try to push every product on you. Bonus...free learn to run programs can't beat it.

This location would have received a higher rating from me a week ago but after my last visit there, forget about it. The cashier was rude and argumentative and chose to fight with us at checkout rather than help us. She was very condescending and lacked the skills to work in customer service. We filed a formal complaint with their head office and yet to hear back from them. Every other time we've been there we had not had any problems. However with this last experience, we will be going to the Whitby or Markham locations instead. Not worth going to deal with angry cashiers that prefer to sass customers rather than help them.

Veal sandwich was good although the veal was pretty thin.  Good bun though, not too hard and was fresh.  Good assortment of toppings.
Beef arancini was also good but huge and very filling,  it could be a meal on it's own.

Mary and Kent are absolute super stars!!! They took our uniforms at the last minute and committed to getting them done in a quick turn around.  Not only that, they made them impeccably clean and organized.  Whenever I am in the Ajax area, I will only go to them to get dry cleaning done. Great service, great results and great people!

Very strange Harvey's/ Swiss Chalet.  You can't see or find any sign of the Harvey's in the parking lot or front entrance of the Swiss Chalet.  Only from Taunton Road.  

Service was good, burgers are just okay.   Not a big fan of Harvey's anyways.  This was a stop of convenience.  Burger patties always taste like there is a lot of filler in them.  Non meat like texture to it.  Fries okay.  

Probably won't have another Harvey's for another year.

Jerk Oxtails and Jerk Chicken dinners were both delicious. The chicken sauce  being a bit ' dry ' compared to the sauce administered to the Oxtails , but still very tasty nonetheless.  Dumplings were huge and filling.  Small diner with what seemed like young, hard-working people running the place. It was a nice, random  stop for me. I'd go back.
Love the coffee, desserts and food!! Staff is great too. Awesome Portuguese bakery in Ajax.

I have had a lot of mixed experiences at Swiss Chalet.  For example the location at Kingston Road/Brock in Pickering should be shut down.  Howevet this location in Ajax is great.  It is what you expect from Swiss, nothing special, but unlike others it is consistently good.  Takeout is fast and the servers in the dining room are attentive.  If you want a good lunch that is fairly quick, this is the best spot.

Mark is amazing, he is beyond knowledgeable and makes every experience extremely easy. After dealing with a lot of different shops with all the vehicles I've owned, you can tell mark is one of a kind. Never felt so at ease leaving my car with someone so honest and trustworthy. Will always be coming here !

I am a vietnamese food junkie.  I know viet food. Trust me when i say this is the ONLY hardcore vietnamese restaurant in Ajax. Everything here tastes homemade and authentic. You know why?  Because the owners and cook are vietnamese - not chinese like most gta vietnamese locations. And they are vietnamese who can cook!!  The pho broth is clean and void of msg overload.  I can drink the broth no problem. 

I work in toronto. In toronto i only go to 2 places for good pho and rice dishes. For pho its pho tien thanh;  for rice dishes its pho linh. 

This place has both good pho and rice dishes!  Moving to Ajax comes with its ups and downs. But this place is the hidden gem in ajax - where the restaurant scene is crowded by south asian, Caribbean and Afghanistan oriented cuisine.

We love it here and its our only choice for vietnamese food even though we live next door to pho metro (crap).
Small but a very cozy place.  The workers were super helpful, friendly and provided excellent service.  Just felt like to stay longer with my awesome iced coffee!

Hair in my soup once, shame on you.

Hair in my soup twice, shame on me.

I used to love this place for its reliably tasty pho. But then it came under new ownership and everything went downhill. 

Since I work three minutes away from here, I even gave it several chances. But they messed up my order a bunch of times, and on at least one occasion I had to leave hungry because it took too long to bring me the correct order...I had to run back to work. Anyway, the second time I found a hair in my food??? PEACE OUT. Never again.

Visited this place today for lunch. The portions are good for the price and the food is fresh. We both had the beef noodle soup with rare beef, brisket and meatballs and it was good but the broth was a little on the salty side. The springroll was also crispy and big. Would come back here again and probably try the beef stew with rice noodle.
fish was raw when came home from takeout!!!hope we don't get sick. grrr....we did get sick ....phoned them no one answers....great service

Efficient, prompt and very friendly service! Aside from regular dry cleaning, they also look after delicate materials and apparel that require special attention such as UGG boots, wedding dresses, winter jackets, etc. 

In house, they offer an array of repairs and alterations services if your clothes are damaged, suits and dresses don't fit right, etc. Mary does a great job! She's quick and I can't even tell where the hole in my sweater use to be! 

They seem to have a huge number of regulars that always look happy visiting the dry cleaners. I'd definitely come here if you're looking for professional dry cleaning/alterations services!

Best Italian restaurant in the Pickering/Ajax area!
Their coffee tastes just like coffee should. The food here is unbelievable... desserts and pastas... Whatever you chose, you can't go wrong. The owner here really knows how to treat his customers.

At a family gathering we stopped in to pick up dessert along the way in Ajax.  I didn't go in so can only comment on the take out items in the store.

Nova Era is a European bakery that specialises more towards Portuguese desserts with several locations across the GTA.

We had several items including custard pudding, almond tarts and of course traditional Portuguese eggs tarts.

They were all very good, on the sweeter side but not too sweet where you would go into a diabetic coma:).  The shell of the egg tarts were crispy and flaky which contrasted well with the soft egg custard filling.  No wonder why they are the most popular item in Portuguese desserts!

Overall a very good option especially considering there's not a lot of specialty bakeries in the Durham region.  Will definitely come again if we are in the area.

The Sri Lankan food here is delicious!!The added bonus is that they have a lot of snacks, frozen food options that you can pick up for later. The restaurant is very clean with excellent restrooms and attentive staff.
amazing food! love the yellow thin noodles and the mutton rolls

we did take out our first visit and we were very pleased with our meal.  The spring rolls were huge and tasty and we both had the  soup small well done beef  with rice noodles, Very good.  A must try if you like Vietnamese food.
Awesome place. They changed up the management and they new people are so nice. The food is also amazing as well. The fried rice is just too good!!!!

I really like the new menu. It's a great mix of comfort food with carribbean flavours. The pricing is average considering the smaller portion sizes. 

The homemade beef patties are very tasty but more fatty than other brands. The lobster doubles are made with a very nice crunchy flatbread with a tasty curry however don't expect to get more than a few small bits of lobster. The jerk shrimp Mac and cheese was very unique; it's creamy and rich with a bit of jerk heat (but disappointingly it's cooked with tiny low Grade shrimps). The jerk chicken was authentic with a great smoky grill flavour. The rice and peas were a bit dry. 

Overall, I would recommend this place for quick casual dine-in or take-out.

I had an awful experience at Canadian Tire Ajax on News Years Eve.  I needed a new battery.  I realized it was going to be busy.  I realized that there were a lot of people that needed new batteries so I might be out of luck.

After having one employee visually check stock to ensure the battery I needed was in stock, I agreed to the work.

Over an hour later they called me and said that the battery I needed was not in stock.  I was so angry when I left that store.  

I did complain to the Auto Department Manager, and he went above and beyond to ensure that I was treated fairly.  The solution that Canadian Tire agreed to was exactly what I had requested.

Rice balls and marinara sauce very tasty, although would have preferred a higher filling to rice ratio.  However, contrary to the experiences of some other reviewers, I felt about as far from family as you could get. When I asked about which arancini they had, the counter staff member went through the whole list on the board.  However, when I tried to order, her fellow staff member snapped at me that they only had a couple of the options... which was the point of my original question. They seemed very defensive about the fact that, because they are freshly made, only a subset of the fillings will be available at any given time. That's fine with me.  I just don't appreciate being snapped at.

This place is a hidden gem!  No frills, friendly service, and delicious homemade food.  The owner takes great pride in serving large quantities of freshly prepared food.  Not as fast or cheap as McD's but way better quality food and bigger quantity; made with care by adults who have been working there for years.  Texas Burger makes delicious souvlaki, burgers, and fries, and there are several other menu items I have yet to try. A lot of regulars go here for a reason, and I think they deserve more recognition and visits by first timers.
Food is good for Ajax Sri Lankan eats. Rolls and biriyani are the best. Also sell a huge variety of frozen foods for out of towners.
My girlfriend got me a beef wrap roti from here and let me tell you it was just like being back home in Trinidad. Excellent. Can't wait to have some more.
Decent food but this place has never been cleaned.  This place needs a major cleaning job!   Seriously

We love coming here for any food or supplies. The service is always great! Staff is very friendly and helpful. For a smaller sized store they are packed with everything a big store ands more! They also have great clearance events and sales that address specific to the location!

Husband got the burger said was great and I got the grilled chicken sandwich .they don't have whole wheat buns so they used whole wheat bread . The chicken in have to say was rubbery and made me a bit ill. I was a bit upset because I am thinking that was not what I expected. I will try a burger when we do take out next but I am a bit wary now :-(

WARNING!!! This is by far the worst Mediterranean food I have ever had in my life. I paid $40 for a chicken Swarma sandwich, Kafta sandwich, babaganoush and a fatush salad. Every dish was horrible. I recently moved to the east end from Mississauga and wanted to find a restaurant that could compete with a Mediterranean restaurant i use to go to a lot in the west. My search continues. If someone is reading this review and is ever in Mississauga go to a place called Monforts at Dundas and Hurontario. Also if anyone knows of a good Mediterranean restaurant in the Durham region please let me know of it. And again I warn people not to waste their money at the Mazza restaurant in Ajax!!!
Can never go wrong with Texas burger. The best spot in Ajax for a chicken souvlaki by far.  can't thank them enough for all there support as well.
everyone took the cupcakes, some fought over the red velvet. the boxes were perfect for the baby shower  and best of all...the price was reasonable.
Great Arabian nights. They have "set menus" on Saturday nights, which they keep providing food to your table till 3 am. Live music and belly dancing are there every Saturday nights and are amazing.
This is a new location in Ajax. Company has been around for a while...I've tried different pastries here and it's okay. Not the greatest. Fast service and friendly people overall.

I love this place, everything is 10/10 for quality and very reasonable prices. Friendly staff, always a pleasant visit to a great place where you know that you're supporting local businesses and everything is local and fresh! I always feel good leaving this place :)
I LOVE THIS PLACE! the tarts are simply AMAZING! A lot of pastries and dessert... all of them are really fresh and delicious...

Great little Portuguese bakery, nice to have one here since we came from downtown and hey were everywhere. The breads are always good and the desserts are so so so GOOD! A bit on the too sweet side but that's what dessert's all about. The only downside is the service. It's a hit or miss.....there's a couple of young girls that work the counter that seem unhappy when they work. But at least the baked goods make up for it.

I have been to several upscale salons, but have never been able to find a stylist that I am happy with...  I have recently visited this salon to see a hairstylist named Pinky as recommended by a friend.  The end result is that I am HOOKED and in LOVE!  She is absolutely amazing!  I am more than thrilled with her expertise and my new look.  She is just simply incredible and her main concern is YOU!

If you're in the mood for delicious SAMOSAS! this is the spot. 4 for $1 veggie. Crisp with delicious (bit spicy) filling.  They also have a large selection of prepared south Indian food. The Masala Dosa is also delicious, but you need to pre order.

What is up with all the grumpy faces? Every time im in there, its bland attitudes as if im inconveniencing them to get me a simply pastry. No one has ever smiled at me and ive been coming there to get treats for at least 2 years. Finally today i decided to write a review to not only inform the customer but to let the staff know that perhaps a smile and a welcoming attitude would make their business  even better. The pastries are amazing but i always eat them while complaining about the crappy service. Thanks for the great treats.

I have to say, I'm basing this rating on my last visit. Typically I go to Texas Burger for their Gyros dinner which is great but this time, I had a two-for-one coupon for an actual Texas Burger (with the purchase of fries and a drink) so I figured I'd give it a shot. The meal still came to $14.00. Turns out, a Texas Burger is over $7.00!!... are you kidding me?  For what? As you can see from the picture attached, it's nothing special. Boring in fact. I don't get it... and I certainly will never order one again. And where's my huge helping of fries that the previous reviewer seems to get?  :(

I will say though, the service is always friendly at this place (although the lady behind the cash wasn't being all that friendly to the young lad she was training) and the other food I've had here has always been good... I just don't recommend coming here for their burgers.

If I was rating them on their Gyros, it would probably be a 3 star but everything during this last experience was just... meh.

Went to this place on a whim and SO glad I did! This place is clean, the staff are friendly and the food is AMAZING!! The vegan meatballs are the best I have ever had! My fiance got the coconut shrimp and the crispy cod and he said it was by far the best coconut shrimp he's ever tasted. Crispy cod was delicious. Went back again last week and tried the jerk mac and cheese and the jerk chicken dumpling. Unreal! Everything tastes so homemade. Will definitely be back!

First off, we purchased our Acura TSX from Jim, one of the salesman there.  Excellent experience.  If this review was based solely on our experience with Jim, it would be 5 stars.

However, I am reviewing their service department, as we, wanting to be loyal to the dealership we had a great sales experience with, decided to bring our vehicle in for the regular maintenance it requires.  Despite living in Markham right near Markham, Acura and working Downtown, close to Downtown, Acura we chose to make the drive out to Acura East.

From the first service we should have known not to return.  The useless "service advisor" did not have our appointment noted despite us calling to confirm it with her the day before.  We had asked for the day use of vehicle, which we were told we would get - she again said that this is not possible and she had no record of the request.  An hour later, given a rental from Enterprise, we were on our way, with a promise from her the 'service advisor' to call us upon the car being ready.  It was estimated to be a two hour job.  We call after about 3 hours.  No answer.  Finally we get through 4 hours later and she says 'ooops, my bad, your car has been ready since two hours ago...I forgot to call you".  

What?? How can this even happen?  She was very casual about it and shrugged it off when we arrived there.  We had asked for an accessory to be fixed onto the interior of the trunk, this wasn't done.  She hadn't even communicated this to the mechanic, despite us asking the shop rate for them to affix it and telling them to add that to our total.

THEN...one day after this service, we notice the same issue wrong with the car.  We go back and have much the same run-around.  All errors point to the doorknob Amina working the front desk.  She "advises" people incorrectly, telling all customers to 'save their money' and not get this or that repair done now, but to come in later for it despite us repeatedly telling her its not about saving money for us, but for our car to be maintained.  A dealership turning away service???  I know, hard to believe, but go to Acura East and talk to Amina and you will find she is SO knowledgeable about everything and can just advise you about your vehicle without once looking under the hood.

The service manager is apparently the 3rd one in 6 months and after speaking with him I can foresee a fourth one coming soon.  Passing the buck, making excuses and shoddy service.  

SO..  Go to Acura East for car repairs if:

A) you have heaps of time to waste making 3+ visits for one service repair to be done correctly

B) you love showing up for CONFIRMED and VERIFIED appointments that you have taken a day off of work for that the person at the front desk has no record of ( despite the followup appt being made IN PERSON and TO HER...Amina this is once again the typically shoddy work of you)

C) You hate or are 'over' your car as after an experience with these people you'd feel you're better off ramming right off a cliff.

My boyfriend and I were thoroughly unimpressed with the grooming services at this PetSmart location. After taking our pup on his first hike, we thought we would take advantage of this coupon we had for a free puppy bath at PetSmart that we got from the PetSmart Puppy Guide. The puppy bath is advertised "For puppies who need just a bath to maintain a healthy-looking coat. Plus, our pet-loving stylists help get puppy comfortable visiting the salon." But sadly we cannot say our Echko had a pleasant experience.

First of all, we were kind of skeptical because we could not see the puppy bath. It is hidden in the back of the grooming area behind a door of the "employees only" area. It seems the big window with all the dogs getting groomed is only if you are getting your dog trimmed/shaved. When we dropped him off, we were told that the puppy bath would take about an hour. We were fine with that (actually, we were expecting that), because the puppy bath experience offers a bath & blow dry, 15-minute brushing, nail trim, ear cleaning/hair removal/flushing, scissor feet/pad shaving, sanitary trim, and anal glands cleaning. After an hour of browsing through the store waiting for our pup, we decided to just wait in the waiting area of the grooming corner of the store. No grooming staff was to be found at the front desk for 15 minutes. Another gentleman who was picking up his dog had to talk to 3 associates of the store before they got one of the grooming staff to the front desk to finally pick up his dog. It was then we were told that Echko would be another 30-45 minutes because his groomer, Brooke, went on break and "he just needs to be dried still". My boyfriend and I were pretty confused because all we could imagine was our just-bathed puppy, still wet, waiting for this unprofessional groomer to go on break. That isn't the worst part, though. 

So we continue to wait in the waiting area, see her come back from her break, and hope since he just needs to be dried, it won't be much longer. Turns out we ended up waiting a maximum of an hour from when the staff member at the front desk informed us the groomer went on break mid-bath session. While we waited, we could hear Echko screaming from the back. We originally thought it was just him howling at other dogs and playing, but now we're not so sure because what is to follow. When we FINALLY got to see him, the groomer made us pay for the bath before letting us inspect him. Luckily for us, we didn't pay a dime and had a coupon. When we finally got him, he had tear stains under his eyes on the fur of his face, he ran right to us, and then towards the big window, thinking it was outside. It was as if he just wanted to leave immediately. The groomer said nothing else other than "he was a good boy, very sweet. I hope you like it!"

It wasn't until we got to the car when we had the opportunity to inspect him thoroughly. It turns out, the groomer failed to notify us that she cut his nails too short, cutting the quick, causing many of them to bleed. The fur around his paws were covered in blood and the nails that were quicked were red, bloody, and scabby. I understand accidents happen sometimes, especially with dark coloured nails, but all of the nails that she quicked were clear. She also didn't touch the back nails at all and only cut the front nails, for some reason, even though there were many long nails on his back legs. 

My concern is that she pushed us to pay before we could pick him up (even though the gentleman before us was allowed to pick up his dog before paying), she tried to convince us to re-book before giving us the opportunity to inspect him, then failed to take responsibility for her actions by failing to tell us she quicked the nails.

Not impressed at all and would NEVER recommend PetSmart's Grooming Services to any friends or family. Clearly she was unprofessional, undertrained, and more concerned with commission (if they get any) than caring for my dog.

It's so hard to find good asian cuisine in Ajax when you're only there once a week and there's not as much heavy Yelp action, but this place came with some great reviews, and we gave it a shot.

We ordered a pho soup noodles with rare beef and beef balls. They actually missed the meat and ended up cooking some extra for my boyfriend which was very kind of her :) I ordered the bun. I like the grilled/ bbq meat with the vermicelli swimming in veggies and sauce. It was a great balance of flavours and generous portions at a decent price. 

Usually, I grab an avocado milk shake along with my meal, but we decided to try their lemon soda. I'm not sure what she puts in it for sweetener, but this is absolutely the most delicious lemon soda I've had. I let her know how much I loved it and she proudly let me know that it's a customer favourite. :) Don't forget to try it out if you get a chance to swing by. 

This place is rather small, seating just a few tables at a time, but service is quick and the over all dining experience is pleasant. In and out within 30-45 minutes. It's a solid vietnamese location that I'll definitely be swinging by again soon!

We were in town for a wedding and were looking for a local, healthy grocery store. MacMillan Orchards fit the bill - great food and friendly service. I love the array of fresh local fruits and vegetables and unique frozen foods that you can heat at home - pies, quiches, etc.! What a wonderful family store. If we lived here we would visit more often!! The owner is fantastic and very responsive. Would recommend!!

The meals here are cheap, $10 or less taxes included. The food tastes pretty good (rice, pork chop, chicken, fried egg, veggies) for about $7.50 before taxes. Portion to price ratio is good, give you a bit of everything but not too much or too less. Tastes like homemade food, no complaints. Better than average food for better pricing than most places.

I tried Taste of T & T for the first time today and it was amazing! I got the regular size jerk chicken dinner, which came with a choice of rice & beans or a roti, and what I believe to be curried potatoes. I love jerk chicken and get it with rice and beans every time, but the curried potatoes is something i'd never had before and it was delicious! Portions are about average for jerk chicken dinners and it included 4 pieces of chicken. I'm not even finished eating but I wanted to come online and tell you all how great the food is! (I also wanted to give my mouth a rest from the heat :p ). Anyways, definitely a great place to check out if you like Caribbean food! I'll definitely be going back!!

We went there with 2 other family , the food were nice , the surprise when the bill came he charged a flat charge of 30$ per person and this isn't a open buffet but more like a set menu of arabic mezza and grills not only this they charged all children above 6 yrs full price !!!!! . Cut a story short it is a rip off never will go back there . Don't recommend at all

This place is great! In addition to what you'd expect from an orchard such as well, fruit, they also have a range of prepared frozen foods that are delish. For a quick easy meal, I particularly enjoy their quiches. 

If you happen to be in the hood, it's worth it to pop in and check it out.
BEST breakfast in Ajax. The food is always good, and I love the fresh fruit that comes with the breakfast. Their home fries have a nice bit of flavour to them. This place has not equal.

best bakery i have been too...i come all the way from toronto just for the nata's and the sugar dusted donuts

the water bread is amazing too

This evening I went to the take out counter at 8pm.  I ordered a 1/4 chicken with fries and a extra bun. The cook in the kitchen had a flossing pick in his mouth. Taking it out of his mouth playing with it putting it back in and making our food. I asked the girl at the counter to eat the bun he had put in a bag after playing with his flossing pick. She wouldn't eat it? Let me tell you I don't want it either. She didn't offer to exchange my bun nor my order. I'm so disgusted right now.  I made sure the other guest heard what I thought of this. No supervisors overlooking what's going on?!? All I have to say is yuck!!

Highly recommend a visit here. Great specialty coffees. Friendly staff. Lots of other stuff on the menu that I am eager to try. A guy next to me was eating one of the pizzas. Looked great! I had an Americano=delicious. Great atmosphere. This place has it together.

Every time I come to this location is okay I guess until one day my husband and I walked in and got tricked into applying for a Canadian tire MasterCard. The employee kept on calling the card a points card and did not disclose that it was a credit card. We were offered to apply for a points card that you can earn points to get a discount on gas. Right after I notice it was a credit card we immediately called master card and got it canceled.

They seem to be out of stock of things like egg bread often. Can't be bothered to stop and check if they have what I need anymore; most times it's a waste of my time because I go there for something and have to walk away empty handed.

Just as I thought. Facility looked amazing when new and still looks nice but now the maintenance issues are starting to show. 

I knew there was going to be a problem when i saw those small tiles in the hot tub. Below the waterline is fine but they forgot about above the water line. Grout is mouldy and you can scrape a thick layer of dirt around the rim ( from sweat and creams/ dirt) which covers about two rows of tiles in dirt because people don't shower before entering pool area. It is really nasty actually. There are cleaners for this that will not affect the quality of water. Maintenance seems good for facility but it doesn't look like they know how to keep the Spas clean. Why the small tiles? I bet staff gave up cause it is so hard to clean that endless grout on your knees. Hope you guys clean it soon. People spending 100 a month to rub their back in this filth ewww !!! 

If you don't believe me check it out for yourself. Make sure you point it out to them while on tour ; this company is very interested in new money because they probably need a higher membership base in order to remain viable.

Have driven by this spot a few times. My wife always had said no to going in, let's be honest the place needs to be renovated. 

Online reviews looked great but now I'm sceptical about the authenticity of the reviews.

What I tried 10oz Texas burger with a pouting and a small drink - $26 after taxes. Not worth the price.

The burger is dry and lacks flavour. Needs some herbs and spices to make it better.

The fries taste like McCain fries that aren't crispy. The poutine gravy was the saving grace but as a whole was lack luster.

My search for the best burger in Durham continues. Retro Burger still holds top spot for taste and value for burgers and poutine.

This Swiss Chalet has consistent food quality. 

Sometimes I order takeout from here and sometime we dine in. Dining-in is child-friendly and the food portions are always larger then they are with takeaway. 

The servers are generally very nice. 

I highly recommend the new fried chicken on their menu - if you like fried chicken. It's pretty good.

Clean restaurant right off Taunton - perfect for after work pick-up. Now they have salad bowls with choice of topping just made it better. Always love Harvey's made to order burgers. Now even better w choices of salad, rice or fries. But the best part is the service - hard working young people that are polite and helpful. Win!

After my experience here im absolutely done with big box commercial gyms, equipment here is the same as any other commercial gym, and all of their decent bars and platforms are taken on weekdays from 7 to 8 by their stupid crossfit class.

Very tasty....tried the boneless jerk chicken roti, a chicken roti and doubles. 

Everything was very tasty and flavourful. Large portions and I felt the price very reasonable for authentic, home-cooked style food. 

Ordering/payment process could use some tweaking as there was a lot of confusion and a somewhat long wait for food. Speaking with other patrons who are regulars, this is apparently a constant occurrence.

I've been coming to Texas Burger since I was a kid. I LOVE their tasty burgers and fries. Always a huge helping of fried. I have recently developed a food allergy, and the owner has personally taken care of my needs. Amazing family owned place.

We recently discovered this place and are so happy we did! Such friendly people! The samosas are 4/$1!! And they're so good, not too greasy which is awesome. We recently tried one of their combo meals and it was great. You get so much food for $6-8!

Looking forward to trying more!

Delicious selection of Sri Lankan foods. Very friendly staff. Bonus - you can eat in, as there is a seating area; cafeteria style. 

Noodles, rice dishes, rolls, samosas, rotis - and so much more. Love their stronghoppers and pol sambol

As a Sri Lankan I can attest this place is the real deal!

This place rocks! The staff are always incredibly friendly and welcoming and the place itself is clean and well kept. This is my GO TO Pho joint in Ajax and I pick up food from them at least once a week. If you're craving some good traditional Pho, 10/10 recommend!

Food: for the area thenfood here is pretty decent the broth and the ingredients in the pho seems to be simplified. There are only three things that can go in the pho, rare beef, beef flank, and beef balls. Although the broth tasted toned down the overall flavour was decent. The rice dish was typical of any other viet restaurant. 

Service: the service was friendly the lady that served us was always smiling and is very
 nice.

Atmosphere: this is a typical family ran Asian restauramt. It is small but cozy. 

Overall: all in all this restaurant is decent for the area and would go there again. It definitely satisfied my phone craving.

Best roti and doubles that I have ever tasted, but the service could be faster. I often call ahead and yet still have to wait up to 15 min for my order when I get there, but still this is my favourite Roti place in Ajax!

I came up to Whitby to visit my mom and sister . I am a lifetime member for a long time - as a diamond member, I have the privilege to use other clubs. The one in Ajax is fantastic!! Great selection of equipment, clean facilities and very pleasant staff - thanks

If you want light and flavorful pho, this place is the best in the Durham area. I would even say that this little mom and pop shop is one of my top pho places, and I'm from Markham. Their small bowls is the medium size of other restaurants. The flank was top quality meat and not the cheap cut and frozen type. Honestly, I had a nose congestion when i was eating thepho and I was able to taste the yumminest from the broth!
Love the food here! There samosas are by far the best! There is usually a line up on weekends but it goes pretty fast and definitely worth the wait

Hit and miss but mostly hit.   Seems to be a popular place for sandwiches and such but I've never had that.  I've had the breads and pastries and the breads are always good.  The pastries though are hit and miss.  The Nata's are amazing... always great.   Had a napoleon once and it was quite good.. went back a few weeks later and it was filled with chocolate instead of custard.  Then a week or so I was in there picking up a few things and my creme horn had a hunk of lettuce in it.  That's put me off the place a bit.

Best place for Caribbean food ever! The best doubles ever! ... staff is so nice! ... the pepper sauce is the best!
My favourite place.

This place is just an awful place to eat. I bought the shish kabab meal. Paid. 23.50 for about 2 oz of meat (tasted rancid) it came with a spoon of rice and a salad that was worse then the meat. I threw the food in the garbage and made my way to maimanna in ajax. I have never been so displeased.

I have been a member at this location for about 2 months now and I can safely say that no other gym can touch Life Time and what their facilities offer.

Is it costlier than other gyms? Yes, but pictures and reviews alone don't do the place justice so please go see the facilities for yourself so that you can appreciate what your membership fees are going towards. 

Fresh towels, change rooms stocked with complimentary toiletries, locks built into lockers, tons of equipment that is always available, indoor AND outdoor pool, spa, cafe, basketball court, soccer pitch, boxing, spin and a bunch of others I'm likely even forgetting.

There isn't a single thing that I can think of that I would add to this gym.

This is a hole in the wall burger joint. They also have Greek food. Their burgers are okay - definitely not my favourite and their prices are outrageously expensive. We had a buy one , get one free burger when you purchase a fry and a pop and the total came to 16$ with a gravy? No thanks. I would rather go to Harvey's. Staff is also indifferent to their customers and or on the rude side. This place also only takes cash so if you have a card you have to use the ATM inside which charges.

First time here. Had the 10oz homemade burger....amazing!!! Juicy and very tasty. Definitely worth it. The owner is just a really nice guy.  Very friendly and had a nice convo with him. Will be back soon!

I ordered my wedding cupcakes and cake from this lovely dessert bakery.  They delivered it to my reception on time and even provided large take away boxes for us to take home any left overs at the end of the night.  We ordered a few different flavors and each of them was delicious.  My only complaint was that the price we paid was too much for the finished product.  The cake was decorated beautifully but the cupcake decorations were really boring and not what I was expecting. I wanted a little variety with the cupcake decorations but I didn't get that.  I would definitely recommend them but be very clear with what you want so there are no surprises (which is good practice with all businesses you deal with for your wedding)

Had the veal sandwich. The taste of the sauce & bun was good, although as already mentioned the veal is SO thin! They take "flattening the cutlet" to the next level, which essentially leave you with breading between bread... 
I would definitely try this place again for the arancini, because it's cute and clean inside!

I have gone to this location several times.  Upon each visit the ladies working there are friendly and welcoming.  I went with a friend who hasn't had Indian food before and they suggested some good options after asking some questions about his spice tolerance.  They provide huge portions and unlike some other Indian food joints, the cooking oil in the food is at a minimum.  Great prices, huge portions, tasty food, and friendly service combine to make an amazing place.  For $10 (which includes a drink), you'll be full all day after having rice and two curries! :)

If you are middle eastern, then the food here will make you feel like it was flown from back home. There is a buffet available during Ramadan. At night there is a band and a dance floor so you can burn off all the food you ate!  To top it all off, they even have shisha that can be brought right to our table while you eat! It is truly a place to just relax and eat good food with good people.

Better location then the Scarborough location, much cleaner...but for some reason the food tastes better at the Scarborough location. The Ajax location has a  nice place to sit if you want to stay and eat. If the go at their peak periods be prepared to wait a bit in the line. Prices and the amount of food per order can't be beat!

Entertainment fab! Food not so fab.

Makes for a good group experience, as the whole place is 'on theme' with the decor, food, music & shisha. Sort of felt I was crashing a (very small) middle eastern wedding reception as the staff appeared to be close family, everyone knew the music and were generally in good spirits.

Went on a Sat for the live music & set menu  @$40 (Shisha $20). Music began at 10pm and they were just fantastic! They played all night, even while the belly dancer performed - also brilliant and entertaining to watch - she used the whole dance floor so everybody could see. 5*

For some reason the food is not great, which doesn't match the venue! While the spread was impressive, most of the 12 apps/snacks  and even the mains were under-seasoned or just lacking in flavour - potatoes, cauliflower, tabbouleh, felafel, sausages - meh. I did enjoy the kibbeh (raw seasoned beef), along with the baba ganoush, but would have much preferred 2-4 well made apps. 

The last main dish - chicken & beef kebabs - FINALLY, were tasty and tender. I wish this was served earlier when we were hungry instead of at 12.30am & full-but-not-satisfied! I'm torn between rating a 5* night based on 2-3* food. Considering this, it is an expensive night.

I hope they improve the menu because the rest of the experience was great, and I'd like to return for more.
Mark is the best mechanic I have ever used. Only does what is necessary and at a very reasonable price!  I would highly recommend his service.

I should add a little flavour to my review.  This is my favourite store based on reasonable freshness, lots of variety, and I feel they have the best value in Ajax.  You will save some money here over other stores....

I can't lie.  Possibly the strongest reason I come here is because I like riding grocery carts as a grown man!  haha so if you see a man with sunglasses riding his cart to his car summer or winter, that would be me :)

The place has the best shopping carts and a slight slope to its parking lot.  I like to park my car at the back, take some running bobsled steps and sllllliiiiddeee my way to my car!   Yippie!!!!!

**** Please don't try this I have been riding carts since I was a kid :) 

Enjoy! :-)

Running Free wins time and time again.  Such a knowledgeable staff and value add running store.  
In preparation for my first marathon in May I decided to pay a visit to the newly opened Running Free in Ajax(Pickering Village). In my past visits to Running Free in Markham they always provide a great selection for anything to do with running.
I was specifically looking for a water belt.  i was looking at a specific style when one of the owners came up and started asking questions about my next run.  Their was two types of water belts and I tried on both at his request. For anyone looking to do long distance runs and require a water belt, the Nathan brand is the one you want for the simple fact it is easier to get the bottles back in the belt after taking a drink.  The other brand would have been a nightmare to get the bottles back in the belt.  For those of you who run can understand when you are huffing and puffing while trying to put your bottle back in a belt, if the bottle doesn't slide in easliy, it can be frustrating and a distraction.
Also, Running Free offers a variety of free running clinics throughout the week for many running levels and sometimes are sponsored by running sho brands or other brands wanting to market themselves on a local level.  Last week shoe brand, Mizuno, allowed runners to try their running shoes during the running clinic.  This week, Gu, an energy gel company will be giving a talk and providing free samples.
Running Free does an amazing job adding value.

Wow..... joining the circus? Want answers to you medical needs...go somewhere else.
If you have people who are called Dr's you would assume you have some reassurance that they know what's going on...not here...
An emotional roller-coaster of a ride where maybe's as a diagnosis and I'll get back to you...4 days later seems to be the moto here....
Ask your ambulance attendant to take you somewhere else....
God Bless!!!

If you are in the market for expired goods than this is your place.
Many times have seen products on the shelves that are past the Best Before date.

The only thing worse is the lack of restocking.
Weeks go by where products are not in store, especially their house brand PC.

I will say the only positive is the staff seem helpful and I haven't had too many issues with them in the 6 years I have shopped there.

Best doubles and rotis in Ajax. I used to go to drupatis and kiskedee but not anymore (sorry not sorry). This place is much cleaner and serves was tastier and less greasy food. The staff is also very friendly and willing to answer any questions you might have. 
I've only ordered takeout roti but they also have specials on plates and sweets.

I love my Acura MDX. Honda builds a great car, but their Acura dealer service network is left wanting. Paid $60.00 for an oil change that costs $35.00 at a local Honda dealer - the same materials too! Booked a full service & asked for a detail. When I got there I had to find someone to take my car, they were not on their game. Then I read a sign that said if you booked a detailing you get a replacement car - no one told me that when booking the service or when I brought it in. After the service pick up I asked why I was not told and the employee indicated that it was on a first come first serve basis. I asked the surveyor (post service follow up) to have some one call me regarding my concerns - no one did! I will not go to a Honda dealer for service from now on.

This caribbean fusion style restaursnt was very unique, upbeat and clean. What set it apart from the other places around town was the very affordable prices, the menu wasn't over crowded and it had nice caribbean canadian blend.

I tried the jerk shrimp mac N chz with a jerk and oxtail dumplin and my only regret was not sitting in to enjoy the full experience. And to top it off the owners are very welcoming. I will definitely be recommending this place.

I went here for the first time today and their doubles are pretty good! Only thing I really have to say is the place is A bit expensive! Their doubles was $1.80 and all the rotis were over $10 some people could walk out there spending minimum $20 or more if you order something big but I think it taste pretty good I'll go back there and try the roti and see if it's worth the price. I'll definitely come back and buy the doubles when I'm feeling hungry and I want a little snack!

Expensive but sometimes a few bucks less than Sportchek. 

The real difference here is that the staff are very informed and helpful.
Large selection of stuff too despite the small size of the store.

As others mentioned, this is literally a whole in a wall. The plaza parking is always full at night thanks to the bar in the middle. 
The food is decently priced. The menu was simple. We've ordered their rice platters combo and a side order of spring rolls. The spring roll and chicken was tasty. My only complaint is  the pork chop, it's so thin compare to other viet places. It's as thin as sliced cheese. 
Will come back for sure but I'd probably not get the pork chop again.

This is a hidden gem. Has been open for a few months and it seems like they have it together. The pastas and homemade pizza are simply delicious. They also have a hot table during the week which serves up stuffed peppers, chicken parm, eggplant parm, steamed veggies etc. The veal on a bun is my favourite on the entire menu. 

This place is clean and friendly. There is wifi and of course COFFEE! Fresh ground specialty coffee and a wide selection of desserts makes this restaurant a favourite.

I would recommend trying this place at least once and make up your own mind.

Called and placed an order for pickup and was told they would be open until 7pm. Arrived at 5pm to a locked door. Called and asked why the door was locked and was told 'everyone decided to go home early.' 

You have customers placing orders and hours posted,  but decide to go home early. Horrible customer service.

I didn't realize this place is now under new ownership.  A big improvement from the previous owners.  Affordable prices and great portions.  With so few good Viet places in Durham, this place needs to stay in business.  I now endorse this place.   Pho was a good size with lots of meat.  A little too salty for my taste but I know many people will like it.  Fresh rolls were made FRESH, not premade like many other places.

They do not have authentic Indian style dosa's. They cater more to the Sri Lankan customers. The idllis are also not fresh, most of the times they are very hard and stale. The sambhar for the dosa is very thick which is not how it is supposed to be.

If your looking for great middle eastern food in Durham Region, then this is the place.

My review maybe a bit tainted because I have been spoiled eating at fantastic middle eastern restaurants in the Yonge/Steeles area, but with that said for Ajax and the surrounding Durham Region this place is good.

Decor- you can tell that the owners basically bought this place as is, and haven't changed the decor much from the previous Greek restaurant it use to be, but it works. The restaurant is airy and a good size, would have preferred listening to middle eastern music instead of having to watch NFL football on the big screen tv's it's a restaurant not a bar. But overall decor is good, but I did find it weird that all plates had "Woo" written on it, must have gotten a good deal ;)

Food- the food here was really good. I ordered the Mixed grill. Food was flavourful, didn't like the lentil soup or the bread ( seems store bought)

Service- the staff was professional and polite, made overall experience great

Overall I liked this place, for Ajax and Durham Region this place is good. But make sure to call ahead since it seems that Mazza has dancing/dj's on certain nights and if your want a quiet dinner you maybe surprised.
Tried many portugese egg tart bakeries in Toronto and this one is my favourite. It's only $1.25 per tart, and if you get 12, you don't pay tax.

***Review is based on takeout coffee/cannoli and whatever service that was required.***

I was in between showings and absolutely STARVING, so I decided to check out what bakery was nearby and Maraschino fit the bill!  

(It wasn't ultra-close, but there weren't that many listings for bakeries in the area.)

A 12oz coffee was $1.50 - the man behind the counter made a fresh pot - but it came out of a package.  That's fine, tasted ok.  So it's not a coffee connoisseur's paradise.  Had some time, so I also grabbed a small cannolo which was $2.  That was good too and tasted fresh with an actual ricotta - or at least a mix - filling.

Just as I was finishing, the man who served me brought out a homemade pizza and pasta to a neighbouring table.  It smelt really GOOD!  

It's a shame that I wasn't able to order actual food though 'cause it did smell and look great.  Next time, Ajax!

Pleasantly surprised by how good the food and service was, even on such a busy day as Father's Day. 

Had breakfast with a large group of family and still only took an hour in an out. 

The variety of what they offer is matched by the quality. Will be back next time we're in the area
Hands down the best Roti and Curry in the GTA. So flavourful not dry at all. The pepper sauce is actually spicy which I love! I always get extra. So amazing!

Awesomely delicious cupcakes. Not just the icing bit the cake has good flavor too. Our favorite is the smores cupcakes. They also have some beautiful cakes and cupcakes that can be ordered special for birthdays and such. Next time we go looking forward to trying the crepes.
Never a disappointment, our meals always come out pipping hot and the staff are amazing. Love your new crispy chicken - keep it on the menu!!!

I recently ordered a cake for a 25th anniversary party from Cupcakes Canada. Email correspondence was a little slow, but okay since I ordered about 3 weeks in advance.
