The attitudes were amazing of the employees, everything was made fresh and even though while paying, I thought it was a bit pricey for a coffee and sandwich, I have to say that the quality made it worth every single penny! The woman to made my sandwich even came over to check if it was to my liking, which it absolutely was! Will definitely revisit!
Omg no .. Cafeteria food at best red wine and water were the best .. Should hhave known 3 people in the whole place

Tried this 3 times, all takeout, hoping it would improve as I thought the menu sounded great. Service was fine, takeout orders were delivered reasonably quick.  I love Thai and Japanese food, but this style of fusion doesn't do justice to either cuisine.  The free Hawaii roll was also not to my taste.  Sadly, the fried foods (like Pad Thai) tasted of turned oil or perhaps had another dishes' flavor still in the pan, which I disliked.

After being recommended to visit this practice for my newborn son, for a neck condition called Torticollis, my husband and I felt that we were taken advantage of as new parents, in a very vulnerable time in our life trying to seek professional help for our newborn son. 

The audacity of these individuals to try and exploit a new parents' good intention for their newborn is shameful. If your newborn seems to have any type of issue, see your family doctor first, they are the professionals and will give you a referral to see a specialist. In our case, it's a physiotherapist, not a chiropractor.  Our doctor is confident that in a few sessions, the muscle will be stretched (with our efforts at home as well). 
This dr Tara Dhanasar wanted us to buy: 36 sessions, coming in 3 times a week for 4 months- for the cost of just under $2000. Absolutely nauseating.

Do yourself a favour and do not put yourself through the emotional grief and discomfort of going to this establishment to be scared and guilted into purchasing their services.
Stale food and unhygienic environmnet. Stay away even if it is free.

Durham region is quickly changing. The diversity and culture in this region is nice to see. With all that culture comes the food of course. 

On a Friday night, tired of the usual, decided to try this place. I have always had good experiences with other Afghan places , such as Bamiyan Kabob in Scarborough and Maimana Naan down the street. I love afghan food so it should be a win..win.

This place wasn't very business. It was clean and the decor was quite nice. I ordered the Beef & Chicken Kebab dinner. My wife ordered the Beef Seekh Kebab. The girl at the counter told us that one dinner wouldn't be enough for two people. We did want to share, but after hearing her advice we ordered two. Big mistake!!! Or a good mistake depending on how you might look at it.

The portions are huge!! But it was also very tasty, we ordered the dogh drink as well. It's a must have in a place like this.

All in all I can't complain, we will be back!

3 for the food + 1 for friendly service.

Came here tonight after finding this place on Yelp- and after calling to make sure they had enough "hock in stock."

For $24.99 the gigantic pork hock comes with choice of 2 sides: Home fries, red cabbage, creamy mixed veggies, sauerkraut, and spatzle .

One will serve 2 for sure! Maybe even 3...

Our waitress Karla was really friendly and attentive. She informed us that the pork hock is only served on weekends and the schnitzel special is on Thursdays and Fridays for $12.99.

The interior definitely adds to the cultural dining experience. Dated, but welcoming... one can see how this place has stood the test of time.
Flavourless pad Thai. Terrible. One of my favourite dishes and I had to force it down.

Food is simple (4/5), but healthy and very fresh.
But the service is amazing (5/5).  Food is delivered to your table in a prompt and very friendly manner.   Food is also removed from your table and service is always with a smile. 

Very family oriented spot in a super convenient location.

Amazinnnng food here.   The menu food is always hot and fresh and the staff are very informative on ingredients etc. The baked goods section is so enticing, I always have to ask about what each item is, and usually end up picking a few to take home.   Favorites are the cappuccino bars (when they have them!)

So I roll into Sobeys looking to pick up a roasted whole chicken for the family for dinner tonight.  Looked over the cooked chicken like an owl about to swoop down on its prey.  Choose one that I thought looked juicy and tender.  Pay for it and leave.  My mouth is watering on the car ride home.  It is lunch time so I decide, hey, why don't I make myself a nice chicken sandwich with some tomatos, cucumber, cheese and a healthy portion of guacamole. I'm about to cut myself a piece and what do you know...dry as bleepy bleep desert.  For all those who are and want to admit Chevy Chase and Vacation movie fans, remember in Christmas Vacation when Clark attempts to carve the turkey open at the family Christmas dinner and the turkey completely disenagrates...that is what lay before me.  Hence, I wolfed down my dry sandwich with mouthfuls of water.

Next time I'll stick with Loblaws

Panera is a nice spot to visit and fairly consistent across properties. This location is pretty big and I didn't find it to be busy when I visited so it was nice to enjoy a quiet meal. Service is great here and food is consistent.
I ordered the pick 2 option. 
I love their salads because they are always evenly dressed, not too light but not drenched in sauce.
The sandwich was not really enjoyable. I ordered the chicken avocado melt. There was hardly anything in the sandwich and the avocado were falling out. I liked the grill on the bread though

Honestly Panera is a nice place to go once in a while, but I think it's very much over priced for what you get. Never ever ever get take out because the portion sizes shrunk by a ridiculous amount!

This is my go to Afghan restaurant . The quality of  ingredients are excellent. Everything is made fresh to order and the portions are generous. I recommend the 5pcs tandoori chicken dinner. The meat is so tender and seasoned  perfectly.
The decor is very tasteful. Simple and clean. Place your order at the counter and seat yourself.

Came here for a girls night and was very disappointed.

We came for all you can eat and 1st of all the service was terrible, 2nd bathrooms were dirty.

The over the top to make me write this was a friend of mine ordered a roll and left one piece on her plate and they charged her for the whole roll! 

They also gave us a roll that tasted a bit off and when we told the waitress she said if we don't eat she will charge, after 10 minutes of arguing the manager came and said no charge after I said I just won't pay!

Took me on at very short notice (half an hour) and I was thoroughly pleased with my experience! Everyone at the salon was so friendly and welcoming. The salon itself is in a convenient location and the little boutique in the front is adorable, there were so many cute things! 

Can't remember my stylists name but she did a great job. Did exactly what I asked her to do! I will definitely return again in the future. 

I would 100% recommend this place to anyone!

Would not go back . Originally went in as a walk in , the lady who greeted me at the front( if you want to call
It that ) was extremely rude until she got me in the chair . Did a fill and and less than two weeks later my nail come cleanly off , no chip , no break , just falls cleanly off. I went back to get fill ( which was done well ) and less than a week after that , my nail snaps of while I'm putting something in the drawer . If you've been getting your nails done for years you know this is a sign of poor technique on behalf of the nail technician . I call to make an appointment to have the nail fixed and am told  " we don't do appointments for broken nails"  ok , I'll just come in . When I get in the shop the girl who greeted me tells me that she doesn't know how to fix my nail and the other lady "Is going to be busy for awhile " . I ask how long and get the same answer . Meanwhile the same lady who did my nails before is standing less than 5 feet away not making eye contact and talking to the other girl in Vietnamese with food in her hand , looking not busy at all . The other guy who worked there had apparently " went out for lunch " and they had no idea when he would be back . This a classic trick crappy nail salons use to not have to fix broken nails , giving you the run around till you leave . The bottom line is nails done properly don't break ,do yourself a favour and go somewhere else , i recommend ombré nails across the street , who fixed my broken nail for me .

I love this place for all my gluten free finds.  I go once a week usually and find many gf products at discounted prices.  But always  check the expry dates.  Though some items are frozen before they expire.  Almost Perfect has many locations in Durham and one in Toronto.

My phone crashed when it was submerged in water, and my charger, mic and speaker malfunctioned. Immediately I went to Fixtronics and he was able to fix my iPhone 6s  for a reasonable price in less than 2 hours. Very reliable, caught us off guard when it was a house, but this business is 100% legit and he knows what he's doing. Highly recommend.
No box office just machines, so bring your visa, cash not welcome... movie started at 510 and we were still waiting at 505 to get in, because they were cleaning...

The food was passable, but not great. 

The service was horrendous. With people at three tables, the waitress acted like she was being run off her feet. She got my food order wrong and, to top it off, she dropped the bill on our table without bothering to ask if we wanted dessert.

We will not be going back.
Staff is friendly, prices are fair and my drink is always made properly. A great place to study or go on a date.

Enjoyed a meal here with four others and it was delicious!  I've been to another location before and this, by far, had better atmosphere.  It's a large space with lots of tables and it was nice and bright.  It's perfect for large groups.  We ordered shrimps, mussels, king crab, and clams and enjoyed all of them as they were perfectly cooked.  The service was friendly and courteous and the servers were mostly knowledgeable, especially given that they just recently opened.  I would definitely be back here for another visit.

Get the pizza.  Anyone who claims this isn't as close as it gets to vera napolitana on our side of the ocean is lying.

The pasta is fine, to be fair, and there are some other great dishes. But this is first and foremost a pizza restaurant. Its an Italian pizza restaurant, but pizza none-the-less. 

Even the name refers to the pizza oven (forno = oven). So if you come here with crazy high pasta expectations and order something lame like cannelloni and it doesn't floor you, don't be surprised because you just went to a steakhouse and ordered a vegetarian dish.

If you don't like a traditional wood fired oven with fresh cheese and charred blistered crust you wont like this. If you've been to Italy and loved the real thing then Il Fornello will not disappoint.

The margherita and diavolo are the best, fig pizza gets an honourable mention. Everyone tells me the calamari is good but I dont like seafood.

The samosas are unlike others you would have tried.  The pastry is not greasy at all - something that is difficult to manage if you have tried other samosa places. The fillings are packed with flavour and the size of the samosas are very generous.  The Samosa chips are also very addicting - beware.  If you are in the neighbourhood, stop by to give it a try!
The samosas were great, but the best part is that they cook them when you order them. So fresh and yummy. No more soggy cold samosas!

I'm always in this plaza for lunch when I noticed a new shop advertising samosas - The Samosa Shop. I love samosas so naturally I had to give them a try. This is strictly take out, which makes sense as all they serve is samosas. Choices include vegetarian, beef and chicken both regular and spicy versions. I don't do spicy and so I tried two of each. The owner suggested a tamarind dipping sauce. I warmed them in the oven when I got home at the end of the day and my wife and I enjoyed all of them. The vegetarian was our favorite, beef was second and chicken third. The spicy versions could change this however.
I'm a firm believer in supporting local businesses so all you Ajax folks give The Samosa Shop a try; you won't be disappointed.

They don't have beef shawarma! How can you be a shawarma place if you only have chicken and gyro?

Taste-wise, it's so-so. Nothing great.

I think they try to rip you off by asking what toppings you want without disclosing that most are extras. You'll only find out when they hand you the bill. I don't mind paying for what I ask for but I also want full disclosure.

Never coming back. There are better shawarma places in Durham.

This is my first time at Top Nails. I arrived thirty minutes before closing so I asked if my boyfriend and I would still be able to get a pedicure. The male told me yes; however a female worker was very rude and I overheard her telling a client that we were rude to ask and that walk ins needed to wait or leave. I chalked up to a misunderstanding as I didn't have a problem waiting; I had only asked as I knew they were closing soon. Anyways, Kim gave me a mani/pedi and she was WICKED. She was jovial, informative and overall just provided good conversation. My feet were in ROUGH shape and she didn't make me feel a way about it, she just worked her magic and now they feel AMAZING. I'll definitely be coming back here, just on the strength of Kim alone.

About a month ago we tried this place and I was pleasantly pleased with it, has a very nice relaxing atmosphere, very nice dinner experience. the food was fantastic from the bread and $10 pizza to the sea food linguini, fettuccini alfredo and the white wine we got for dinner it all was done to perfection, it was absolutely fantastic.  The staff was friendly the dinner experience was great and the food fantastic.

We stopped in with a large group on a Saturday night. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. This is the only location I've been to. The restaurant is large, clean, bright and well decorated. 

The group shared different pizza's. The quality and variance of the toppings were excellent.

Overall I was very happy with the experience of the evening.

I had an issue with a fan on my motherboard. 

Andre is such a nice guy he helped me out immediately and was very equitable with his pricing. 

You got to be good to be lucky and I'm lucky I met him.

Knowledgable man. Don't let the store front fool you.

If you are in durham and need IT help - Dre is the MAN.

Going into Country Cheese Company is always a fun experience. Tammy (the owner) is so lovely and always has something new to try.  

Such a great asset to the durham region!

Stopped in at this burger joint after a round of golf. The prices seemed a but steep for the burger combos but I'll get to that.  I was pretty hungry and wanted fries and a drink so I opted for the 4oz combo.  The fries could have easily fed 2 or 3 people and were awesome. They were large but crispy and not greasy.  I suspect their poutine would be awesome...next time. The burger was great; made to order with fresh ingredients. I had the works sans hot peppers.  It was a lot of food for one person but tasted so good.  As I was leaving had a chance to talk to the owner.  The next time I'll have to try one of their home burgers.  They're made one site with their own spice blend and are huge. Hope to come back here with my wife so I can take down a burger and share the fries! Great value just need a major appetite or a friend.

My wife and I went to this restaurant with great expectations as we love seafood and Cajun cooking.

I would have given a 1 star rating if it had not been for the food which was actually very good.

The service was absolutely terrible and very disorganized. There is a combination of bad attitude and just plain inexperience with how to create a good customer experience. We arrived around 5:30 pm with no line up and many open tables. It took over 10 minutes to be greeted while the hostess was chatting at the bar. After being seated, it took over 15 minutes to have a server come by and after I had to ask another server to find our server. After ordering 2 beers, another 15 minutes. This was very disturbing and really spoiled our dinning experience.

I realize this restaurant has only been open for about 1 month but I expect much more. Where is the management who should be overseeing customer service???

One other issue: the air handling system seemed to be off and the place was extremely stuffy. So we asked about this. Then all of a sudden there is air flow!

Such a shame. Poor management, inexperience, and certain employees who have no concept of how to serve customers and display bad attitudes.

If I return to give them another try, I am going to wait a while until they hopefully get their act together.

This is by far the best Pita Place in the Durham Region and GTA. Chicken and Gyros is always cooked perfectly, the workers treat you like you've been there a million times before (I definitely have), and the potatoes are perfect. Can't go wrong at Pita Land Ajax. Seriously. The Chicken Shawarma plate is the best bang for your buck. With some hot sauce over the chicken and Italian dressing for the salad. 

Customer for Life.

I have been doing my nails since I was 13... moved to Ajax 7 years ago and started going to top nails 2 years ago... no matter where I end up I will come to this nail salon. I have never had a nail break. chip. Or fall off... they do an amazing job and are very qualified at what they do. Amazing work.. if you make an appointment they are very good with keeping their time. Louise and bill are the best at the job but all are qualified. Thank you for amazing work.

Ive been going to top nails for 2 years now and every time they've done an amazing job. 
Their staff is very friendly and artists take their time and are keen at detail. Their business is clean and well kept and always a comfortable environment. Whether you walk in or have booked an appointment they will always try and fit you in! They're nails are always well done and stay on for a little over a month depending how you treat them and if you don't get them filled and such. All and all a great place and I'd highly recommend them!
Very extensive range of cheeses to cater to any pallet topped off with excellent customer service.

Great little store with amazing service. You definitely get what you pay for here. There are lots of wonderful specialty cheeses to try and to buy. They are not cheap but the prices are fair. I definitely recommend it for any cheese connossoir out there.

Cool venue. Open, lots of seating and lots of parking. Several beers on tap as well as a cooler with bottles to take home. I grabbed a flight of 4 samples.

Staff are super friendly and super cool. Good snacks available too that come from local businesses; they don't have a full kitchen. The beer is alright. Some are very light, but I liked their black lager. Prices are great!

They have live music there sometimes. The musical guest performing when I was there was really good!

There's a large patio as well, too bad it's winter!

So I went to this salon because it was recommended to me by a friend. I ended up waiting about 45 minutes before I was actually served. I when I arrived they asked me what I wanted so I told them shellac manicure and a regular pedicure. 
 The lady told me to pick out my colours so I did. When it was time to get my manicure they told me that I had to re-pick my colours because the colours I picked were not shellac. Fine so I picked them and they got started. They did do a good job on my hands. 

On to the pedicure, one of the guys did my pedicure, he asked me if I wanted the sea salt scrub so I said yes, then he said $5 more, so I said no thank you. Once he was done and my nails were drying I saw that he missed a few spots on the bottom of my heel. I told him and he kept saying that it was just the way my heel was, which i knew wasn't true he just didn't wanna fix it. 

Now comes paying. On the phone I was told $45. They told me I owed them $55. I asked them how come, they said because $5 for a design on my nails even though they didn't tell me that at the time and I don't know what they other $5 was for. Regardless I was not happy. 

Overall I might recommend this place to someone. I will see how long the shellac lasts first.

I will definitely recommend this place. Shellac lasted a long time
Great service from the young ladies working the counter. Great environment for a casual dessert and coffee/ tea.

Love that there is an Il Fornello now located right in the heart of Ajax so I don't have trek all the way downtown Toronto!

This location has a great vibe and is very bright looking with it's white brick walls and beautiful dark hardwood floors, high grey industrial looking ceilings, and lots of funky hanging lamps. They even have a large bar side and a lovely patio!

We had an awesome waiter, who was really helpful and funny. We took all his suggestions and ended up ordering all his favourite dishes. The boy definitely has great taste because everything we ate tasted phenomenal.

This is what we ordered:

Pizza Pollo "BBQ"  - Tomato sauce, mozzarella, slow roasted chicken, chipotle BBQ sauce, charred red onions +add bacon for $3 more
The thin and chewy crust with crisp edges definitely packed that beautiful wood burning flavour. The pizza was packed with ample fresh toppings, real sliced chicken breast, gooey melty mozzerella, and the sweet & spicy bbq sauce plus the crunch from the crispy salty bacon helped hit all the flavour bases.

Gnocchi Asiago - House made gnocchi with asiago cream sauce, spinach & crispy shallots
Wowww was this ever good! That lush rich creamy asiago cream sauce was soo delicious I wanted to drink up all the remnants left over after I ate all those plump pillowy gnocchis and the addition of the crispy shallots which were like mini onion rings added just the right crunch!

Tagliatelle Stefano - w/ slowly braised beef short ribs in tomato sauce
Perfectly cooked al dente pasta and those tender flavourful fall off the bone meaty ribs were perfection.

Finally onto the dessert which our waiter also recommended, totally knocked it out of the ball park!

Double Pistachio Gelato - Double scoop of creamy pistachio gelato evenly blended with real pieces of pistachios.
Perfect balance of sweet and salty, loved the intense taste of pistachios with every bite and the crunchy bits of real pistachios evenly blended throughout plus the addition of the gingersnap biscuits on the side was a pleasant surprise. Pistachio is now my favourite flavour!

Overall a spectacular meal from start to finish. I can not flaw a single thing, our waiter was very attentive the whole night, refilling our glasses without mention, making superb recommendations, food was fresh, flavourful, and delicious to the last bite. I'm will definitely be returning here!

Always a great breakfast. Weekends are busy so budget your time accordingly. But during the week, always fast. And regardless the day...always a smile from the staff. Usually served by a gentlemen with glasses (I'm afraid I forget his name) - anyway, he's been there for years and he's an absolute pleasure! Great spot! Omelettes are phenomenal

No issues with food quality or presentation.
Love their hot & sour soup.  Chow mien combo with beef , vegetables & soft noodles was quite good & filling.
Mango salad side was flavourful but perhaps over spiced with too many onions.

My family are British background so real fussy about their Fish N Chips.  I thought I should write a review as they have sent me here a few times to pick up Haddock and Chips.

- Fish is crispy and fresh (almost a cross between Tempura and British Beer Batter)..has a nice texture (not too greasy)
- Chips hand cut and fresh made

The place is busy and has things like Mushy Peas, Blood/Black Pudding/Haggis/Iron Bru etc.  There is a little restaurant part of the establishment.  

If you are British and like a good plate of Fish N Chips that is closer to the stuff you get back home - this is the place.  I have tried other places in Ajax and my family have given those the thumbs down (as they just didn't make the cut)

Balmoral is consistently fresh fish, crispy batter (NOT soggy), chips have a nice texture and hand made, busy place and on weekends you may have to wait a bit for your order to be processed - but worth the wait.

This is one of the places my buddy and I go to once a month for breakfast and there is always a friendly atmosphere. 

I find the food good but they could be more generous in portions for the price. The service can be slow at times but the quality of the food is consistently good. 

My only real gripe besides the bland decor is the the terrible backs on the booths. Whoever designed the backs on seats for the booths forgot to add a solid core. They are comfortable until someone sits in the next booth. You can feel the other person poking right away like they are coming through the back of the seat and it's clear there is nothing but foam separating the two sides. It's distracting and you can feel every motion. Oversight or cheap design. 

Otherwise it's a decent place to eat

Where South Street sets itself apart from competitors like Five Guys is in the toppings.  Cajun onions, garlic mayo, guacamole, etc.  They also have toppings for the fries (both spices and poutine styles).

The regular burger is 519 calories and the small burger is 289 on a whole wheat bun.

The small fries is 400 calories with 1.5gr saturated fat.

See Nutrition info at the website (PDF).  Really appreciate it when they offer this.
Good place for constantly good Italian food.  Service is good too. Wood oven pizza and lasagna are my favourite's.  Worth a visit.

Second time, dry greeting, empty atmosphere, no house bread. Beets salad good, kids pasta and cheese pizza simple sauce and penne our meals both were pasta with chicken however chicken under cooked, didn't eat after one piece. Quite pricey based on location, cutlery missing from table they say us on. And missing napkins. All in and once a year huge maybe

This location open recently. My wife and I stopped in for lunch. We were expecting a basic coffee and donut style operation. We were surprised at how nice the restaurant was. There was an excellent selection of sandwiches and wraps. It took us a few minutes to decide because we weren't expecting such an interesting and varied menu.    

This location has friendly staff that helped us choose from the menu board. The staff were also very friendly and after ordering the meal was brought to our table. A staff member (he may have been the manager) came over to remove the dishes and chat with us. 

The 2 wraps, soup and coffee came about $18. The ingredients were all fresh, wonderfully prepared and looked appealing. 

We will definitely return and we'll check out other locations as well.
Probably the best breakfast restaurant I have been to.  Excellent friendly staff and fantastic food great portions - delicious and super value.
Fairly new club with a big selection of different machines. Decent size studio for classes. Change rooms are clean with spacious lockers.

Ajax casino has lot of new slot machines now. We played on different slot machines, It was very busy in there. Then went to the self serve beverage station,it was a huge mess, sugar spilled everywhere, there was no teabags, no cream, just hot water and the coffee machine was also empty, the employees were nearby but no one cared.

The lady serving cold drinks was carrying ginger ale in a big plastic bottle (which looks dirty to drink from)  I am sure they can do better.

Food is decent..I would give it a 3.5-4 out of 5. Wings are decent..AYCE is $13 (plus mandatory $3 drink) and you can change flavours every order. Your first order is 6 wings after that you get 4 and it's annoying waiting between orders. 
It's what you expect from a Bar...greasy fries, old washrooms, and a big TV over the bar. A decent spot, but not worth getting excited over. Beware though..it's not free refills. I paid over 9$ for name brand coke.... Overall 2 of 5

WASTE OF TIME! The order we placed was two coffees,  2x 3 eggs, choice of bread, bacon, and home fries and 1 Monte Cristo to share. We waited over 50 minutes! I drank 5 cups of coffee. At 45 mins the waitress comes over to apologize for avoiding us and NOT making eye contact because the kitchen hadn't even started making our food! All she offered to remedy the situation was a discount on our food, didn't tell me how much of a discount, and some more coffee. When she came back with the coffee she said it would be another 15 minutes. I told her "your telling me that they need 15 minutes to make our order? so they haven't started yet" and she said yes. Well we left. If you need an hour and ten minutes to make a BASIC breakfast order, it's probably not going to taste good. BYE FELICIA!
I don't mind this place, I'd say it's mainly for older people (seniors), decor is outdated but the food is good enough  and the service is great .

So wouldn't it be nice to call a place where they make assembled burgers and you have to wait 10 minutes for them to make them, but instead you could call them and order in advance? Most places allow for this.  South street doesn't so they lost my business and I went to shamrock burger in Ajax!!! 

Way better!!

I came here to have my fake nails removed and just put on shellac. I told them I wanted to keep the length of my real nail but they proceeded to take my nails off in ways that did just the opposite. Instead of using acetone to weaken the glue, they just pried my fake from my real and some nails really hurt during this process. Even though I told them again I'm trying to grow my nails, the tech proceeded to use the machine to completely shave my nails down making them EXTREMELEY thin to the point where I was strugging to open a can of pop without chipping my nail. The shellac they put on started chipping within a week which has never happened to me before. My nails started breaking within a week due to them shaving off so many layers. Overall, they do not listen to the customer, they just do what is most convenient and takes the least amount of time. 

I do not recommend this place.

solid little source for a rather decent offering of cheeses in the GTA. considering the size of the shop i was quite impressed with the amount of variety they had. the owner & staff were happy to make recommendations and offer samples to get you what you're looking for. 

they also offer paninis made to order (you pick the bread/spread/cheese), for $7.99 - didn't give it a try this time around but the options all sounded delicious. additional $2 for capicollo.

there's a smattering of goods around the store to go with the cheese as well - crackers, cured meats, jams -- easy one stop shop, minus the wine ;)

The food here is very tasty. The staff was super friendly. Had the chicken balls, chicken fried rice, egg rolls and noodles. All delicious!!! The interior is dated and they were slow to bring the food. Despite that, it was a good experience. I will be back.

This location has the worst drive tru and the worst staff  they are to busy fooling around then giving the proper orders.The last three Saturdays we have gone thru and have gotten the wrong order all three times we did not notice until we were on the 401.On Wednesday my wife tried to get a tea and had to tell the girl at the counter three times that she was not getting the proper order the girl got rude and closed the window on her. I have phoned three times to talk to manager and have gotten nothing but the run around. I phoned today and talked to a young man and he kept calling me boss very cheeky. So we like many others will never be going to Tim's again. Richard M
Our new favorite place. Great seafood but horrible service during Sundays. We went during the weekdays and it is way better service.
omg ceasar  salad to die for, unfortunately our friend ended up spending about $40 for a salad and a glass of wine.  Just a little to pricey for what you receive
Decent theatre, showing its age, although they do try to keep it up.  Nice for a quick trip to the movies or for avoiding crowds at the more popular theatres.

I have been drinking Falcon Red Falcon Ale and Laggar Falcon Lager since back when they first start out. You can still get those from your local LCBO stores.

And now they finally have their own brewery, bottle shop and taproom! I like their line of beers which has all these playful names and themes!

The tasting area is spacious and you have the full view of the brewing area. You can choose any 4 beers on taps to create your own beer flight at $5.50. Or if you not really sure what you like, the friendly staff is ready to assist or give you a taste.

You can get some of the beers in bottles or if you get a growler, you can fill that up with any beers on taps!

I ended up getting the Canada Gose... Love the label design and it is perfect to drink on a hot summer day.

So worth dropping by when you in the area! As almost all the one they have on draft you cannot find them in the Beer stores!

Pleasantly surprised! Service was fantastic. Food was served piping hot which made me very happy. I hate getting cold food. Portions were big. Boyfriend and I shared calamari which was delicious. Sangria was good. When server was asked for the cheque, it came promptly. (Another peeve of mine is having to wait to pay). 
Not only would I return, but I'd order the same pasta dish. (It came with spinach, tomatoes & mushrooms which I loved. Nice to see restaurants that have veggies!)

Excellent customer service 
Better food I had the lamb shank and it was delicious my date had the salmon and she enjoyed it as well

The server didn't smile at all.  The guy at the cash register (could be the owner?) seemed like a grouchy old bastard.  The food wasn't bad, but I've had better.  The service was the deal-breaker for me.  I won't be back.
its a fast food 50 and 60s style diner we come for all day breakfast .. we think reasonable meet friends here on the weekends... its just ok what do you expect its a diner?
Love this place for breakfast. Servers are fantastic and the food is exactly what you'd expect from a breakfast place. Get there early to avoid the lines, it's busy for a reason!

Is it obvious I enjoy the food here.  Had lunch on one occasion.... Pizza was delicious, thin crush the way I like it.  We went for dinner on the weekend and both my husband and I had the seafood linguine.  It was delicious!!!! The pasta was perfectly cooked "al dente".  The meal was hot and there  was a generous helping of seafood on our plate.  Will definitely order this again.  My mum had the Fettuccini Alfredo, which was also very good.  Will I go back a third time?........I think it's safe to say I will.

I called this morning with concerns that I may have a flat tire, and was told that although they were busy to come between noon and 1pm. I got there around 12:40pm. Jason was extremely busy, but managed to go above and beyond to give me piece of mind. It turned out that the tire needed air. Anyway, I was highly impressed. As a business teacher, I can honestly say I would recommend him. Great job Jason, and Thank you.

Home made Lebanese food & sweets by a very very friendly staff. We usually come in with a large group from work and order tapas style from heir extensive menu. 

We usually order the Fuul, a thick bean based soup with a good dose of lemon,  Manakeesh - Lebanese style pizza with exotic toppings such as Haloumi cheese, zaatar and sausage are some of our favorites!

They also make a good variety of middle eastern sweets, lebneh, eggplant spread and pickled vegetables.

Cant wait to go back!

This place is ok, you get what you pay for.

If you eat just bacon and eggs than this is your place, anything else outside of that realm it's not great at all.

I've found their feta and yogurt to be gross, almost as if it's turning

I won't even spend too much time writing a review on this place, food taste like they put all the right ingredients into a bowl with the meat and microwaved it. 

I ordered 

Thai green curry (it wasn't green)
Beef and black bean sauce( no black bean)
Deep fried crispy chicken wings 
(The wings were very good)

I called back to complain and they didn't answer the phone. 9 pm

Great beers and southern exposure patio. All make for a good experience. Steak and ale pie, bierwurst and beer cheese all made with their products for take home. I also enjoyed the hot pretzel while sampling beer

My husband and I know others Lebanese bakery in Toronto and Montreal but this one is the best ! The food is fresh and very tasty. All pizza are delicious. I will suggest the chicken Fajitas pizza. My husband and I love it. The service is excellent, people are very pleasant!!!!  If you have the opportunity to stop there, you won't be disappointed.

For reasons beyond me, I dragged my boyfriend here to celebrate our anniversary. I thought it would be like the location downtown, which seemed to have good reviews. Big mistake. I ordered an western omelet, that came with homefries. The omelet was hugeee, but lacking in flavour. The home fries were terrible, roasted potatoes that looked like they had been scraped from the bottom of the pan. My boyfriend had the steak, which arrived undercooked and almost made me sick to watch him attempt to eat it. I won't be returning here.

PS: They also don't accept debit or credit card, so be aware. They do have a pricey ATM at the entrance, though.

Will never go back here. I've had 2 absolutely horrible experiences here. The last time I went on July 28th, I wondered why I ever went back. I felt so scammed and am still bothered almost 2 months later.

My family and I have been eating here at least once a week since it opened about a year ago. There are no heat lamps, food warmers or any other things one would expect to see in a typical burger joint. And that's because this isn't a typical burger joint.

The food is fresh and the owners/staff are friendly. Speed of service largely depends on how busy they are, but it's well within acceptable limits.

Highly, highly recommended.

Best breakfast i had on my 10 day stay visiting canada. To bad i wasnt staying nearby or i would have eaten breakfast everyday here, I happen to find this spot by accident. What can i say, quick service, great taste and fairly priced. 5 stars in my book. Everything was cooked to perfection, I had fresh orange juice and a classic breakfast with bacon and rye toast. i asked for my bacon extra crispy, yum yum yum.

I'm likely not the best person to review a casino but based on my, albeit limited knowledge, I don't find this casino enjoyable at all. We came here a couple of times this past week only because of a promotion we received in the mail (and then the follow-up promotion we received once there the first time). Sign up at the counter was quick and the customer service was great... of course it was.

Please, tell me if I'm missing something but all I saw was a room full of slots... and not a very big room at that (compared to other casinos I've been to). The only other thing I saw was a restaurant/bar area. Is that all there is to this place?

Of course, as with any casino, it was packed to the rafters and it always amazes me to see people straddled over two chairs with wads of 20's in their hands feeding, not one, but two machines a seemingly endless supply. I don't get it but maybe it's just my age... no wait, some of these people have a good 30 years on me! Wait a minute! Aren't you on a fixed income lady? Oh, who am I to judge. ;)

The last time I played a slot machine it was in Seneca Casino (US) and I noticed two main differences: 1. The machines at Seneca seem to track and display your winnings so much better and 2. In the States, they don't care if you know your limit OR if you play within it.

Liked it better when it was pickles but the service is good not impressed with their changing their menu using sliced lunch meat on clubhouse sandwiches reasonably clean  still can't get rid of that smell in the basement of the bathrooms. Overall friendly and inviting
The food did not blow me away but the dessert (tartufo) was good.  A little on the pricey side.

This use to be one of my fav spots to eat.     I was treated very well I odered spaghetti and meatball they use to give 3 really big meatballs but have changed it to 5 small ones  the pizza is good will try that next time
This a good breakfast place. Not very busy when I was there few months ago, the staff is nice.

The food here is good, but not enough for the price. The water also tasted weird, but maybe that's just me. Don't get the ice cream either, it's freezer burnt and overpriced. Nice looking restaurant tho

This is not really a Casino, just a large venue with slot machines. It is a very pleasant modern building, with an attractive layout and restaurant. It is extremely crowded on weekends but very accessible on weekdays.

There is a nice array of slot machines for a wide range of 'budgets'.  There are complimentary non-alcoholic drinks, and the service is very good.

I have often read negative reviews of Casinos based on the reviewer having lost a bit of money. That is not and should not be the standard. 

This, overall is a pleasant environment, with a bunch of nice players (with a few exceptions), and really accessible from Toronto. They are a bit skimpy on comps (it is the OLG), and players can only guess at the payback percentages of the slot machines. Ontario and the OLG are one of the few casino operators in North America that do not 'tout' what the payback is on slots.

The rating of this gym fluctuates depending on the day and time you go at. OVERALL this location is pretty good, due to 24/7 access and is decently maintained. There are some exceptions. 

If you come to the gym later than 9PM, the one staff member seems to always go missing. So if something breaks, someone gets injured, or whatever, good luck finding the staff. Honestly, I feel like they're taking a nap somewhere - I can NEVER find them. They just leave the scanner and towels out. If you die during a 2AM workout, they'll find you in the morning. Just help yourself to the first aid kit since nobody else will. One of the girls who worked here didn't know what an instant ice pack was so I'm not sure how much you want to trust their first-aid skills. 

This location has the hard rubber flooring, not the squishy kind near the weights. Deadlifts can be pretty loud, so be aware of your surroundings. You sometimes get the person who doesn't understand the concept of weightlifting yell at you for "slamming the weights" on a 300lb+ deadlift and how "you're doing it wrong" as he waves his gloved hands around explaining how to do it. That's great, but if you want silence go to a library. 

Here's a breakdown of what the gym is like throughout the week: 

Off-hours, including weekends, not including holidays:
Not too busy and it's fairly relaxed in terms of trying to get equipment. You don't have to run for a power rack since usually one will be empty. Lots of room for deadlifts and exercises using battle ropes, sleds, box jumps and stuff. 

Holidays: 
Get here nice and early, and you'll probably get a good workout. Come here 3 hours before closing, you will have every person who forgot it was a holiday come to this gym because all the other locations within a 20km radius is closed. You'll get all the favourite types of gym-goers such as those who do unnecessary exercises in the power racks like bicep curls, dumbbell raises and squatting the bar. 

Weekdays, after work (5PM-7PM):
Not as rough as some of the other clubs closer to Toronto/more populated cities like Markham. It's doable and these people are regulars so they just do their thing. Sometimes it does get a bit busy if you follow a "typical" lift schedule (i.e Mondays are Chest). 

Overall it's a good location since it has plenty of benches, power racks, and functional training equipment such as sleds.

Almost Perfect is Always Perfect for someone on a budget or looking for a deal especially on frozen and package food.

Aside from frozen food..they also have discounted chips, snacks, BBQ sauces, Spices, candies, chocolate...

Some of them has a short expiry date..but some are good for another year as they are probably overstocked items. So double check the expiry date!

One lone cashier...and a line up... especially  busy on a weekday afternoon!!

I've been to Top Nails in Ajax twice, and will be going back for sure! I've had shellac nails done here twice and they do last the full two weeks (or more if you let it go, I'm sure!) and the employees are friendly and helpful. The shellac nails are only $30 (plus a tip), which is a great deal I think.... the usual salon I used to go to which is across the street in Harwood Plaza charges $45 for shellac, and they're always too busy for walk-ins.
Top Nails is a great salon with nice staff, and they do a great job on my nails! Thank you!! :) Easy parking and access off of Bayly, just west of Harwood Ave.

Eggs benedict to die for breakfast like you would serve yourself at home good portions lots of home fries they now take debit not just cash anymore most of the staff have been there for many many years which is always a good sign in the restaurant
A landmark breakfast location in Ajax. No frills quality food breakfast place with lots of coffee. Usually packed weekend mornings and only accepts cash. Plenty of good food at a cheap price.

5 for excellent savings in $'s and gourmet foods for an excellent price point.

Terra Chips (big bags) 99cents
Almond Milk (chocolate - Blue Diamond) $1.25

Honestly if you live in the area and don't drop into this store to check out the pricing and do some shopping you are a fool (as the $'s you save in this place is substantial).

Christmas time and Valentines and all those holiday's they have the chocolate gifts for those occasions (Lindt, Pot of Gold, Ferrerio Rochier, smarties, Rowntree, Cadburys ) etc.....so brand names for good prices

This is a fantastic place to stock up on name brands and also get items if you are having a shower and or family get-together.

I am giving 5 stars as price-wise you can't beat it and for carrying EXPENSIVE NAME BRANDS at cheap prices.

Carries tons of name brands and changes every day - so if you live int he area worth dropping in from time to time to see what new things are coming in.

Has amazing desserts and cookies.  Has the basis for birthday cakes so if you are a mom wanting to make a homemade looking birthday cake that is in the shape of a car or a castle it is easy to go there and pick up the cake squares and then you can cut them into shape (one of the gals at my office did this turned out amazing).

Has chip, juice, veggies, meats, cookies, desserts, frozen fish, meatballs, burgers, chicken, chicken wings, Seafood stuffed Chicken, Shrimp.  

Good place to stock up for Christmas/Easter/Thanksgiving also as it has a lot of variety that really would enable a family event to be substantially met "food-wise" and not break the bank either.
Excellent and fast service. Super friendly staff that are attentive and there when you need them.  The food was made perfectly ans the menu has a great amount of options.
I'm not 100% sure if it is old, but this theater is definitely showing its age.  Smaller location compared to others.  Great if you wanna see a movie and avoid huge crowds.

Environment is awesome. The place really pays attention to detail. High quality coffee and baked goods. Have yet to try their breakfast but will soon. 

Order their cold coffee CCino, so so good!

Never thought a thin burger could fill me up but 7 ounces is still 7 ounces.  Nicely seasoned burger, fresh ingredients, and customer friendly staff/owner.  
Definitely coming back!
***make sure you get the sauce, it's tasty***

My visits to pita land specifically this location are usually very good experiences I really like the food it's fresh. The service is really good. 4 stars 

From a business perspective I think you guys should stay open a little bit later to keep up with the 24 hours good life that's right beside you. subway still eating up the late-night business

Greasy spoons hurrah!!!

If you want a yummy grill style breakfast without the inflated prices of Golden Griddle and the shitty service you get there, Sunset Grill is a good one to add to your list.

As others have stated, this place is usually busy and for good reason so get there early or be prepared to wait for a table. If you're in the mood to meander and chat and have a two-hour breakfast, go to Cora's. This is the kind of place you come to when you have a hankering for pancakes, eggs, sausages, bacon and toast and you want it NOW.

I've rarely had bad service here but that's not to say service is fantastic either. But really who are we kidding? I come for the food!

I've had the grilled cheese, one of the breakfast plates, the tuna melt and pancakes over the years and none of them have disappointed. Other than that, there isnt much more to say! Simple food, done to order and it'll fill your belly up :)

Underwhelming experience. I immediately regretted coming to this theater to see a block buster at this location. The screens are disappointingly small. The seating is the old style - can't recline, no footrest or headrest.

In terms of other amenities they do offer mobile pickup. When I arrived there were only kiosks to manage ticket purchase and no live agents. Washrooms are only located before you enter into the screen areas so don't forget to bring your ticket with you to the restroom.
Beer is great, staff even better and now they serve food! Always enjoy the new brews available!

Have been to this location on several occasions, at different times of the day. It always seems busy (that's a good thing), but not too busy. Easy to  find space to sit and work, or chat with a client or a friend.

Management seems attentive and on the ball. 

Great alternative for me to meet with clients for a quick coffee. I'll be coming back for sure!

I walked in to try fruity cheeses from shipped from abroad. I was thankful for the lady being welcoming and helped me even if she knew I was there to only try small samples of cheeses. I'm not a cheese snob but I'm tired of regular cheese from the grocery store. 

Right away she knew I wanted to try Stilton Cheeses and when I told her I wanted fruity blue cheese, she had me try something from Montreal. She cut the piece of cheese for me and did her best to give me a perfect amount. She knew I was just expanding my knowledge in cheeses and was very enthusiastic about it. She didn't try to cut me a bigger slice than I wanted. It was as small as she can, as what I asked. 

I had the Mango Ginger Stilton Cheese from UK(apparently a best seller) and I so recommend it. I want to come back for more. I paired this cheese with white wine (reisling) from Niagara and a simple toast with Avocado. It was perfect guys! The smell of the cheese is amazing, fruity and had a creamy smell. 

The fruity blue cheese was also perfect. I had it a little later than when I bought it, I completely forgot. Thankfully it was wrapped and bagged well. I enjoyed this with the egg sandwich. Add bacon if desired. The smell wasn't pungent but was definitely in the cheesy side. 

Parking here is not too hectic, it's situated in a plaza near the 401 Salem exit. I didn't find the cheese expensive, I thought the prices were practical. For Antipasto for 50 people it's easy to spend about $100 for the cheese. 

There are a few tables and not too many seating. The lighting is okay, it's not bright in there. I was also told that they cater to events, and i find their prep area (behind the counter) clean and organized. 

When you buy a piece of cheese, there will be a sticker, to make it easy to remember. On the sticker it has the name of cheese, where it's from, and the price. I remember a brief description included as well. 

I like how the cheese I got didn't have the wax part that came with. At some stores they also count the wax to weigh. I'm not sure if it had a wax case and if she took it off before weighing it. But I was pretty happy with it over all, if I were to buy a big piece. 

They sell good variety of cheeses, a good alternative when you're not down town Toronto (Kensington Market).

You can also ask them for pairings. They are knowledgeable. They can tell you what wine to pair with it best. 

I would come back here again.

We went there Friday night and it wasn't too busy. For appetizers we had the Calimari. The main course we ordered Lobster, King crab, Shrimp, Mussels and Cajun Rice. Everything was delicious! I would just go back for the rice. Service was great. Will come again and I love the hours.

Came back today to try the new ginger beer, not bad but I still prefer the bomb girl. It went down one star as the service was not as good today as my experience from last week.  I walked up asking for suggestions and it wasn't as helpful and welcoming as my first experience..

Took my girlfriend here yesterday for her birthday. The inside decor is very contemporary, which looked awesome. We opted to sit on the patio. The patio is separated in two areas (by a warm fireplace), one for dining and the other for lounging. Our server was very nice. We had a pitcher of the white sangria which was really good! So refreshing and lots of fruit. We ordered the ricotta dip but it was disappointing. Didn't think it was gonna be cold. Wouldn't order it again. For dinner I had the gnocchi and added chicken. It was so delicious. Felt like I was in heaven. It is heavy so keep that in mind. For dessert we had the cheesecake to share which was ok, nothing to brag about. I would definitely go back for the food and sangria!

This is a hidden gem. I found this brewery after eating brunch down the street.

The beer sampling flights were good. I really enjoyed the cheese platter, it was all so fresh and unique.

They are launching the ginger ale beer soon. Will definitely come back to try.

Service was friendly and amazing. They will all help you choose the type of beer that you like. 

Will be back!
Eat here all the time, best shawarma around. The prices have gone up recently though. Staff is friendly.

Tables were so close it was as if everyone in the restaurant were sitting together. Needless to say, and also because the people beside us kept staring as if they never saw human beings before, it made the seating very uncomfortable. It reminded me a lot of Hell's Kitchen, and we waited about an hour and a half to be served, only to be filled up with stale bread in the mean time. When the food finally came, it was the only thing that pleased me, but was not special enough for me to go there again. Il Fornello did not live up to expectations, and especially the goals listed on their website.

This location gets a low rating because the staff seem miserable. The individuals at the welcome desk are never smiling and barely make eye contact when you arrive and never say thank you or good bye on your way out.

I never see anyone working with a personal trainer...EVER! Yet they will kick me out of the area marked off for PT sessions when the rest of the gym is totally packed. I guess they like that area to remain empty for no reason.

I am at this location 2-3 times a week and not one staff member has ever made any attempt to have a conversation with me. I continue to go here only because of the hours of operation. 

I have been to the body combat class and it was fun. I would recommend it.

I drop in here for breakfast once a year while having my car rustproofed nearby. The food has always been good and the service efficient and friendly.

This morning, I had a Montreal Smoked Meat sandwich with fries and a glass of freshly squeezed orange juice. The sandwich was good any was only $8.99 with the fries but the juice was $4.49. Really? For a glass of orange juice? It was freshly squeezed but I could have bought a family sized jug for that price.

I was a little hesitant when I searched the address and realized it was a home; however, the reviews were all good so I went ahead. The hours of 9-9 are very convenient as was the location close to my work. He offered to replace my iPhone 6 screen in 15 min while I wait but I had to get to an appointment. When I returned about an hour later the phone looked brand new. He even threw in a more protective case than I had on it after we discussed that the phone is used by my 9 year old! Fast and reliable for screen replacement. I would recommend this business to a  friend.

The parking makes it for a long walk to park. It is fine if you like walking though. 

The slot area is small. I've never seen any helpful staff around yet and I have been there numerous times. 

Just like any other slot place, the machines don't pay out anything anymore.

To start we were not greeted nor sat at a table when we arrived. Server just yelled for us to sit anywhere. It wasn't busy so there was no need for that. The place is too dimly lit (better to hide the filth). Server was polite but seemed a bit frazzled. I had the JR burger. It was ok. Nothing great. I have had way better burgers. It was presented sloppy on the plate. I ordered 2 servings of onion rings. We got only one. When mentioned to server she dealt with it apologetically but they came out when we were half done our meal and they were extremely greasy and over cooked. Anything fried is greasy and slimy. My daughter had fish and chips and the fish was not edible it was so greasy. While there I used the ladies room and was nearly sick to my stomach by the filthy condition of the toilets! Just 2 and one was clogged with what could only be described as cow patty. Flies hovered over the bowl. I tried to flush it as the smell was overwhelming but it was stuck in there. The loo is just dirt and run down. The whole place is dirty and run down. Service is mediocre and food the same . Would rather eat at McDonald's

Update - no longer impressed with this business. The lack of communication is horrible. You constantly fill out forms indicating your physical medical history. 
Services are booked and/or sold to you, but nobody at that point Booking or selling indicate whether your medical history prevents you from having the service performed. I have wasted my time, gas and money to get a facial peel. 
I didn't even finish filling out the form when I saw that I have medicines and they decided they didn't want to do the procedure because of having arthritis condition and associated medication. 
The reception and multiple technicians here are well aware of my arthritic conditions and medications as I have already filled out the forms at least three times!!!

THIS BUSINESS ONLY WANTS YOUR MONEY!!!!!
Go elsewhere. 

I went to Skin Vitality's open house recently to get some information about the types of services provided and get a feel for the clinic. Lots of fun and lots of detail provided. I ended up winning some free units of Botox that could be used in conjunction with a purchased package. 
Financing ( interest free :) !!) was available, so I thought that I would try Cool Sculpting. 
--- Imagine noninvasive fat removal. 
I have for the most part been treated exceptionally well by the friendly and competent staff.  
----  The one exception--- a woman who seemed to be lacking in professionalism and compassion. 
I won't go into detail ( privacy ;))
But after the issue- I spoke with Linda and was impressed with her sincerity, professionalism and compassion. 
I am coming back due to the clinic activity fixing a difficult situation. 
Well done!

Finally found my go to salon in Durham! Yay! 

I have been struggling for years to find a salon near by that does great acrylic nails. This place is awesome!

I called ahead and was able to book a last minute appointment for my sister and myself, which was awesome! When we arrived, the salon was fairly busy for a Monday morning, but they let us choose our colours and took us right away! Awesome. 
Ladies!!(Or gents!) the colour selection here is phenomenal. Truly. For both shellac and regular polish! I usually struggle to find a colour I love, but this time it was hard for me to decide which I loved most! 
The salon was clean. Definitely not a luxury spa, but I am very particular when it comes to sanitation and cleanliness of a spa, and they pretty much passed my test. Only downfall, is that they don't use disposable liners for pedicures! But then again, unfortunately not too many places do..

Overall, I'm extremely happy with my nail shape and colour. the man who did my nails did an excellent job!  
Price was standard for the area, and well worth it! I will definitely be returning soon and bringing more people with me!

Actual rating 3.5.

Really adequate at best.  I was immediately creeped out by the fact that the booths had very badly stained upholstery on them.  After seeing all the stains, I couldn't possibly feel comfortable sitting back in my seat and let my hair touch that nasty fabric.  Looking past the stains, I couldn't help but notice that the entire decor of the place felt like a tired dentist office waiting room.  Not very appealing to say the least.

I got the three egg and four slices of bacon breakfast.  I asked for eggs sunny side up and they were a bit overcooked.  The rye toast was dripping with butter, so points there, lol.  The home fries were tasty, but I couldn't have more than a few because I am sure they were laced with MSG.  

All in all, the meal was decent.  The server was pleasant enough, but it took a while to get our food.

House made pastas, sauces and most ingredients! And 90% of the cooks were Indian! No wonder the spicy Penne was 'desi style'! If you are craving for Italian then this is a must visit! 
We were 2 adults and 2 kids! Ordered 3 main dishes and 1 appetizer and that was surely enough! The drinks were good too - Pomtini was delish! 
Great decor and service too!
Good food, fair prices. And the good news is they will soon be open in the evenings.

Great value for a handwash!  Sometimes the line gets long.  Staff are friendly.  They give it 85%+ every time, and considering the cost, that's a great value!

sometimes they close earlier than stated hours, if they aren't busy.

The wraps here are solid but be careful because feta, jalapeños, tabouli, olives, etc. will cost you extra. I got the 12' falafel wrap with all the extras for around $14 with no drink or sides. The falafel wrap was great with all the additions. The falafel was great because of all the add ons which added tons of flavor and keep the falafel moist but overall I thought it was expensive. I know, I know, eating out is expensive but this is only worth the money if you are craving a solid wrap. If you get a wrap without the extras and aren't that hungry you can get a 8.5' wrap for around $8-$11 with no drink or sides. Check it out for yourself...

love the atmosphere...so relaxing and nice

perfect place to study and i love the Godiva cheesecake

Now this is what we need!  A terrific coffee shop, serving a very nice coffee, offering a wide assortment of sandwiches, soups, cakes and snacks.  Lots is seating.  Hardly anyone with laptops.  Shhhh!  Don't tell too many people about that.  They need to open more of these stores.  Leaps and bounds better than a Tims.   Fast and friendly service to boot.

The service and ambience was good, but the food was okay.. maybe I should have ordered something different. I had the Connolly and it was kind of plain.. it tasted bland and boring, and like the other reviewer said, its missing that 'something'. My red wine was good, can't go wrong. My dessert was good (crème Brule) but not the best.. I had better. It was my first time, so I don't know if I would go again.. but I herd good reviews for the Toronto location, so maybe I will give this restaurant another chance, and I said Maybe.

It's the night out with my 9 year old niece & she wanted fish and chips. So I drove up on Bailey's and found this little place called Balmoral Fish and chips. I had to admit I wasn't too keen about trying it but was greatly surprised. Yes it's a fried Halibut but it was good.  Do ask for Emely she's a sweetheart with a great service and a huge smile. It was really worth it

Greeted immediately. Friendly conversation. Busy little place. 
Great big burger. Well constructed. Very enjoyable. 
Would like to see fresh cut fries and home made gravy in the future though. A soda fountain would also help with the diner feel.

Happy to have Il Fornello out in Ajax, my Toronto buds are always surprised when I suggest we eat there, they can't believe there's an Il Fornello out here. I'm a consistent fettuccine alfredo consumer and my friends  eat everything else on the menu with gusto! I have also taken advantage of the $5 Margherita Mondays, an amazing deal!

Consistently great food and great service! We have gone dozens of times since they have opened. I love that it is great for our whole family.  They are my benchmark for a margarita pizza.   They are also amazing with my daughter's milk allergy - always making her feel safe and doing what it takes to ensure there is no cross contamination.

Sadly, this is the best option for Chinese food in Ajax.  Not as typical for "Canadian style" Chinese food.
Service is definitely typical though. Had my 2 young children under the age of 3, diaper bags, booster seats, etc, early lunch hour on a weekday,  The host/ owner? was very rude about the space I took up with our belongings, although there was absolutely NO ONE else in the restaurant.
Great food and super nice staff. I have a lot of diet restrictions and they were able to accommodate everything I asked and were extremely nice about it.

A burger chain that is a cross between Wendy's and Subway. That is, great tasting burgers where you get to pick the type of bun and toppings you want with it.

There's a significant variety of toppings that gives you a lot of options to try. And, like I alluded to, the burgers are very good.
Fries are decent, not super amazing, but a worthwhile side to your burger. 

They cater for kids too, having varied sized burgers, including smaller ones for smaller appetites.

Casino is a little tight for space. No service, you have to serve your own drinks. Folders coffee was gawd awful, I left it on a machine. Place seems lacking a lot. 

The restaurant....producing decent food is not hard. The food is terrible. Pre packaged frozen food on every tsble. I sent my fish back as it was very mushy. At least the frozen desserts where safe. I've been to many ontario casinos and have never had such poor food. Put a little effort in! 

I won't be back.

We went first to this place upon opening. Portions were big. Prices were a little higher but manageable because of the quality and quantity of food. Now we have noticed quality and quantity have slipped and are quite disappointed only because we knew what this place use to be. Also we feel the prices don't match up to the quality and quantity served. We rarely come here now. And I mean rarely, only for events that we are invited to.

Came here numerous times for oil changes and never had an issue until recently they did the differential fluid and I found out they only did the rear after saying they would be doing front and rear.

Scam artist that did nothing to fix the issue 

Go somewhere else!!!!
Best sharwarma in Ajax, plate and wrap are so delicious. Prices are a little high than other places
Not much of any particular thing.  Big store but terrible selection for theme parties.  Those items they do have seem over prices.

Went here on a friday night and was very disappointing as soon as we pulled up. We had a great coupon so I decided to give it a try regardless of what my spidey-sense was telling me. Wow this place looked like a seinor citizens club from the 70's. Its very clear that this place hasn't been changed since before the jays won the world series. walls are cluttered with old sports memorabilia purchased when Bi-Way was still around.  We decided on have wings, just the wings. Hot, Hot & honey garlic. They were large, but not that tasty, Meh. Nothing special at all they didn't even bother to do the basics well,  Half of my wings were half coated in my desired sauce. Its safe to say we wont be returning to this place. Now i know why there were 8 people in the bar, including staff and customers.

Worst service and cleaning ever! They called me complaining that the car is dirty! Confused as this is the reason why I took my car in. Because my car was too "dirty" they charged me an extra 20$. Fine. But when I got my car they didn't even do a good job! Still crumbs and salt left behind. The interior was barely wiped cleaned. I could have done it myself for such a mediocre job. Owner was unprofessional won't be recommending this place to anyone!
Best breakfast ever!! I stopped here on a road trip & I have to say everything was delicious & cooked to perfection. It's definitely a must have!

Greasy spoon. Had brunch here today for the first and last time. Toast was warm bread with melted butter...was maybe waved over a toaster but it certainly wasn't toast. Eggs were overcooked  and home fries were a mush of potatoes with some type of coating...disgusting. Server removed plates and could have cared less that the plates were still full of food. In a good restaurant, if food was not eaten, they would at least have asked if there was a problem. Then again in a good restaurant, they would never have served this.
Will drive into Whitby or Oshawa in future.

Super nice staff and my dog really liked it!  They provide cage free doggy day care and overnight care for dogs and cats, the lady also runs a rescue out of the place which shows that she really cares for animals and this is not just a business for them.  

I toured the entire place before and they offer a free trial which I took them up on.  The place is not fancy by any means...but hey...I don't think my dog really cared.  It was clean, smells overwhelmingly of doggy and has a really nice outdoor area, one for big dogs another for smaller dogs.

This is a great option if you are looking for pet boarding where your pet can mingle with other dogs, run freely outside for at least part of the day and is'nt too expensive.

Basic diner-like atmosphere, but good food at a decent price. This afternoon, we ordered breakfast and it was at the table inside 3 minutes. And hot and fresh. Also, toast was not dry and cold, like so many places. I should come here more often.

Horrible job. Just. Horrible.......


I'm re-writing this review again because I called after I left and realized how they left spots and marks everywhere and I called to complain about it and the fucking PUSSY hung up the phone on me because he didn't want to hear a customer complain. 

Reality check, if it isn't for the customers your  ass wouldn't be getting paid working at this good for nothing car wash. You don't want to hear people fucking complain, how about you do your job right!

This is my first bad review and by far worse experience I have ever had from a business owner. I would ask for my money back but maybe you should use it to better your fake ass car wash. 

I saw the other cars they washed too... horrible fucking job. I wish I would of wiped my ass with that tip money I gave. Good luck on your next job since this won't last long. Due to the owner.

I understand the concept of you get what you pay for. If that is the case I should of been paying 5 bucks. 

I called the shop listen on yelp expecting its the number to the wash. Turns out it's the actual owner. Let me tell you guys what he decided to do this morning when I called to ask for the owner or manager. 

When I asked, he said "why do you want the owner? What happened, why you calling" 

I proceeded to tell him how the wash was horrible and I would like a refund or credit for another wash. Bite before I can mention that he decided he didn't care at all about me, the paying customer that's putting food on his fucking plate. So I called back, no answer. Call again and he starts to cuss at me, meanwhile still hasn't admitted he's the owner. I eventually found out he was the owner through my sources. I hope you are reading this, the owner who needs to get disciplined by his parents. You are a asshole, and don't deserve shit. I hope one day you realize your attitude can cost you. Therefore I will be the first to try to make you understand. I'm leaving a terrible review for both of your car washes in Ajax and Oshawa. You will be reported to the better business bureau. I hope you wake up and small the coffee. Before it's too late. Good luck on your business and future.

My partner and I have been here four times and have loved it every time. The fresh bread is incredible, and their $10 weeknight pizza deal is great! The pizza is delicious and has never disappointed. The customer service is top notch and the atmosphere is rustic and modern. We will definitely be returning! :)

I thought about fixing my phone's cracked LCD screen myself, but the part from Amazon would cost $60 and it would take at least a week to get here. Contacted Fixtronic for a quote and it would be $40 more for them to fix it. Dropped by 6pm to give them the phone and came back at 7:30pm same day, the phone looked like it was brand new. Couldn't be happier!

Best burger in Ajax hands down ! 
Every time I go there they never seem to fail me actually they always rise above ! ( except once but I will explain ) 
I get the banquet burger with fries and gravy for less then 10 (because I go for the student special 11 - 3 )
I technically gave this place a 4.8 because on one visit the cook was not all there that day and I believe he under cooked my burger ! But other then that it's usually cooked to perfection and they have the best fries ever  and gravy is good ! 

They use too have caramelized onions but not anymore I guess but still Amazing !!

Oh how much I hate this casino. And I loves me some casinos!

The entrance is beautiful and it's nicely located out of the main part of town. Parking can be an issue but they have a shuttle that goes around the parking lot for those rainy days that you can't be bothered to walk to the doors.

But when you get INTO the casino, its a huge let down. The place is packed with machines and even after the expanded it, it's still far too crowded. It's hard to get onto a machine at just about any time of the day or night (we've gone during the middle of the day during the week and during the middle of the night on weekends, its always the same) and the machines are so closely packed together that its hard to move between them to make your way through the casino.

I don't know who's bright idea it was to pick machines, but whoever did it at this location picked far too many high roller machines. $5 a spin? I think not. There's an entire area of the casino that sits empty because everyone wants to pay penny, nickle, dime and quarter slots (and this high roller area is a sizable area too).

The complimentary drinks are nice but I do find that the staff stare you down. This could be because I'm 26 and look like I'm 19 but still... I'm inside, clearly I'm legal so leave me alone to gamble. The bathrooms are gorgeous as well, but it really doesn't make up for repeated lacklustre gambling experiences. I'll spend the extra money and time heading up to the Blue Heron for better machine selection and more room to move around.

Oh and for the record: compared with other casinos, I've had decent luck here. I walk out with the same amount of money I came in with 1/4 times. Not bad...

The best chicken shawarma plate I've ever had.  And their potatoes are so good!  The only thing stopping me from giving it 5 stars is the price. For a chicken shawarma plate and feta on my salad its almost $15.  

Super friendly staff too!

I actually made a Yelp account so I can warn others about their MEDIOCRE food, sub par atmosphere and the WORST service you will ever experience at any restaurant, not just in Durham but in the GTA.  The wait staff in the evenings has attitude like you've never experienced, they are condescending and have no real knowledge of customer service.  It is the type of establishment that acts like they're doing YOU a favour by serving you.  Its unfortunate but most other Il Fornellos especially Bayview and Downtown are quite the opposite even in terms of food.  Ajax, please pull up your socks; if not a change in staff, at least a lesson or two in people skills and how to earn your tip instead of just expecting it.

Everyone raves about this place so I thought I'd try it. I ordered the chicken shawarma plate which was 11$ ish on the menu. I found they were stingy on basically everything... I got two potatoes with my meal and the whole thing was rice and salad with a few pickles, onions, peppers etc. when I got to the cash to pay it was $15 because some toppings aren't included in the plate? Extremely disappointing. I've had cheaper shawarma plates in the past and gotten way more food. Don't get me wrong the food was tasty... Just not 15$ for lunch tasty. I will be seeking out a different place for shawarma next time.

I had a really nice meal here on my first night in Toronto. It strikes me as a fast-casual restaurant - yet they manage to create a warm interior that is inviting. We split a beet salad which was pretty standard and I went for the rigatoni with a Bolognese; the others tried the baked cannelloni and the salmon dinner. Perfectly fine meal - nothing terribly wrong and yet nothing out-of-the-ordinary "hey welcome to Toronto let's do this up" either. I would consider this a safe bet for a lovely Italian meal.

It was great, we had shrimp and snow crab legs with the captains boil sauce. And the server was great as well we had originally ordered the crawfish but they weren't what we thought they were so she brought us the shrimp instead.
Best fish and chip place that I've ever had, batter is light and fluffy. Have gone to this place ever since I was little and has always been the best.

Ok everyone, this is the real deal!!  Do not be hesitant, because this business is not a storefront, it is so legit. I have a 2 yr old iPhone 6 Plus with a unique problem that NO ONE could figure out. Best Rogers could say to me after 2 hours on the phone was to "buy a new one". Took it to Fixtronic, 2 hours and $90 later.. phone as good as new. Seriously.... you have nothing to lose by trying.
Awesome breakfast and lunch place.  Always fast and consistent quality.  Service is also great.

So we decided to go for another round.  
The wine selection is good but expensive - if it was unique to them that's one thing but I know what I pay for it in the liquor store.

The staff is great - friendly funny interactive - but the food is terrible.  My meal was taken off because it was unedible.  How can you order Italian pasta and the food be terrible - that's on the kitchen.
