I'm thinking it will be a huge jump as to us going back - even the Caesar had rotten lettuce ... quality control is everything!

Typical party supply store.  The bonus is that you can pretty much find everything here - so for that 4 Stars..the price seems to be all over the place.  I ended up finding some things at the dollar store that I could have used instead...but at this store it was like 3 times the price.  I should have gone to the dollar store first.  Although if PP has a sale you can get pretty unique things for a good price.  And of course their Halloween costumes are awesome (if not a tad bit expensive!) but hey..it's just once a year!

Not a great place.  For one, it is not at all clean.  From the moment you walk in, there is either an overwhelming smell of urine, or bleach mixed with urine.  Whether you leave your pet there for one day at daycare or for boarding, they will be returned to you reeking of urine, and gritty with dirt.  Dirt I can deal with.  Urine, no way.  You will not want to touch your dog after a stay here.  I know some dogs like to roll around in all sorts of things, but I had more than one dog here (one of which did not like to roll around) and they both reeked upon pickup.  I also knew 3 other pet owners who had similar experiences.  I chalked it up originally to standard "kennel smell" but have since taken my dogs to several other "free play" kennels and non-free play kennels-- they've never smelled the way they did at Ajax.

The worst thing though-- my dog was seriously injured while in the care of the Ajax Pet Centre.  I was told my dog was in a fight with another dog, and had started the fight.  However, both the vet and the surgeon who cared for my dog advised that the wounds inflicted indicate my dog was in a defensive position (bitten on the inside of the rear leg).  The other clue that my dog was not the aggressor was that there was no bleeding or inflammation around his mouth or gums, indicating that my dog had not bitten anything.  These two observations were made independently by both the vet and the surgeon.

Unlike other petcare centres, Ajax does not provide "doggy-cams" for you to observe your dogs, or to witness the care they receive.  I'd think twice before taking your four-legged friends here.
Great customer service. Great tasting food so far although I haven't had much. Prices are a bit expensive I mean I'm not really interested in paying 7 bucks for a smoothie

I just went to South St. Burger Co. for the first time (in Ajax), & thought I'd share.  It's a slightly more upscale burger joint with nicer decor & ambiance than your average burger shack.  They do a few things to help separate them from other places, & give them a different identity.  Their prices are a bit higher than standard fast food places, more like Lick's or Five Guys Burgers & Fries.  For this review, I'll be comparing South St. head-to-head vs Five Guys.

First, I'll start with the atmosphere, since it's one of the first things you notice when you walk in.  South St has nicer decor, furniture, & ambiance.  Like I said before, it feels more like a restaurant than Five Guys, which definitely has more of a fast-food feel to it.  When you're going out for a burger, you don't need anything fancy, but sometimes it's nice to sit at a table & not feel like you're sitting down to quickly wolf down your meal.  The food isn't served on standard plastic meal trays, but in aluminum pie pans, which is different.  Their tray liners are circular to fit the pie pans, & it's a neat idea that I'd never seen before.  South St definitely wins in this category.

Next, I'll move on to the most important category & talk about the burgers.  South St. gives you the option of a white or whole grain kaiser, which is a nice choice to have, & not one offered at many burger joints.  The buns are done by a local bakery, & mine was nice & fresh.  They use hormone & antibiotic-free beef, while Five Guys website just states that they use "fresh ground beef" & that nothing is ever frozen.  South St gives you one large patty on their standard burger, whereas Five Guys gives you two smaller patties.  South St burgers are flame-grilled, compared to Five Guys & their flattop.  I prefer the flame-grilled taste, & the larger patty, so I've got to go with South St.  Their burger was cooked perfectly, & was very juicy.  Five Guys burgers were good too, but I have to side with South St on this one, although that's just my personal preference.  Another reason I think they're better is that they offer a wider array of toppings & sauces, as well as five different kinds of cheese to choose from.  They offer four different types of mustard, two kinds of ketchup, four relishes, three different mayos & three kinds of sauces to enhance & personalize your burger.  A tidbit on Five Guys' website states that there are over 250,000 possible ways to order a burger at Five Guys, & because I suck at math, I can only guess that means there's over 1,000,000 different ways to order at South St.  Another important factor to consider is price, & whereas Five Guys will charge you $6.49 for a regular burger, South St's price is only $5.75, & you get a $1.00 discount if you buy a combo, unlike Five Guys.

Next is the battle of the fries, which some people would argue is as important as the burgers.  South St uses New York Fries, whereas Five Guys uses freshly cut, homemade fries.  Even though South St's website states that their NYF are hand-cut daily from fresh potatoes as well, the edge here goes to Five Guys.  Their fries are better than some chip trucks I've been to, & the portion is massive.  Two people can easily split an order of their fries, & even though a regular order of fries is $1.00 more than South St, it's well worth the extra dollar.  The NYF portion is standard & I just didn't enjoy their fries as much.  Even though they have several different seasonings to use on the fries, Five Guys have got them beat here.

Miscellaneous factors, Five Guys offers free refills, & while South St might offer them too (I don't know), you'd have to go back up to the counter to get it, which is a pain, particularly if you're there at a busy time.  It's nicer when you can just go refill your own cup, so Five Guys gets another nod here.  The free peanuts offered by Five Guys surely appeal to some, but I doubt anyone goes there specifically for that reason.  Besides, those peanuts are so incredibly over-salted, that you should be entitled to those free refills by law.  One other small thing that South St does better than Five Guys is their website.  Their menu actually has prices on it, so you can see for yourself what things will cost, & you're not soiling your pants when you find out your total.  Also, South St uses local businesses for supplies & lists many different ways that they "go green" whenever possible.  Some people might not care, but I think it's nice to see a business with a conscience.

So after all that, I've got to give the edge to South St. Burger Co. over Five Guys Burgers & Fries.  Aside from the flame-grilled burgers & wide array of toppings & sauces, they were a slightly better value, they did more of the "little things" right, which is why I gave them three stars to Five Guys' two.  I'm still waiting for Big Boy's Burgers to open in Whitby, & I'll be sure to post on them ASAP.  In the spirit of Christmas, Season's Eatings, everyone!

Went back here the other day and this time, with a friend who has driven by the place since he now works in the area.  Happy to say that he enjoyed his meal and service very much.  I was also happy as usual, with special thanks to Eugenia.

This time I had their Bacon Cheeseburger which really hit the spot. Mind you, it tasted pretty much like any other bacon cheeseburger but I loved how generous they were with the bacon! Bacon is life, afterall.  Also, the burger was huge.  I can't believe I actually ate the whole thing.  I guess it was that good that I didn't want to really take any home.  Instead, I brought home the rest of the fries and their delicious gravy.  4/5.

Speaking of their gravy, make sure you get a side of gravy if you're going to have fries.  It's absolutely delicious and the portion is big that 2-3 people can share it.  5/5.

Now, their coffee is probably the best out there next to McDonald's.  It's so good that I actually had about a cup and a half with my burger.  I mean, who has coffee with a burger?? 5/5

After a dull winter, it was time to peel off the dull. SkinVitality is not your usual spa with the scented candles and soft music. You don't get an esthetician, you get a cosmetic nurse! Kate was delightful. I'd never had a peel and I was given 2 choices for the complementary peel: Vivier peel and Glycolic peel. She explained what both contain and what they are good for to different skin types.

I thought a peel would coat my face with a mask and then peel it off. Wrong! These peel over a weeks time. I went for the Vivier peel. The cleansing part before the peel was more uncomfortable than the actual peel. She really made sure your skin is prepped for the application. It was tingly and there was a little heat, but nothing I couldn't handle.

I was told how to take care of my skin after and what to expect. I would've liked a check list or something to take with me. After a few days, I was forgetting what Kate had told me to do. 

The peeling process was interesting. I think I expected to peel like snake skin, but this was not the case. It was gradual, not shocking. I almost felt like I should peel more than I did, but I'm not sure if that was my fault because I forgot to do what Kate told me! (Oops!) My skin has definitely lost that dull hue and I have a nice glow. Perfect time of year for a peel!

Kate was very professional and made it a calming experience. The word 'peel' isn't a gentle word, but she made it an easy process.

I'd definitely come back and do it again!

This place is a joke. I write this review as a warning to all. My family ordered the combo for 3 which included beef and chicken. We did delivery. After we opened it they gave us two containers of celery with 3 pieces of tiny meat in it each. I called them to see if they would give me what i ordered. They said essentially too bad all of our meat dishes are 80% vegetable. She went on to tell me that i was the one who said i didnt want any onions. As if giving me 2 bowls of celery AND ONIONS would of made up for the fact that there was no chicken in my cashew chicken or beef in my szechuan beef. What a joke. She said every single chef can verify that they counted my pieces of meat. Riiiiiiiight. What a joke. I was totally pissed. 40 bucks and every one in my family went to bed hungry.

Best Haddock and chips in Durham if not Ontario :)
Husband and wife team are super friendly and always remember my order every time I walk in. Have tried other places out of convenience but always come back to Balmoral. Fair prices too. 
Definitely recommend.

Quite disappointed at this Il Fornello. 

Hostess: Surly and didn't let us know we could sit at the bar. Had to wait despite seeing lots of empty tables. 

Waiter: Andrew D gave us lots of attitude and little of his attention. 

Food: Caesar salad was okay (lacked the saltiness of anchovies). Enjoyed the Calamari. Husband loved his Fettucine Alfredo. My Linguine di Mare was meh. 

Dessert: Didn't have any because Andrew D left us alone for 20 minutes. By then, I wanted to GTFO. 

We asked for the bill and waited another 5 minutes for the machine. 

Summary: I wouldn't come here again. I'd rather trek to the city either to another Il Fornello location or another (better) Italian place. Just because it's the suburbs doesn't mean we don't deserve good service and food.
Great location, unique of this kind in Ajax. I ordered a bouquet in advanced , and went later to pick it up. Good experience overall

Stopped by to see what this place is... and bought a couple packages of cheese.  Definitely a cheese specialty shop.   The owner was very patient and informative and offered samples of any cheese there.   I learned about how much I don't know about cheese!  Impressive variety and they have sandwiches, too.
Nice, clean gym. Lots of parking. Chill atmosphere. Good classes. Nice but not overbearing staff.

This if for the OLG Ajax Downs casino.

I will just review the restaurant, as I could not spend much time gambling today (but will return for that).

One odd thing about getting there - the nearest parking is a long walk.  Could have been planned better.

The restaurant is pleasant, with nice full-length windows to look out on the racetrack, a great view with a few horses exercising.

The food is okay, though I can never understand why any chef thinks frozen French fries are acceptable to eat.

Service, unfortunately, was worse than poor.  Staff is apparently untrained, same as at other OLG casinos, where the attitude seems to be that if the food or most of it somehow gets to you and not too much of it is spilled or forgotten, and you don't mind eating your soup and cold main course at the same time, the customer should be satisfied.  "I don't know" should be an acceptable answer to questions about the food, and "I'm new here" should excuse any other mistakes a waiter makes.

In this case we ordered 2 soups and 2 main courses after struggling with the waitress's total lack of understanding of the menu.  So we were both having the same thing.  After a long, long time, one of the soups was delivered by a different waitress.  When we asked about the other soup, she explained that she had seen the one soup sitting in the kitchen and knew it was for our table so brought it out. Never a thought that there were two of us.  Then she chatted in a corner with other staff, forgetting us.

After another long wait, the other soup arrived with the 2 main courses.  I mean, give me a break.  When asked to keep my companion's main course warm until he ate his soup, the plate disappeared until much later, when it came out cold.  A similar experience to the Blue Heron restaurant - are they conspiring against us?

This restaurant was an ordeal I do not want to repeat.  OLG casino restaurants, all of you, please train your wait staff in the basics of food service so I don't have to go through this every bliddy time.

Out of the few Coffee Culture locations I've been to, this one consistently has the best tasting coffee. Their products are always fresh and the coffee doesn't taste watered down compared to other locations (and other chains). Kudos to the staff and management!

Sitting area is very clean and comfortable with plenty of power outlets and free wifi. This is the perfect place to bring your laptop and get some work done when it's not busy.

Awesomeness while you wait! Not perfect but let me say to have a full clean inside and out 25 for an SUV... they save me time .. time saves me money ... as I said they are not perfect some things get left but close to perfection and I didn't have to do it!

Regular!

Good place to go and grab dessert and relax. Go there 2-3 times a month and have always seen some new dessert. Prices are what you would expect. Much better environment that Starbucks. Not a five rating because I have had some of the drinks that were not really anything special/ had a tea that was basically water. Go get some cake!

Wait staff were good despite it being busy and wait times were alright. 

All our pizzas were a little burnt in spots and the knives were so blunt, none of them would cut without just tearing the food apart. 

Pizza fichi is the best with figs and honey. 

Bit expensive.

Only reserve tables after 8 but you can do it through their website.

My wife and I had been here previously and were quite pleased with it.  So we decided to go back and treat ourselves to a nice breakfast one Saturday.  Got in and to a table very quickly and ordered.  And then it all went downhill....  we waited and we waited and we waited....  After 15 minutes another server came by to ask if we had ordered.  No asking about refilled our coffee (my cup actually had a chip out of it).  And another 30 minutes or more and no food.  Other tables came in later and were served before us.  We had seen our server spend time at the cash.  She eventually came by to say that they were really busy and apologized for the slow service.  Problem is that both my wife and I saw her take our orders out of her pocket, look at them and them put them in at the kitchen.  So she forgot to put the orders in and then LIED about it.  She had nothing to say in response to us saying we saw what she had done.   The "manager" tried to make nice, by some flimsy apology and then he gave us the "employee discount" which basically covered the price of our coffee.  Should have walked out and left them to figure out what to do with our food when they finally got it made.  Which by the way, the home fries were burnt and some parts of our meal never came.
This is not a place to go when looking for a nice treat for a weekend breakfast !!

Being lactose intolerant and going into a cheese shop is a bit of a death wish. However, walking into Country Cheese Company was far from it. Yes, they have an amazing assortment of cow's milk cheeses but the variety they have for those like me was amazing and exciting.  Imagine being able to have cheese again that's not fake!

Not only were there lactose free options but also sheep and goat's milk. I had NO idea that sheep and goat cheeses could have so much flavour! The staff are fantastic with suggesting types and figuring out how much you really need. 

I walked out with the Honey Bee Goat Gouda which is hands down the best cheese I have ever had, a goat blue cheese, a lactose free olive and tomato and a pecorino. 
If I could have dairy I would have loved to try the Sticky Toffee Cheese it just sounds outstanding. 

You'll love your experience here.
Overpriced. Small portions. The kind of joint you leave somewhat hungry, unless you fill up on lots of bread. Not worth a return trip.
One of my favourite spots in Ajax to grab breakfast. The wait staff is friendly and greets me with a warm welcome. The food is good and service is fast and attentive.
I didn't find the food amazing, the flavour was quite simple. The omelete was huge but honestly didn't enjoyed. The steak was good though. The staff was friendly.

It's been a while since I visited il Fornello's, but I'm glad I did. I was told there was a 15 minute wait for the dining room, so we decided to eat in the bar. Service was quick and attentive. Food was amazing, wifey loves the Margarita Pizza. Will comes again.

Update: It looks like they recently increased their prices. I used to be able to get a simple breakfast sandwich with home fries and coffee for just under $11 with tip. Now it's nearly $14.50 and they charged me 75 cents to add a tomato to the sandwich. Talk about nickel and diming.

The food was reasonably tasty, but the portions were too small for the price.  I also notice other reviewers here writing of being offered bread with their meals.  None was offered to me or my guest.
The service was borderline terrible in this place.  The girl who sat us at our table and who brought the food (not the waitress) was miserable and likely wouldn't have smiled and been polite if I had offered her $20 to do so.  Despite me being polite (as I always am) she was passive-aggressively hostile.  I'd say thank you to her and she would just walk away.  
The waitress was passable, but never came to check if everything was all right with our meals (as most servers will do in restaurants) and we had to sit there well after being done eating and scan the dining room for her so we could flag her down for our bill.
Even the greeter at the front desk was taciturn and seemed like he didn't want to be there.  I saw very few smiling faces among the staff, so I wonder why everyone is so dour around this place.
The men's washroom was quite clean, so at least they are up to snuff in that regard.  Perhaps they should shut down the dining room and keep the washrooms open.

You blew it with me, Il Fornello.  I won't be back.

I came in on a weekday night.  Was seated right away & had a drink in my hand within 5 mins.  Ordered breakfast & it came in about 15 mins fresh & hot.  I don't know about the negative reviews about the service but these servers were happy, pleasant & trying to make the meal a pleasurable experience.  I would definately eat here again.

This used to be my favourite gyro spot. The flavour was great, the servings were generous and the prices were reasonable. 

However, now that all pita lands have been standardized, this place went from a 4.5/5 to a 2/5. The prices increased while the servings got much smaller. In addition, a bunch of the free toppings became premium toppings which you have to pay extra for.

I noticed a difference in the taste too. I think the taste has gotten much more bland compared to before.

Standardization is not always a good thing!

This is a new location. I thought it was pretty good! I really liked the atmosphere, and the patio looked like a great spot to go for drinks with friends (I didn't use it, but I really wanted to!)
The service was really good - attentive and polite.
The food was good. It wasn't gourmet food - but it was really good. I had the chicken parm. Although I couldn't finish it all because I was so full..I really wanted to!

All-in-all I'd go back again! It's basically an Italian version of The Keg. And it's a great spot....must go back to sit on the patio!!!!
I try the Nachos burger which made me sick after. The guacamole was old abtasted horrible. The older woman with square glasses has a bad attitude. I highly don't recommend this place.

2.5 stars

they left the doors to the patio wide open for the breeze to flow through to the bar. patio is quite spacious and fenced off from the parking lot so you get to enjoy your dining experience undisturbed. it was slightly chilly out of the sun, so we opted to sit in the bar dining area.

service was attentive, and food came out in reasonable time. the CALAMARI FRITTI was quite tender; and the SALAMI BOARD was a bit skimpy but hard to mess up.

my date and I had a MARGHERITA PIZZA to share and it was definitely over salted. for a pizza with such simple ingredients, you'd think they'd get it right?!

nothing was horrible but I don't particularly feel inclined to return either.

I would NOT recommend this dog care facility to anyone!! I went into their Ajax location on Kingston Road two weeks prior to book my puppy "Koda" in for an overnight boarding, I had an out-of-town wedding to attend.  They marked Koda on the calendar for a one night overstay, and informed me I would need a Bordetella vacine, which I had done.  I called them a week prior to confirm Koda was signed up for sure, and they said yes, and I asked them if they could send me the paperwork to fill out to save us time on the Saturday when we drop off our puppy. The girl said we could come in anytime to fill our the papers, so we did on the Tuesday night at 4pm, and to our surprise, there were two girls there, one gave us the sheet to fill out and the other girl said "oh no I won't be here for one dog, I have the weekend off",  she then called over to their other location on Finley and got the owner on the phone to talk to me, and she informed me because there was only one dog "Koda", booked it was not worth paying a staff  member so she gave her the weekend off, but..... I could bring Koda to her Finley location and he would be all by himself with no one there, but she could monitor him by camera from her house can you imagine? not acceptable!!! so I was out on a limb, if I had of brought Koda there on the Saturday  morning the place would have been locked up.  They don't care about our pets, only the money! So Koda had the vacine for nothing at our expense and I had to cancel our plans. They have no business ethics WHATSOEVER!!!  

Koda's Mom - Whitby

Way back in the day this place was packed......oh but now it is a disappointment - I ordered fish and chips here and the fish was greasy and sub par run of the mill batter.

Really wished I had just went to Balmoral instead - wasted my money and a whole lot of calories on a crap meal. :-(

Weekday SLOTS alway makes me feel Young & Alive.
At least in this environment, I'm probably 99% younger than core patrons.

Free Self-serve Beverages?   (Coffee, Tea, Fountain Pop only)

1. Choose Beverage
2. Put head under dispenser
3. Push lever
4. Chug beverage until mouth foams

Doesn't replace McD's $1 summer drink days.
There's no drive-thru and no disposable cups.

My Lunch-special Friend found the Penny-special Slot.
High roller indeed.   :P

CDN/USD @1.01
On par with Banks without the line-ups on Weekdays.
No Bank Card required either if I'm correct.

Whole place sounds like pinballs, if you're nostalgic.
No coin sounds since machines dispense ticket instead.

I miss the sound-o-money.   : (

Typical American style Chinese food. If you are looking for a quick, cheap lunch or take-out, this place is a good bet. I definitely prefer the Ajax location to the Scarborough location. My kids love the special golden fingers. Similar to chicken balls but longer and crispier. The egg rolls are excellent in flavour- although a bit greasy- but what type of Chinese food isn't? Calling ahead is always preferred for takeout. If you would prefer no MSG remember to specify when ordering.

This place is awesome! The burgers taste delicious and the fries are NY fries...who doesn't love them. The burgers have a great taste to them...I hate getting a burger and having it taste like nothing...these burgers have flavour. Plus you can get NY fries plain, poutine or onion rings and homemade milkshakes. We live about 25 minutes away and have no problem making the trip for these awesome burgs. :)
Beautifully decorated with a great patio.  Food is good and the fried mozzarella balls are fantastic.

Really loved the fish & chips!

We ordered the haddock and halibut and they were both delicious

They use a tempura style batter that's light and not too greasy 

The fries taste like chip truck and were great!
I went here on Saturday. The food was amazing. It's a little pricey. If you are looking for a great Italian Restaurant this is the place.

Usually I love their food but this location was horrible. We came in around 11am and were "served" by the most inattentive waitress. She forgot to bring part of my order, never came back to check on us etc. The ketchup was 100% expired, the restaurant was freezing and to top it all off the eggs were super overcooked, the bacon was as salty as the sea and uber greasy. Even the orange slices they provided were mushy. When we went up to pay our "waitress" tried to make small talk with us...the kind of small talk you make when your fishing for a tip.

Will absolutely never return to this location. If you are looking for a great Eggsmart with perfect food head on over to whitby. They never disappoint!

Actually more like a 4.5, had the True North, an excellent little burger - opted for the 4oz, not disappointed- or hungry. Great flavours, you can taste the difference fresh makes - I'm not sure which restaurants tag line that is but it applies here 100%, nice ambiance in restaurant, great accompaniment to NYF.
This guy was awesome. iPad screen was cracked and he had it fixed in an hour at a very affordable price. Hooked us up with a nice cover and screen protector as well. Will use again!

I came here to see a movie after a dinner out and some shopping. This particular Cineplex is located at Highway 2 and Salem on the east side of Salem, north of Highway 2 in the Home Depot/Canadian Tire plaza.

This has never been one of my favourite theaters, probably because its poorly laid out and that can cause some issues. When we came in, there was a HUGE lineup of people waiting and since I was using a gift certificate, we had to wait too instead of going to the faster self service kiosks. A note, as with any cineplex, any 3D movie requires an additional fee if you're using a gift certificate. And no, you don't get scene points on that :(

My main issue with this theater is the concessions area. Not only is it wide open but there's no discernible lines. It's hard to tell which cashier is open and available and people are constantly butting in line, making the wait for popcorn rather annoying. On a very busy night, this place is insane so beware.

All of the theaters here are fairly small as far as theaters go. Not super sloped so if you get stuck behind a tall person, you might be SOL. The seats are usual theater seats and they don't have the cool mobile games at this location. 

Overall, this theater is just your basic movie theatre, nothing mcuh worth nothing but it does the job.

This location primarily serves the drive-thru needs of the commuter traffic with a large driveway and dedicated in/out entrances. When approaching this store,  you must enter from the street on the south side as the access directly from Westney Rd is only for exiting northbound. Exiting southbound is only by the south side road. 

Even so, the inside is well laid out and always friendly staff.
1st time getting dinner to go . Awesome homemade burgers  yummy!!!!  Few things I'd love to see would be while wheat buns , sweat potatoes fries ,  and home cut fries . But we will go back .

This place was decent, efficient, and served its purpose. I got the grilled breast with scrambled eggs with cheese and onions and home fries and my lady got the all day breakfast special with sausage, eggs, and home fries. She said her food was good. I thought mine was just alright. The chicken was marinated and seasoned but dry, and the cheese on the eggs was heavy so it did blend well with the eggs, the home fries were abundant on both our plates. Overall, it was cool and I would try something else on the menu.

Loved the Cannelloni Formaggio. It is done perfect here. You get a generous portion from the dinner menu, that I did not expect. Prices are moderate and affordable. We didn't break the bank. The servers are wonderful and it's very clean. Love the decor as well, it's very inviting from the moment you walk in. Definitely coming again.

I ordered a big daddy burger  (14oz) and a big daddy poutine. The burger was good, it was big as expected, but nothing really special besides the size. The poutine was lacking cheese but if you are a meat lover you are gonna love it! The service was very good. But I feel like they should update the dollar signs to 2 signs.

Visited this place on a Sunday morning.  Had a long wait to get a table. The waitress was in a huge rush and wasn't that attentive or friendly.  Eggs Benedict were good, pea meal bacon a bit tough though. Home fries overly cooked and crunchy.  I stepped on some home fries under our table and asked the waitress if she could clean it up, she told me that she would do after we left.The decor reminded me of a high school cafeteria. No debit cards, cash only. Don't think I will be back.

We had an awesome server. First time here I like the ambience. I like their $10 pizza special but looking forward to trying their salmon pizza.

Interior design is rustic
Lighting is not too dark
Parking is free
Big seating area
I was served with house bread and chili oil as expected. I couldn't finish my pizza and they wrapped it up for me nicely. Its a good place to have a drink with friends. 
I thought it was a bit pricey but the $10 pizza is the way to go. The salmon pizza that I wanted to get was not in that category.

Check out this photo for the pizza special sign by the pizza

Il Fornello has a trendy atmosphere that makes you feel like you've arrived underdressed. Made me feel all trendy just being there. 

We looked over the lunch features and quickly put them aside; the main menu is where it's at. After my mom and I changing our minds 100 times, she went with the Gnocchi Asiago and I selected the Cannelloni Fromaggio. The dishes arrived and they were beautiful; we couldn't wait to dig in. My cannelloni had cheese inside, cheese outside and cheese all over. The sauce could've used something; it was a plain tomato sauce. I know it had a lot of cheese going on, but to have a plain sauce, made it a little unbalanced. The gnocchi, this was clearly the star of the show. After deciding it was awesome, my mom 'allowed' me to try a few bites. Wow. Just plain wow. The asiago sauce was creamy and rich. The gnocchi were light and tasty. It didn't need anything else, but the spinach and crispy shallots were a nice touch.  

The service was alright. They never refilled our coffee and barely came to check on us. We didn't need anything(except coffee), but if we had, she was nowhere to be found. 

It was a delicious meal and I'd go back. There are many more items on the menu that caught my eye! I hope the staff is a little more attentive next time!

My take out order included chicken chop suey, chicken balls and egg rolls. The egg rolls were VERY undercooked! The chicken chop suey had 4 pieces of chicken and a clear gelatinous substance could be seen in spots. The batter on the chicken balls was cracked, sometimes did not cover the entire piece of chicken and I sadly got a mouthful of whatever oil they were fried in. I lay here now on my couch with my guts twisting in knots and a case of diarrhea as well other physical ailments. I am never ordering from this NASTY place again! Food poisoning is not fun! 

The restaurants reply when I called in with my complaint about the food was to argue and call me a liar! I was shocked as I was willing to bring back the food (this was before I felt sick) for them to see and all I wanted was a refund for the food that was not properly cooked.

I have only been here twice but I find the food is very good it is comparable to Terroni downtown and tastes like very good authentic Italian food. the service is a little bit slow compared to some restaurants but I find that the atmosphere is generally fairly nice and most times you can get a table. They also have a wood oven which makes the pizzas taste delicious.

Wow!  Totally NOT impressed with this place!  Had the risotto, which I love, but not this one. It tasted more like dirt than mushrooms and was a complete disaster. I ate 10 bites and gave up.  Service was fine, wine was good, but they should learn to allow couples in conversation to just enjoy themselves without continual check ups!  Too many interuptions by the waitress to make even the conversation enjoyable.
Tried it once but will never return

When a friend originally asked us if we can have lunch at this place, I originally thought it was the chain restaurant.  I was however, pleasantly surprised as I generally get really excited when trying a new place that's a little more of a greasy spoon/Mom & Pop's type of place.  My friend also kept raving about their Eggs Florentine so I had to opt for something close to that so I got a traditional Eggs Benny.

I'm quite picky when it comes to Eggs Benny as it's one of my favourite breakfast items.  It's always something I order through in-room dining when I travel and stay at our properties (I work for Four Seasons).  I must say that their Eggs Benny is better than some of the ones I've had at some of our properties.  Their portion is very very generous, with up to 3 thick slices of Canadian bacon on 2 slices of English muffin, perfectly poached eggs and a generous amount of Hollandaise sauce.  The only thing I do wish for was for the Hollandaise sauce to have a little bit more of that lemony zest, but it was actually still very good.  

The one thing I need to stress is how perfectly poached their eggs were.  The lovely waitress also first asked us how we wanted our eggs (we all got Eggs Florentine or Eggs Benny), and that alone proves that they know what they're doing.  I went to this one restaurant that pretty much gave a hardboiled egg.  Yanno.

So on top of the very friendly service in a very casual, welcoming restaurant, their food is definitely worth continued visits.  I'm sure they already get many returning customers, including my friends, and I will definitely be going back to this place.  All-day breakfast for the win! Also, their coffee is really good.  

Straight up 5/5!

Il Fornello is located on Highway 2 between Harwood and Salem on the South side in the same plaza as McDonalds and Smokes Poutinerie. My boyfriend and I came in here on a Tuesday evening around 7.

We were seated right away  and were given a specials/extras menu as well as the regular menu - on Tuesdays pizzas are only $10 and they had a few extra specials they were offering this month. We ended up ordering a mini pizzetta which had cheese, sauce and prosciutto on it and I went with the Gnocci Asiago and my boyfriend got the Lamb Shank.

Shortly after we ordered we had some bread delivered to the table while we waited for our appetizer. Now I may be nitpicking, but at a restaurant that looks as nice as this one does and has some amazing fire grilled pizza, you'd think they could NOT give out butter packs. I would have preferred to see a little container of butter or something instead of a bunch of butter packs thrown in. The bread was good, nothing amazing but a nice start.

The mini pizzetta was quite good, thin crust, not too much sauce, enough cheese for it to be stringy and good sized slices of prosciutto. I think the only thing I would change about this is to make the pieces of prosciutto smaller since there was only one piece (maybe two) per side and they were hard to bite through in one bite so they would slide off the pizza. Otherwise, a nice start to our meal.

The Gnocci Asiago was quite good, I had quickly popped on yelp to see if anyone recommended anything and this one stood out. Soft pillowy gnocci tossed in an asiago cream sauce with baby spinach and crispy onion strings on top. While the sauce was rich, it wasn't super heavy and neither was the gnocci. It's hard to find good gnocci that aren't gummy or chewy and these were melt in your mouth amazing. I couldn't finish the entire thing but I kept going back for more even after I said I was finished. 

I did try a bit of the lamb shank and while my boyfriend quite enjoyed it, it didn't do it for me. The lamb was a bit dry and the potoatoes weren't anything special but since I only had one bite, I can't really give an accurate description. 

Overall, we really enjoyed our meal, good food, good service and a nice atmosphere in the restaurant. We'll be back to try Il Fornello again.

Okay....  Being from east coast, it's a pretty big deal that I think I had the best Shwarma I have ever eaten today!  Along with perfect fries and amazing service.  Will
Definitely be back!

Went to try this place out and thought it was expensive given the shady location, but the quantity and size makes up for it. I would probably not go out of my way to go again, but was content with what Big Daddy's Burger had to offer. Great customer service.


My order [$$]: (1) Big Daddy 14 oz. burger and (2) Big Daddy poutine

(1) The burger was 14 oz. prepared as a flat, thin patty. I found you had to eat around a ring of beef before actually getting to the burger. The patty is homemade and seasoned well which over all gives a better than average taste.

(2) The Big Daddy poutine had mounds of beef and sausage, but consequently a little lacking in cheese and gravy. The fries were freshly cooked and not greasy at all. The taste didn't blow my mind, but it was a different poutine experience.

This place is so ghetto and good!!!  To begin with, behold the plaza itself in all its splendor.  It is a throw back to that specific period of time when the strip plaza ruled supreme, and I love it!  When you go into Almost Perfect, keep in mind that the name really sums up the place.  What you will find is exactly that; discount groceries that for whatever reason couldn't be sold in their original incarnation.  Why?  I have no idea, but I do know the prices on stuff can't be beat!

Yesterday I stocked up on a bunch of stuff for my birthday party.  I spent under $50 and I walked away with a ton of things like Terra chips, rice balls with cheddar and habaneros, and various phyllo pastry hors d'oeuvres.  

You don't have to tell anyone where they came from!  When those goodies are on the plate they look the same as if you had paid the big bucks and got them else where.

I am a fan!
Got takeout out twice. Amazing food and great portions. I recommend getting the captain boils flavour. Will be a return customer :)

I had an enrolment seminar to conduct in Ajax this morning.  Given the nature of the client, the meeting was held at a restaurant called the Station Street Grill.

After everyone left by 8:15am, I knew the highways would be jammed with traffic of people heading downtown to work so I waited it out by having breakfast there.

I had eggs, peameal bacon, fried potatoes and toast. I also had milk (I don't drink coffee).  It was HUGE and soooooo good ... I couldn't finish it all. And it only cost $7!!

My server was very attentive. I would definitely go back if I'm in the area.
It was pretty good I went with my family. very large portions and really nice service. If you do order anything with gravy be prepared to get a lot of it.

A great place to go for family fun. I loved the crab legs! Shrimp was okay. I really recommend this for family or friend outings. Super interactive and the food was amazing. The Cajun fries are bomb!!

Who doesn't like going out for a plate of good breakfast?

This place I did enjoy but I find it VERY overcrowded...I think this is the only place in Ajax now for breakfast.  There's used to be Baywood but they vanished. 

Another issue I had with this place is that I think they only use a somewhat dry cloth to wipe up the tables to the point where they are still sticky with syrup or whatever was spilt on the table. 

Hence the reason my friends and I nickname this place "sticky tables" lol.

Other than that though the food is great and prices are reasonable. 
There is A LOT of selection for everyone and everything comes piping hot.

If you don't mind a little bit of a wait to get a table and somewhat of a loud atmosphere for your early morning meal, then this place is an ok place to check out.

I would not recommend  going there to wash your car. Interior nor exterior. They do a lousy job, I can vacuum my car cleaner than they could. The receptionist tries to rip you off by saying they did more than you ask for and charges you for it. Be careful going there people. Know what you're getting into. I will never go back there.

Great goodlife! Since it's in AJAX.. nobody goes.
It's very empty, all the time. Never an issue to find parking in this dead lot. There used to be a ..grocery store next door? But now it's just empty space. 

Changerooms - pass.
Very clean, pretty spacious considering there's never more than 2-3 other people in there. Bathrooms are useable without grossing me out, so that's a pass.

Equipment - pass.
Lots of squat racks!!! YASSS. Very empty too.. I guess nobody squats here, but they have more than any other goodlife. Lots of room to do deadlifts around here too. Other equipment is pretty standard and never seems too crowded. Cardio machines always empty too. Where is everyone?

Crowd - pass.
Not too many juiceheads, unnecessary weight slamming here. Everybody kind of just does their thing and keeps to themselves. 

Staff - pass.
They say hi and bye. Just standard.

All in all, there's nothing that turns me off from this gym. I'd go again, when in ajax.
Love this Tim Hortans! Its a nice location and staff are always nice and friendly. Service is always quick

What a nice casual cheese boutique in Durham.  The staff are super friendly and knowledgeable.   It's great to have such a place so close by.  

The selection isn't huge but they enough of an assortment so as to not have to drive into the city.

We will continue to support this business because we need these types of shops locally.

I should read the reviews before going there. But we rely on the name eggsmart, that is our mistake. We ordered two dishes, both are terrible. But I am concern about the service other than food. Not only their food but also their service is terrible. My question is that how can one run the restaurant like eggsmart with these terrible service. And they don't care about it. 

I strongly don't recommend it and I will not come again for sure.

delicious seafood and fun environment. service is nice and polite. If you haven't eaten at a captains boil before, you order your main seafood with a side, sauce, and spices. you will receive a bag of your food, gloves and a bib. this place probably isn't a good place for a first date cause it can get messy.

This is a great all-day (until 3pm) breakfast place.  For Ajax, this feels like an authentic greasy spoon diner, run by a mom and pop kind of rabble.  The servers are friendly, without getting into your business and the food comes quick and at a good price.
Although it can be busy at times the line goes quickly.
The food is always the same and the serving sizes are generous.  I usually get the same thing every time I go but sometimes I feel adventurous  and go off script which has never been a disappointment.
This place offers good value and an old school atmosphere that is slowly dying in Toronto and not present in the big box / franchise land of Ajax

We eat here at least once a month. We like their pizza. Their meatballs with garlic bread is good, but the serving size is small. Last night we had the Carne pizza and it had less meat than I would expect from a "carne" pizza - one pepperoni per slice and a little bit of ground meat. 

 I am a fan of the smoked salmon pizza, while my partner loves the pepperoni pizza. Their pizza is made in a wooden pizza oven, so they're pretty good. The lasagna tastes like the lasagna from the grocery store. The restaurant is usually packed on the weekends, so we tend to order because we have a baby and it's very loud and dark inside.

We won a gift card for this store, and for some time meant to try it, but kept putting it off. That was our mistake, because once we entered this store we fell in love with the it.
The staff are very friendly and welcoming, and were wonderful in interacting with my children. The range of cheese is fantastic, and we were told that they can order in special cheeses if they didn't have in stock what you're looking for. I particularly love the rosemary and olive oil cheddar and the smoked applewood cheddar has to be one of the best I've tried in a long time.

Although not the biggest of premises, there is a little seating area inside where you can savour freshly made paninis and tea/coffee.

Although I do love this store, it only gets a 4* rating because of the prices. I get that many of the cheeses are imported and the expense that goes with that, but even so it is expensive for the size of the cheese you get.

The food here is AMAZING, love it!! Best place in Ajax to buy Lebanese food. I've tried almost everything. My favourite halloumi chesse and foul.. unbelievable!! Inexpensive as well. I recommend to go and try this place you won't regret it.

Straightforward, non-nonsense, always busy Sunset Grill is perfect for an all day breakfast meal.  

Recommended meal:  Eggs with your choice of white or wheat toast, choice of peameal, regular bacon or sausage, on a plate filled with homefries (chopped up potato grilled) is the way to go.  Fresh-squeezed orange juice is available, too.

You may see a line-up (expect it) but the line goes quickly, so stick around.  :)

Great service by Jessica, nice ambiance, fast service and good food! Will be back :)
Thank you

After finding out about The Grocery Outlet through Jennifer late last month, we were chatting and she let me know that there are locations in Ajax, Whitby, and Oshawa, among others. What?!

Naturally, as someone who loves visiting grocery stores, I have a new goal, which is to visit the ones just east of me. I decided to give the location in Ajax a visit yesterday, since it's the closest one to me.

I used to visit Ajax fairly often a few years back. What I didn't know is that this store (it's still known as Almost Perfect, so branding isn't consistent) is in the heart of downtown Ajax. I had no idea that there was a downtown. Then again, I can see why it isn't advertised. This plaza throws you back to what it looked like in the 70's and still looks like now. It's a bit shabby and ghetto, but who cares when you walk into this store!

The store is next to Ajax Bowl, which seems to be in an office building. It must be interesting to be working in that office and hearing pins fall in the background.

There was plenty of parking. I thought that this plaza was a ghost town at first. However, there are other stores that had more cars parked in front, such as Rexall.

I walked in. This store is larger than the Toronto location. I was immediately greeted with a display of crisp bread and salami chips. I got two packages of the latter. They are tasty as snacks.

This store has a variety of items at cheap prices. It basically takes over-productions or imperfect food items and sells them at cheap prices. Nice!

I loved the frozen breakfast items. You can get apple crepes, egg white and regular egg patties, sausage patties, and more. There were also vegan meat items, such as vegan bacon and shrimp. The Chinese frozen section looked cool. I may need to give the five-spice pork a shot the next time that I am there.

I liked that the TRUE line of citrus crystals are available. When I am travelling, I like having lemons in my hot tea, but it may not be convenient to buy and slice up lemons. I buy the lemon TRUE packets and they are perfect. I bought a pack of orange ones. They are also cheap at $1.49 a box. At my local low-carb store, it's nearly three times as much.

The candy section is impressive. I love that Reese minis are available in both milk and white chocolate. You must give the latter a try. I got hooked on the regular white chocolate cups several years ago. They are delicious!

The desserts looked amazing. My regular cakey cookies were there. So were amazing-looking key lime pies. There are also vegan Sweets From the Earth cheezecakes and gluten-free goodies.

I checked out. There wasn't a lineup. The woman was helpful. I had a bag, so I avoided having my stuff loaded in either a box or a plastic bag. I bought a ton of stuff and it was just over $30. I was a happy camper.

This store had frozen cubed turnips for well under $5. It's perfect for me when I make my version of zuppa toscana, substituting potatoes for turnips. I made said soup hours after coming back from my shopping trip and it was yummy.

I love this store. I'll be back.

(339)

When we got seated, we waited 30minutes just to place our drink order, which didn't come until after we got our meals. The food was alright, i got their pasta, but the service was horrible!!! . We went on a Friday night which is probably why it was so busy but needless to say, restaurants like this are goin to be busy on a Friday night, so be prepared for your dinner rushes. If you do go, be prepared for rude and slow service and average food.

Food is good, but I don't know how the establishment can claim minimum 85% returned as winnings. You can walk around for two hours  and not hear a bell ring or see a "hand pay" screen, meanwhile thousands of dollars have been shovelled into the slots.Doesn't add up.
I won't be back, how hard is it to make toast? I think the home fries have been on the grill for awile, coffee not very hot. Place is kind of beat up. Won't be back

This place is great! I went there on a Saturday night around 8:30 PM. The restaurant was fairly busy. We were promptly seated. The server did not seem too familiar with the menu. But nevertheless it was pretty easy to figure out. We ordered 1lb of snowcrab legs - fantastic but my 11 yr old son ate most of it. He complained about it being too spicy (medium) but kept eating anyways!, 1lb shrimp with sausage added which was very good and enough for 2 people. 1 seafood fried rice - amazing! I could have eaten just the fried rice. And a yam fries. The bill came up $72 including tax which is not bad for a great seafood meal. I would definitely go back for a 2nd visit.

This is a nice little cheese shop! The girl behind the counter was very friendly and helpful. In addition to the huge variety of cheeses they carry, they also have exclusive cheeses such as their cajun spice covered cheddar and an amazing ice wine soaked blue cheese. A great place to try something new. I'll definitely be back!

This is a cozy, beautiful little cafe. Their desserts, lunches and drinks are to die for. Everything they sell here is very tasty . Theices are similar to second cup or Starbucks. It's hard to find a seat there at times but it is worth the wait to sit down. You also have the option for take out.
The best place in ajax for authentic fish and chips. Added bonus is the availability of mushy peas!

What is the best place  to have a bathroom break, relax a little and even have a free beverage and open 24/7??

OLG Slots at Ajax Down is a really good choice. 

On a weekday afternoon, the place is half empty.. aside from the low roller section ..... packed full of people....

While sipping my free Lipton tea in a mug, I was circling around looking for the perfect 1 cent machine to try my luck. I just could not decide as usual.. 

Lady luck was on my side? or my Lucky Yelp friend on my side? I won $20 after 2 pulls so off I cashed out and used the winning money for food and yelp some more!

Now aside from visiting libraries, yoga studios and food related venues.. I can start yelping casinos and slots!
Does anyone win here?  I've never seen lights flashing and people excited about winning big.  But it is close.  Parking lot is long and narrow.  Expect a walk.

Do NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS PLACE! I had a horrible experience with this clinic recently. I called to schedule an appointment for a consultation for a procedure and paid 2500 dollars, the day of the appointment they mentioned that the wrong procedure was recommended to me and that i had to pay an additional 1000! I asked for a refund and got the worst customer service from all staff and management!! It has been 2 months now and they have not given me a refund + not replying to my emails or calls. Very frustrating and rude!!!

Update : I have given up on Sklar Peppler. I must think if my $3500.00 custom sofa as an expensive loss/mistake. Word to the wise, do not be impressed by the items in the showroom. You will not receive the product as you ordered. If you order a fabric you will not receive the same quality as what you are led to believe. After many months of trying the only option I had was to accept three replacement casings (there are 6 pulled and snagged) it was the same defective fabric. Never was replacement of the defective sofa even a possibility. 

I did not receive the quality sofa I payed for in good faith. The staff, most especially customer service, have little to no authority to make things right for the customer even when they see a legitimate problem, which they did acknowledge in my case. 

My only recourse is to review Sklar Peppler online where I can, as well as no longer recommend this company to my clients. I will watch with anticipation as this company slips into bankruptcy once again, due to their lack of concern for their customers. I am just one person, however I regret not buying from a big box store. Buy from Costco, IKEA, The Bay, based on their ability to honour warranties and stand behind what they sell. 






I am in the design industry and over the years have sent countless clients to Sklar Peppler, I regret this now! 

I had two wonderful sofas from them in 2007 (pre bankruptcy) So for my most recent personal purchase I thought of going nowhere else. Boy do I regret this decision. I was not aware Sklar Peppler had gone BANKRUPT and were bought by an American company Alan white interiors. This is no longer Sklar Peppler it is Alan White of the USA (check out their history in depth) it is not Canadian made, in fact i am suggesting it is not even American made. It is my belief that the goods are made elsewhere in the world. There is no identification on my sofa that says "proudly made in the USA" like the Americans always do WHEN THEY MAKE A PRODUCT THEY ARE PROUD OF. If you are going to Sklar Peppler because you think they are reputable, save yourself the money and aggravation. Do your research first, they are owned by Allan White in the USA - look up their reviews and all the horror stories where people have had bad product. My fabric was showing wear within a week, we purchased a $3500.00 sectional we have two clean adults in our home. We have had zero satisfaction from Sklar peppler. I believe they are dragging their heels on this so that we will be out of warranty. Not one person thus far, in the chain of command is able to make a decision on what will happen with our defective sofa. They are still trying to peddle me new cushion covers! The whole sofa is covered in this faulty fabric! My impression is the owners will not give any authority to their staff, they are not empowered with making decisions. They say no and make their employees do their dirty work, by passing on bad news to their customers.

I have had some dealings with genuine staff members who would like to help us, and acknowledge that the sofa is prematurely worn, but have proven they have no authority to correct this for us. They need customer service reps that can reverse their failing reputation of bad service. I have even said to the reps I have spoken to that I would look elsewhere for a job and not work for these people. We have even had staff to our home and they have seen the fabric and acknowledge it is not proper wear for a sofa two months old. 
Apparently they sent a sample fabric to their "mill" aka china, to see if they had had other problems with this fabric. The report came back stating it was not liable to replace the sofa because they detected dog hair on the fabric and a hitch in the fabric apparently this was a sign of abuse. 

We own a 2.5 pound yorkie that is hypoallergenic, non shedding, and is not allowed on the sofa. Nice try to wiggle out of liability. So who is responsible I ask? Should I just suck it up and stop dwelling on how ripped off I got? I hate to waste money, money doesn't flow like lava but releasing this from my mind is the only way I can free myself from the growing lack of respect I have I have for SKLAR PEPPLER.

This place is affordable and has a good selection of traditional breakfast dishes and fruit/low cal alternatives. The staff are friendly and want to accomodate customers. 

Draw backs

1. You have to arrive early. It's usually  
    busy and getting a good seat is not
     always guaranteed       
2.  Not the place for a quit breakfast. A lot 
     of friendly chatter and families

Over all, the wait is not long compared to Coras. And the food comes quickly after 
ordering and it good. I recommend sunset grill 
Ajax. Breakfast for 2 $20.00 with tip.

Everything I seem to order has a centimetre of water in the bottom of it. (except the rice) Nothing is very crispy it's all sort of wet.  I've given it a shot a few times and it's the same each time.  I've never ordered Chinese before where it was so well... moist and soft.  I of course haven't tried the full menu just some of the standards but I'm not a fan.  I live close by so I keep giving it a shot because its close.
Best sharwama and plate in town, delicious and fresh. Best favourite middle eastern food in the Durham region as of now. Pricey but worth it.
Great service. Fixed my phone while I waited when the last tech couldn't get it right. Very knowledgable and professional

Sweet find local artisan cheese in Ajax !! 

I saw this place right next to the 401 so I had no choice but to stop. Found some great Ashley Goat and Comfort Cream (maple smoked) both recommended for the venue - went over extremely well at the wine party,, 

Tammy the proprietor was very knowledgeable and helpful....

We will be back !!!

Thank You CCC..

I had seen tons of signs around the local area promoting the "all you can eat wings."
I thought it was a great concept, I just never took the time to go check it out.
One night the guys from work and I decided we would go for a beer & wings.
$13 for the all you can eat wings, and we split a pitcher.

You pick your sauce and you start with 6 wings...........then slowly......... yep........
slowly they bring you refills of 4. They make you wait. No doubt part of the strategy,
I assume they hope you get full waiting. Perhaps they think it will reduce waste.
During our visit we got full while waiting and two us wasted 3 of the 4 wings each.

I think this is such a stupid practice. 
(A) I'd never suggest anyone check it out! 
So no good word of mouth coming from me (or anyone in my group).
 
(B) I'd certainly not rush to go back here, not now, possibly not ever.

During our visit I asked the lady if we could double our order, 
I let her know I'd eat over 10 wings easily. I was told, "no, other people are waiting."
Like you cant drop more in the fryer ? The kicker, the place had two other tables of apx
3 people per table. So 9 people including my group. But again, this is what they make you do.
Slow service hoping you get full. I guess they want your $13 and no repeat business.

Bar is dated and old looking, as I would suspect. Bathrooms were AWFUL.

To be fair I should add, the wings were decent in size.
The sauces are just your local grocery store sauces.
The wings are all cooked the same, then sauced in your pick.
We tried the HOT - it was dusted with some odd spice, not good.
The Bufalo wings we ok. The sweet chili reminds me of the PC
sauce I buy from no frills, and the parm/garlic were decent.

All in all I would not go back. The expericne does not warrant another visit.
The way in which they serve the customers is just off putting.

Since when did it become okay to serve food in plastic bags? Turn off number one. I brought my boyfriend for his birthday expecting this place to live up to the hype only to be completely and utterly disappointed. We ordered snow crab legs, shrimp, mussels, broccoli, potatoes and rice. The snow crabs were not pre-cracked and were incredibly difficult to open as we were not given any tools before asking. Turn off number two, the shrimp were not de-veined meaning we had to put even that much more effort into our dinner. The only thing we didn't have to do was kill the shrimp ourselves really. The mussels were okay. The broccoli was $7 for not even a head of broccoli, menu says it would come in garlic sauce but it was just steamed with butter. The potato was just that, a potato in a bag, cut in half and tasteless. I would tell you about the rice, but unfortunately or not, it never made it to our table. After struggling with a few shrimp and one or two crab legs, we gave up frustrated. We really just wanted to leave and were completely turned off by the whole experience. After waiting and waiting for a waitress or a staff member to come by, I had to seek out the manager myself, and tell him about my experience. I offered to pay for a small portion of the meal yet he still came back with a $35 bill, claiming that as a manager, he's powerless to make any changes. Will never be returning to any of these franchises again.

This is claimed to be the only warehouse outlet for this company, which no longer manufactures furniture at this location. They seem to consolidate all their unsold, overruns, mistakes, undelivered orders, and overstock in this location.

The selection is tremendous when it comes to couches and upholstered chairs. All the items are brand new and available at tremendous prices. They also have delivery (for a fee) which is very efficient. The designs are current, traditional and casual.

We purchase 2 very oversized armchairs, and 1 love seat in a beautiful microfiber. It is beautifully manufactured, and costs us less than $ 700. I remember this place as I reviewed the Pickering Markets. Its very close to there, and it is definitely worth the drive. They have a knowledgeable sales force, but not the sleazy high pressure furniture store kind. They will help you locate stuff that matches. This is extremely useful as the place is huge. It carries tremendous inventory.

Probably the best Chinese delivery I have ever had! Chicken balls were fresh and had a decent amount of chicken inside. Chicken fried rice was fluffy and actually had flavour. General Tso chicken had just enough kick and the veggies were crisp. The ginger beef was very gingery but the ratio was 80% veg  and 20%. 

They gave us an order of chicken wings FREE and my expectations were low but seriously, they were delish!

For starters, the older lady that works there is very rude. We call ahead to order our burgers with all their toppings and when we arrived 30-40 mins after we ordered which is more than enough time they weren't ready. She was rushing us at the cash to pay and then rushing us to get the burgers made. Demanding what we want on them, giving us dirty looks as we sat down. 
Secondly, the burgers were dry, not very flavourful and wasn't anything special. Especially for the $12 for a combo with a drink and fries you pay. 

Lost my business, will not be going back. Five Guys in Oshawa is basically the same price and the best burgers I have had!!

I purchased a couch here in April, but it already looks and feels like it's ten years old. The chaise extension (rarely used) is still firm, while the other cushions sag, and we can often hear the springs twang when we sit down. As well, the back cushions are saggy and cheap-looking. I emailed the store, but heard nothing back.

When the couch was delivered, they arrived hours late, then spent a long time having back-and-forth arguments with my husband about whether or not they could park on our street (they could), and saying it was late in the day (their fault) and didn't want to deliver it until the next day. Although we explicitly stated that we live in a third-floor, walk-up apartment when placing our order, the deliverers complained about this and acted like they were doing us a huge favour by doing their job. 

The customer service at the store was fine, although she said I made a great decision, when obviously I did not.

SKLAR PEPPLER likely MADE IN CHINA
Bought a $3500.00 custom made sectional sofa, waited 10 weeks for delivery. After only a few days of light use it was clear the fabric was cheap, worse than the cheapest scratchiest upholstery you could find, at the cheapest no name, or big box store. It hurts your elbows to even rest your arms on it. To think I actually paid extra to upgrade my fabric, it can't possibly be what I picked in the showroom. I am in the design field and am very familiar with quality fabrics. The cushions crushed the first time they were sat on, and never bounced back, back cushions are under filled and baggy, and the piping is sewn rippled, the fabric has big pulls and snags already, regardless of being in a well kept home with two careful adults. The red flag from the get go was the light beige zippers used on a charcoal grey sofa. No attention to detail obviously. And the down filled throw cushions sewn right up without zippers at all (that's the height of cheap, I have to wonder what's really in them) 

Customer service is shameful, no talk of replacement. I live local and have bought two sofas from Sklar Peppler before and have referred many clients to the Ajax store over the years. However, I have since learned that the real Sklar Peppler went bankrupt in 2006 (look it up) they ripped off all it's employees of severance. (They actually made quality furniture back in the day) then somehow resurface as "Allan White Furniture" apparently taking the manufacturing to the USA - however I, as well as several other online dissatisfied customers have done some digging and feel that the product is likely made in CHINA (thus the long wait and inferior quality) Some people have actually received their supposed "SKLAR PEPPLER authentic" furniture plastered with MADE IN CHINA stickers all over the bottom (oops someone forgot to remove the stickers!) on my sectional there is no branding label authenticating that it is actual "Sklar Peppler" or where it is made - At the very least neither my fabric, nor the construction of my sofa is that of the superior quality I trusted it to be. It is nothing but a cheap knock off, that cost me $3500.00 what a waste of hard earned money. Do NOT buy from them, there are absolutely no returns regardless of what they tell you when they are trying to sell to you. I have given up on this company, I have accepted that this will never be remedied to my satisfaction, my only recourse is to post my story in reviews so that others will be educated about the potential for great personal loss financially. Message me if you would like more details and please feel free to share my post. 
Thank you for taking the time to read through this ridiculous "not so comedy" of errors.

Went there and they didn't give any  knives and forks. Was going to leave but was hungry. They gave me a metal fork and plastic knife. Certainly they can provide silverware when asked. Not to mention the ecological effect of using a plastic knife. The restaurant was lucky to be 15 degrees Celsius. Had to keep my jacket on and drank my beer with gloves on. Food was good but the silverware and room temperature took away from the dining experience.

Keep in mind:

  1.  Life is 99.9999% luck.  The other HALF is a good grasp of mathematics.

  2.  The only room they'll comp here is the bathroom.  However, the bathrooms are nice and modern given the upgrade of a couple of years ago.

  3.  To enjoy yourself, come here with an open wallet and an open mind (no judgement of the muttering losers who are walking out the door as you're walking in or of the zombie-like trance of the players).

  4.  I know my limit.  I'm usually stepping in it.

A small racino with a decent selection of slots (I would personally prefer more penny slots), no table games, a large parking lot with an operating shuttle, a friendly customer service desk and several self-serve complimentary non-alcoholic beverage stations.

Around 800 slots (compared to the 2800 or so at Woodbine) so can be busy and packed during certain times of the year especially holidays when everything else is closed.  Mainly a local's venue.

Ontario has an 85% minimum payback so expect most machines to be set at 85%.  The occasional or irregular player won't be able to tell the difference between a 92% payback and an 85% payback over a single visit.  Hardcore players are better off going to Vegas or Atlantic City for the higher payback, more selection and the latest games.

The regulars seem to be able to eventually sniff out which machines give the most play time (just my opinion) so keep this in mind if you plan on contributing to my child's public education.  By the way, I thank you in advance.

If you lose, you were probably unlucky during your visit.  If you win, you were probably lucky during your visit.  They didn't make the slots tight just because they knew you were coming.

Do sign up for a player's card to take advantage of any contests and promos.

Happy gaming!

The store is great. The service wonderful but the product is pretty bad. We bought the 738 sectional about 3 years ago. I can't believe how awful this couch already looks. The pillows lose feathers daily from just sitting against them. the pillows are half the weight they were originally. The back cushions have lost their shape and quite frankly are looking terrible. The sofa looks like it's 20 years old. The seat cushions are misshapen also. We just sit on it. It shouldn't look so bad after only 3 years. It was 2000 dollars. A bit much for such a cheap product.

Scottish themed, hence the name, however the owners are definitely Asian!

The food was good, bit slow to cook and not particularly busy but it tasted good. Chips were good. 

My only criticism is that the fish batter was too light.

Would definitely go back again. 

Cod and chips was around $9 with tax

Extremely bad service, the Store Manager is a disgruntled employee he hates his job and is very rude to customers and always complains about how much he hates this job and that he cant go home with this job , etc , etc.   We heard another lady yell at him for very bad customer service and this manager lied to her blatantly. He then comes to us and bad mouths the customer.  This manager has ruined the reputation of mrlube and we will not recommend anyone to go to mrlube for their very expensive oil changes and very bad customer service and terrible terrible horrible service. The mechanics are not properly trained and the manager has no clue what he has to do. But he yells and abuses and harasses customers about his hatred towards working at mrlube he hates his job. This manager is horrible and needs to be fired. He thretens customers and has anger management issues. His name is joseph
I bring my family here all the time. It is the best whimpy's in the GTA bar none. Great food portions, clean restaurant and friendly waitresses.

Il Fornello has been a long standing favourite for my family and I.
We were there last night and were completely overwhelmed by the outstanding service.
Thank you to Kim - she was charming and prompt: from the water, when we sat down to the delivery of the bill.
It is remarkable that my 4 children agreed that this lady was the best server we have ever had anywhere!
I say again - thank you for exceeding all expectations!
Of course, the food was delicious, as always!
Cheers!

Very disappointed.. gave me a appointment  card for 9am. Drove half hour to find out that the calender shows the appointment  at 2pm.  Staff was nice enough to apologise but too late now.. the time , gas wasted for Saturday morning.  Way to go !

I will have to give it to the management and the staff. After the whole incident of mixing the appt. time, i was contacted and offered an apology and was asked to give them another try, which I did and to be honest I don't regret it. I had a wonderful experince. The staff is very friendly. The place is neat and clean. Also great result !!! Def. booking more appts.

The mozzarella balls were good bite size and non greasy. For my main, I've ordered the seafood linguine and substitute the tomato sauce with cream sauce. There's a fee of $1.00 to substitute a different sauce. I must say it's very tasty, even when I felt very full, I wanted to continue eating. The only point to mention was that scallops were on the smaller side, but the rest of the seafood were good in the pasta, such as the calamari, shrimp and mussels. Will come back to try other dishes.

I recently visited this location with my family because we live in Durham region and I had a craving for authentic Neapolitan pizza.  I read some online reviews that said Il Fornello has a pizza night and they make Neapolitan style pizza.  I was hesitant but the craving was too strong.  I called ahead and made a reservation and even asked the person who took my reservation to ask the manager or the kitchen if they made AUTHENTIC Neapolitan pizza.  After waiting for a few minutes, she came back and assured us that indeed they do make Neapolitan pizza.

I was exited and ready to go.

To make a long story short, we ordered Margherita pizza and the disappointment was real.  This was not even close to being Neapolitan pizza.  I've eaten in 5 of Toronto's highly YeLp ranked Neapolitan pizza restaurants and while there is obviously some differential in taste in each restaurant, a Neapolitan pizza lover can tell all of them are authentic Neapolitan pizza joints.  Il Fornello on the other hand?  Nope.  The pizza wasn't bad at all but it's not Neapolitan pizza and I'm hoping if you guys read this, you would stop telling people that it is.

I visited the Yorkville clinic.  I've been there about 4 times in the past couple of years.  Overall, a nice, clean facility.  I'm pleased with the results of the services received and the cost.  The past couple of times, however, I had to wait more than 20+ minutes from my scheduled time.  The receptionist never said anything to me about the nurse running late -- I was just left sitting there with no explanation or acknowledgement.  Not the worst thing in the world but a nice thing to do would be to say something like "Sorry, we're a bit behind.  Can I offer you a drink of water or tea while you wait?"
Great Coffee, breakfast and salad! The price is right and service was great. The mango almond salads is definitely worth a try. I've had probably one of the best organic coffee in the area as well.

Finally had a chance to try the jerk pork here and it was fantastic, just as other reviews that I've read. It's difficult to find jerk pork, but this place was excellent. The spicy gravy was also delicious!  As with most Caribbean restaurants, it wasn't cheap and the large jerk pork was about $10 and mostly rice and peas.

The only reason that I'm giving this review 4 stars is because the rice and peas weren't as good as I expected ... the rice almost seemed that it came pre-made package. I definitely try this place again, and hope that this was just a problem this one time. I'm looking forward the the one that's opening in downtown Oshawa!

I have loved this place for a long time.  There were the occasional mess  up with items that we didn't order delivered to our table, or other times items that we did order never arriving.  We figured it was a result of the place being busy and didn't detract from the food itself.

I would say we have been there maybe 20 times over the years but tonight will be our last visit.  I ordered a new item for me, sesame chicken and when it came to the table, as soon as I quit talking with my dinner date, I saw a very large piece of wire sticking out of one of the pieces of chicken.   I pulled it out,and it appeared to be a piece of a wire brush used to scrub grills.  I called the waitress back, and showed it to her.  She looked at it, and explained that it was part of a wire scrubber.  I told her I knew what it was, but why was it in my food?  She took the sesame chicken back to the kitchen but I was just done.  The few items left I flipped around and closely examined from every angle before putting it in my mouth.  I would have quite honestly been less worried about a hair in my food than a wire.  I could have cut my mouth or damaged my teeth.

Sorry Makimono, your kitchen cleaning should not leave anything in the food.  It shouldn't leave soap residue, pieces of cleaning equipment, broken glass, or anything else that could possibly wind up in the food.  There should be safeguards in food preparation, and if I'm getting a large piece of wire, clearly visible to the naked eye as soon as the plate is presented, it makes me wonder what I might have eaten on previous visits that I just didn't see.

Excellent! A great place to go for a warm conversation. Lots of seating and the fireplace is a nice touch. The service is top-notch and the food is delicious. I always try a different dessert, and none have disappointed me! Free wifi and comfortable chairs. 5/5 in my books!

Worst service ever.
