He bought the truck under the promise that if there were issues with the truck, they'd help repair it. First lie. The truck sat on the driveway for 8 months barely used, because my boyfriend was in school. When he did start using the truck there were problems. Kelly & Sons insisted too much time had passed even though the mileage reading on the truck hadn't changed much from when he bought it. He had to pay $1,500 to get it running again. Then a few months later he had to pay $800 for repairs.
A side of the truck had a chunk of it randomly fall off. When we called to get it fixed we were told too much time had passed. No effort made to try to help us in any way. 
The truck now recently slammed to a halt and wouldn't move. Had to have it towed to Kelly & Sons. Sure enough $2,000 to get it running. They quoted him an additional $1,000 for a tire and rim. They also mentioned other work that needs to be done. We've had the truck less than 2 years (not driven for 8 months) and spent $4,300 in repairs when he paid $6,000. Rip off!!!!
We went to master mechanic and showed Eric the bill. He said he could of saved us $500. We asked about the other repairs. He said they don't need to be done. (It's a work truck). We asked about the tire and rim. He said tires were bald and should get new ones (which we knew) but he said the rim was fine. 
Kelly and Sons seriously ripped us off and lost long time customers. I strongly suggest staying away from there.
Update: FALSE!!!! The business owner replied to my comment and it is false! The owner of the vehicle didn't have a drivers licence. The truck sat on the driveway. That is exactly why we were angry that the truck is falling apart, because it WASNT being driven! Had the vehicle been used for snow removal and construction like he alleges that would be another story. I'm not an idiot and know cars require maintenance. When a truck sat unused for months and is breaking down, is when customers have a right to be angry.  I'd be more than happy to go to a DMV with the owner and show him that the owner didn't have a licence therefore wasn't driving or using the truck for work.

People seem to like the chicken on the rocks but the service is woefully understaffed.  Today 3 staff were there but often no one taking orders or filling the orders as they went off getting supplies etc. Phone rang constantly and no one answered.  Unless they do something different people will get tired of waiting (30 minutes for me on a Sunday).

We were excited to try yozens as it's in our neighbourhood, unfortunately we had an unusual and unpleasant experience when the staff insisted that they had to fill every single sample cup for us (none of the other froyo places around here or anywhere has ever suggested such a thing) 
I told them I didn't need to sample that I was fine just choosing flavours that I liked but they insisted and proceeded to have to ask me at every flavour if I wanted to try, then fill the cup, hand it to me...etc. 
Totally ridiculous! 

The worst part is that they would not even accept any constructive criticism on their facebook page and ignored all "negative" comments about their establishment and then proceeded to delete them and leave only the peachy comments on their page.  

With so many other froyo places in the area I choose to just avoid Yozens all together after that.

We went with a party of 7 and were seated immediately.  

The staff was quick and courteous.

The food was huge and delicious.  We tried a variety entrees, appetizers and drinks
  Nobody had any complaints.  The beef wellington was huge.  We took half of it home for lunch the next day.

The pulled pork sandwich was big and just a little dry but the sauce was amazing.  The calamari sauce was different, but tasty.

It was busy and lively for a Tuesday night in ajax, but we really enjoyed it.  We will be back.

Had a craving for fish and chips so I looked for one in Ajax. 
Fish and chips were okay. Halibut I got was very thin. Scallops were imitation scallops. 
Overall, I felt the food was mediocre.
I love the fact that you can read here and no one will irritate you esp with the Starbucks attached in here makes it more awesome to have a coffee and relax with a good read.

Huge warehouse store -- need a gallon of ketchup or 48 chicken fingers? Get them here.

Crazy busy on the weekends, so come early or on a weekday.
Disappointed by this Osmows, genuinely the worst Osmow's location I've been too. They skimp out on the portions and service is slow

Great assortment of books and magazines.  I don't usually see any staff helping out except for those cashing people out.  

Love having the Starbucks handy.

Decent fish and chips spot in Pickering. The lunch special is good value. Fish batter is crisp and fries seem hand cut. Wife had the halibut sandwich which I tasted.  Was decent. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in the mood.
Compared to other Costcos this is on par. Massive. Good service. But über busy. Go on a weeknight. Saturday mornings are good too -- before the fat proletariat get out of bed.
So fresh and so good! Excellent service from employees that take pride in their work!
Love this place. All the staff is very informative and attentive. I'm new to vaping and got alot of help from these guys. Even when I asked stupid questions they were awesome

The best chicken roti I have ever had.
I like how saucy the chicken curry is, not dry at all.
And the roti is just right.
What I really like about this place is they have different things then most roti shops.
I always like to try new things and when ever I order from there I add on something new.
I really like there buns.
Their staff could be more friendly but they aren't so bad that it makes you not want to go back.
Had the veggie poutine and buffalo/smoked bbq wings. Both were very good. Next time Im in canada I will def come back here again
Very new, nice atmosphere a totally friendly staff. Nice to have more fish and chips options in #Ajax. They also have Greek salad, burgers and souvlaki!
Best starbucks in Ajax. Customer service is awesome & drinks are consistently good. The wait is usually not that long either.

Forgot our order then wouldn't comp the wings that came 40 minutes late. Manager came over to explain the mistake but wouldn't do anything about it. The other couple finished their food as we got ours.

One of the best Mexican places in Ajax.  When you go in you feel like you are in Mexico especially when they have Mexican hats that you can wear and eat with.

The people there are super sweet and friendly.  They are asking us if we are enjoying the food and experience plus they're always smiling which makes the experience better.

The food is good.  Loved the guacamole there and had the veggie enchiladas.  Gonna come back here for sure.

I go here regularly, big menu lots of selection.  Wings are great, good size, my only gripe is they should have more selection  of wing sauces.  Always busy and on weekends  they have a dj.  Lots of tvs so it's a great  place to watch the game.  Food is pretty good in general.  Pub favorites, sandwhiches, steaks, pastas, curry and some Asian selections. Service is always friendly and they are very accommodating, even for restrictive diets.

I  highly recommend  if you want great wings, a good pub/sports bar atmosphere, or have a group with varied tastes.

Pretty good place to shop for stuff in bulk. Decent prices and good stock. It's cleaner and friendlier than the Costco in Woodbridge that I visited. They also have a pharmacy, gas and tire station. They usually have samples during weekends and it gets busy but the crowd is more tolerable during weekdays. The food is ok. It's known for the fries/poutine and the hot dog is cheap.

Awesome pub with great daily specials. It can get a bit busy, but they handle it very well. Menu has a huge selection of items and have not been disappointed with anything yet. Some of the best wings and ribs in Durham region (and great prices when on special too).

Worst sauce I've ever had in my life. Who likes sweet mayo on their shawarma??? This isn't even close to anything authentic. I have had shawarma in the Middle East and this is not shawarma. I suggest Ghadir in Scarborough if you're looking for autheticism. If you just want some gruel, knock yourself out!

Pro:
Service was excellent
The quality of the chocolate dip was great!
Gelato was equally as strong as the soft serve
Liked the fact they have live music on Fridays
décor and set up very welcoming and enjoyed the space and layout of the shop
Taste and options were great and the size of the cones were great!!!!

Con:
The menu decreased their soft serve selection, instead of 5 choices there are now 3, and apparently chocolate softserve does not hold the dip so we had to order the blueberry softserve with our hazelnut chocolate dip

Such a pretty place, it would have been nice if the shop floor was swept (it was very dirty) it had napkins and crumbs on the floor and the floor was sticky! Tables weren't wiped down and had sticky melted ice cream left on it from other patrons. 

I would love to give 5/5 but just having the clean floors etc makes a difference for the overall experience.
4.5/5 though is pretty good!

Great customer service and a wider selection of food.
I had it delivered and my family enjoyed every last bite!

First time trying this place.
The restaurant is very clean, and the service is extremely friendly and welcoming.
There is quite an extensive menu of delicious options. Today we ordered burgers and fries.
The burgers were delish and the fries.....they were "those kind of fries" - so yummy, crisp and fresh!
We will be back again for sure.

Food is decent but portions are kid sized.  if you're an adult expect to buy 3 meals instead of one.  EXPENSIVE!  go to Red Snapper or Patois for better prices and portions.  now where to really sit.  tv is an old CRT.  they care more about money in their pockets than pleasing customers.  I give this chain another year or two.  You can't stay open while charging these prices.  Go to Maimana a couple doors down for an amazing meal.

This was my first time ordering from this restaurant after not being satisfied with few other Chinese restaurants in the Ajax area. Ordered Kung Pao chicken, Sesame Chicken and Black Pepper crispy beef and have to say that I was pleasantly surprised that the food tasted really good. This will definitely be my place to go for Chinese food in Ajax. Love the food.
Definitely my Go-To Costco location. Great customer service, good selection of products and isn't too busy on weeknights.

Service was timely, they told me about 10-15 minutes for my food. Got my burger poutine and ribs in about 15 minutes. The interior design was well thought out, it has a classic but modern vibe. The chairs definitely need to be replaced, feeling a little back pain after the meal was done. The poutine was great. A more than generous amount of cheese curds were given , gravy and fries. The temperature of the gravy could be a little higher as it felt as if the poutine I was eating had been sitting out for a while , it wasn't hot but nonetheless it was good. The presentation of the burger was very simple yet appealing with the little toothpick that says come to big mammas house . The burger received no complaints I went for the classic burger which very good, the beef party was juicy and good in size. I ordered the brisket Ribs, they were Korean short rib style. The meat quality was better than expected, I would say AA or higher, but that comes at a cost for around 15 dollars you receive a pound a half which is a good lunch size portion but for dinner the two pounds would be recommended. The ribs were complimented with the smoked spicy BBQ, the taste was rich and almost overpowering at times, but great flavor. Overall a great experience and would definitely visit again .

This is my hands-down favorite place for Chinese food in Ajax. Willing to accomodate and super fast delivery. The employees are always smiling and very friendly. And most important, great tasting food !

First time at Osmow's and it did not disappoint. We shared a large half and half chicken which is basically shawarma chicken and osmow sauce piled over rice and fries. Food tasted great and they were very generous with the servings. Good service, manager came to our table to ask how everything tasted. Will definitely be back.
Costco always has great quality products.  Usually priced cheaper unless there's a sale at the competitors.  Usually my first stop to get everyday things.

The best fried chicken and biscuits ever! I used to prefer Popeyes but after trying this place I was instantly hooked. The chicken portions are larger than Popeyes, the skin is crispier and the seasoning is just perfect. The best part of the meal are their biscuits. They're soft fluffy clouds of buttery goodness. It's more of a yeast based bread than a traditional biscuit - and they're really good the next day for breakfast sandwiches. The owner and employees are great and take a lot of pride in their work. You can tell by the care and attention they take to cook your food and package it.

My favorite local spot. There is something for everyone here and the dishes I have ordered here have been more than satisfying. My favorite here are the wings! It's my usual especially when they're on special. Also the ribs are awesome and if you're lucky you can go when there's a rib and wing combo special! There's so much on the menu to choose from.

The place is aways packed so expect to wait to be seated. Service is great too.

There's something to be said for shopping in a store where they don't earn commission and that would be... I don't care who helps me as much as they don't care if they help me.

I can wander aimlessly around this store without ever being approached by an employee... unless of course, I'm wandering aimlessly around the big ticket items such as TVs or iMacs... which doesn't quite make sense if they're truly NOT on commission...?

In fact, the most interaction I had with an employee during my last visit was when I was wished a good night by the guy standing at the exit... as I left empty handed.

One of the best Mexican Restaurants I have been in. The waitress is very courteous and very polite. It took a little while for the servers to take the orders and the food came a little slow nonetheless, the service is very good (it could have been the fact that the food just took a little longer to prepare)

The meal comes with complementary nachos and dips which is really good and subdue the hunger. The food in the restaurant is very tasty. You will not be disappointed......ever!!

The quality of food and service has remained very consistent and good over the years. I definitely recommend the place.

Don't let the location of the place throw you off. It's a hidden gem in Ajax.

- It's a chapters / indigo.
- you know exactly what you're getting. Books, Starbucks cafe, and ample parking.

The chicken shawarma is amazing.  The sauce is to die for.  The kids like the chicken with rice or fries.  I find it a bit heavy and prefer the daily special that includes salad.  The salad cuts the grease and is the perfect balance.  We also like the chicken shawarma wrap which is lighter and perfect for lunch.

I decided to try this pub because I felt like something different from the regular places I go to (Jack Astors, Kelseys, East Side Marios).

I had the Chipotle Habanero wings. They were great! This is what I call a chicken wing: They were huge. Not the puny (pigeon wings) you get at other places. Wasn't as hot as I was hoping, but flavourful. It's closer to honey-garlic than anything else.

My kids had nachos and that too enjoyable.

The only complaint is the dessert menu: It only had three items, none of which tempted me to indulge.

I will definitely visit again.

The ice cream is great but the service is trash. The little Hispanic kid is super rude because we sat on the patio and apparently it was closed. There was no indication of this anywhere. Basically they were trying to close early. Will not be visiting this location again.

I have become somewhat of a regular here.  I eat here at least 1 time a week. 

I always eat the Halibut Fish and chips.

It flakes pretty nice, the cooks are very consistent, and it completely satisfies my cravings for Halibut 

The staff itself are all very friendly and nice.

You can catch some CP24 and grab a Toronto Star with it.

(why do mainly old people eat fish and chips tho?  lol) 

Enjoy :)
very homely feel. owners are very kind and their taco bowls are amazingly crispy!

I use to love this place. I actually went and told all my friends about it and how great to have a frozen yogurt place is Ajax. However, my last experience will never bring me back again. The owner/operator was quite friend when the store first opened, but now is lacking some customer service. 
I brought in a coupon that I received in the mail (buy one get one free and buy one get 50% off). We came in with 4 people and wanted to use 2 coupons (I was hoping that made sense). The owner advise that we only can use one coupon per visit, and if we buy 4 we can only get one free (with the buy one get one free coupon). We tried to tell him that we are paying separately, but the owner refuse to let this happen.
I know that this was something small, but it left a sour taste for me towards the business. I know that they just lost 4 customers that will never ever go there again. Hope they Yozens see this post and change the way they do business for a better experience for their customers!
Awesome food ,awesome staff and fast. Sweet potatoe fries ..Ya baby! !!!  All they need to add are whole wheat buns ;-)

An elegant, stylish and high end Barber shop thats comes with the full package such as massage, manicure, pedicure and much more. Prices are reasonable. Being Vlado's (one of the hair stylist) customer for 3 years now and quite happy with their business approach.
I've eaten here a few times and it's always yummy and reasonably priced. The decor is a bit dark in some areas but if your their in the evening it doesn't really matter anyway.

More like Tom"s NO THRILLS! This place has the rudest mangers/staff, the most rotten fruit I've ever seen, and the most misleading signage I've ever read! Whatever happened to the customer is always right? I guess that expected with the name TOM"S NO THRILLS! Don't waste your time and earned money! Go elsewhere..

Finally Canada has redeemed itself with burgers in my book. The last time we were out here we went to a couple spots where the burgers were horrible. Retro burger is a great spot. Burgers are chargrilled and you choose the fresh condiments you want on your burger. Next time I'm trying a cheesesteak.

I can't believe I live five minutes away and never been here before. This is a true gentleman experience. I think I just found my new barbershop. Alleyness is very clean, very professional, and covers every service any gentleman needs.  

I am looking forward to coming back!!!

Great service from the older gentleman (the owner maybe?)! He was super friendly and even brought extra rice for my toddler when he noticed she loved it! Great small place for a family dinner very and amazing food! We a ordered different meals and everyone was happy! Will definitely return soon and reccomend to everyone :)

Amazing place! The service has always been prompt, the food is amazing(my favourite are flautas), and their margaritas and sangrias are delicious!!!!! It's a small restaurant with about 10 tables and fills up faster on weekends but we have always received great service despite how packed they are. Love having this place in ajax!

Service is always good and fast! Food is good also.  Went here after a bad service experience at Scaddabush where we waited 20 mins for a waitress to approach us only after they saw is packing up to leave.  When we got here we got seated right away even though they were busy.  Our waitress was attending to another big group but she acknowledge us immediately. Less than 5 mins she was already asking us for drinks.  Highly recommended.

One of my secret joys in life is discovering a little, family-run place where the owners' culture seeps into their business.  Here, they speak Italian, carry CDs imported from Italy (hanging over the cash register), and make gigantic jugs of pomodoro spaghetti sauce (which you can buy on its own or made into a meatball or veal sandwich, lasagna, or other treat).  Lasagna is also in the freezer for you to heat at home.

At the deli, the meats and cheeses are plentiful.  You can take some home or they'll make you a sandwich (pick your bread from the freshly baked rolls).

It's a bit of an alimentari, too.  You'll find groceries from Italy along the wall.  Some names familiar, and some not.

My only complaint? That I'd love to shop on a weeknight, but I think they're only open "late" on Thursday (I think until 6pm).

Veggie Philly was delicious !! Great customer service as well. Must go place to grab a quick bite. 

Oh... and did I say Veggie Philly was delicious?
Moved to Ajax in April and glad we found this place.  Clean, good food, nice people.  Had the double burger.  Awesome.  Making it a regular hangout.

Overall, I really enjoyed my dining experience at Mexico Lindo.

Staff was very friendly, prices were great and the food was tasty.

Buddy and I ordered the Chorico nachos for our appetizer. Quite a generous portion with great flavour, must say that I really enjoyed it that if I was ever in the mood for just having nachos, I'm just going to get them here!

As for my main, I had the Mezlatán combo, and the bud got the Aji Camarones entrée. I'm allergic to shellfish so I can't speak for the dish, but from what was left on the plate, looks like he really enjoyed it. For my entrée, I must say it was great, the beef was seasoned well and the chicken in the burrito was not dry at all or simply just white meat, delicious.

Had the deep-fried ice cream for dessert to finish. It was what it was, frozen ice cream ball coated in cornflakes type crust. Always a fave of mine.

I came to Osmow in Ajax today to eat something with my daughter. As my daughter doesn't know what was in the menu I asked if there was a kids meal.
they told me that they had a kid meal and ask if I want chicken or beef and I said chicken and asked if I wanted fries or rice and I replied by of course French fries. I could not understand what the gentleman was talking about cause his English was horrible.
after getting the meal I just got a small thing of fries and with a few pieces of chicken on it. I ask him where the rest of the meal was.. and he replied that's it!!! I asked him what am I paying $9.75 for?? he said for the meal.. I ask him you are selling this for $9.75 for kids meal that did not come with drinks or anything else.
service is slow and they expect you to know ahead of time before you order.
I'll never come back again or tell my friends about this place.

I always like to return to restaurants I've given poor ratings to. being a chef I know there are sometimes follies at businesses go through sometimes they employ the wrong type of employee, sometimes they're are slip ups and it's understandable and often unavoidable. 

I returned to big mamas house, I didn't want to wait a long time for a burger so I didn't bother. I just ordered a poutine and a drink. 

I got my poutine there was no cheese curds on it it was shredded mozzarella I told the girl at the counter and she said that's always how they make it (the menu clearly states cheese curds) Not wanting to argue I simply threw in the garbage and went to South Street burger to get a poutine.

My dad suggested the Portly Piper for a low-key birthday lunch on a Monday right before Christmas. I used to frequent the Portly Piper about 10 years ago; it wasn't anything special but it was a nice, warm, inviting pub and I expected a similar experience this time around.

When I arrived, a part of the restaurant was kind of blocked off, so upon seeing the "please seat yourself" sign, I wandered over and found a booth for me and my folks. The bar here is raised, almost in the middle of the restaurant. They've done a nice job of sprucing the place up a bit in the last decade and there are TV's EVERYWHERE. If you're going to watch any kind of major sports event, this would be the best place to do it. We had a TV IN the wall of the booth, which provided some entertainment while I waited.

I ordered the Ruben off the main menu upon reading a review recommending it, but their lunch menu is fairly extensive. They have a lot of wraps and paninis on the menu, a great selection and it proved difficult to choose what I wanted. The Ruben itself was okay, nothing special and not the best I've had, but good just the same. I would definitely try one of their lunch wraps; my parents both ordered the same wrap and it looked delicious!

The restaurant was fairly busy for a Monday at lunch, but service was prompt and friendly and the food came out piping hot. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Portly Piper for a low-key lunch, a night out at the pub or for a place to watch some hockey. I will be back to try some of the other stuff they have on their menu!

This is our second visit to Mexico Lindo. We came when it first opened years back.

We ordered the calamari, but they don't have it today? So we are going with the shrimp at the suggestion of our server. 
The shrimp is our appetizer, I am having Chimichanga and hubby having the tacos for our main course.
The shrimps are delicious! They come with bread that is basically garlic bread, I think plain bread would be better. Big jumbo shrimps in a little bit spicy sauce, very good!
Our main courses were good also.

This is the first time I come to this Costco location, I usually go to the Scarborough one. 

I was under the impression that all the Costco locations were the same and that the product selection was the same. Oh what a fool I have been! This mentality kept me from visiting other locations, until yesterday. It was a "WTF" moment for me because this location is not only bigger, there is more selection of products like coffee, and they have Tim Hortons here. The cold cuts they have ham just regular ham, the spices isles too has a wider selection. I have been a fool in not wanting to come to this location, it's even closer to where I live! 

The biggest difference that I found at least is that there are staff walking around everywhere, I did not have any questions but if I did I was glad to see that there was someone I could ask. I am sure that like most retail employee they don't know anything! However, just the thought that they were there not knowing anything is comforting. I will be shopping here from now, I really do not see a reason why to go anywhere else!

Taco salad, how do I love ye? Let me count the ways: tender pieces of chicken, delicious taco toppings, addictive taco-shelled bowl. With a pineapple Jarrito (Mexican sody pop) on the side, that's a delicious lunch right there!

I've also had the enchilada (regular and suiza, which is covered with melted cheese) and the burritos....fam, all the food here is pretty darn tasty. But for me, it's taco salad for the win.

Bonus: they have a stack of sombreros for all your sombrero-selfie needs :)
Great place to pick up a magazine and have a caramel macchiato and just chill with no worries . People that frequent this location are friendly and great atmosphere .
Bought winter asks summer tires here.  Excellent service ad great warranty program.  The summer tires were recalled and I received full credit towards new tires.

Terrible. I had the haddock and chips. The fish was so greasy it tore through the paper it was wrapped in, and the bag, after a 10 min. drive. Fries were undercooked, and soggy. There was one couple in the place at noon, so there was no excuse not to cook it to perfection. Maybe the owner/cook should shut off his cell phone, and focus on cooking properly.

Good place for your typical fish and chips! Have been going here for many years. Fish isn't too greasy and staff is very friendly. A very convenient location and good for take out. Also, you can order online through JustEat.ca

Portly Piper is a typical pub. Typical pub food, typical pub service, typical pub atmosphere. If your looking for all these aspects it's a good local spot to watch the game and catch up with friends while you enjoy a pint.

There isn't really anything that sets this place apart from other pubs though.

I have been using this store for years, it has a Canada post outlet inside just like all the others.  I have noticed in the last few months the prices for their grocery products can beat out some of the major grocery stores.  The girls at the cosmetic area are great ... don't forget to ask for your free sample :)

When I went they only had orange or vanilla ice cream. Who has orange or vanilla? How about vanilla or chocolate? Just a thought worth considering.

However this is a nice little chocolate and ice cream shop with lots of little options from chocolate bars to flavoured fondant dips to chocolate treats for loved ones.

Of course you have your dipped ice cream cones which you can also get in cups to save you the mess. The coating is actually very thick and you really have to press hard to break through the shell when you eat the ice cream, but who's complaining about lots of chocolate coating? Not me!!  P.s. if you're an adult, the mini will be enough for you. It is very sweet.

You can pick a package of toppings but it is from preset options....  you can't just pick Rice Krispies and brownie pieces if that's what you desire, which is a drawback.

It was mildly busy here on a Saturday afternoon with lots of kids in attendance with their parents. There is some seating.

I would recommend this shop for a treat.
There's a new owner, and the quality of the food has suffered. It was never a top-of-the-line place, but it was convenient with great hours and OK food. It now lacks the OK food.
Automotive windshield wash purchased  at Costco is freezing in the lines preventing it from being pumped to the automobile windshield causing dangerous driving conditions.

After reading the positive reviews along with some recommendations, I decided to give this place a try. I was impressed with the facilities when I walked in, and the staff were courteous and professional in their appearance and mannerisms.  Since it was my first time there I wasn't familiar with any of the staff members there and had just requested a haircut and shave when I had called to book an appointment.
I got my haircut from one person and a different person attended to my hot shave.  After my haircut, I was directly moved to another chair for the shave without having an opportunity to examine the haircut in the mirror.
After all was done my wife saw my haircut and I also had an opportunity to look at my reflection, both of us were unpleasantly surprised.  This was the worst haircut I had ever received in my life. I had thought the young lady who cut my hair was a receptionist at first but later found out that actually cuts (butchers) hair.  I then drew the attention of the gentleman who was responsible for my hot shave to my atrocious haircut who was shocked as well.  He then quickly invited me back to his chair and attempted to salvage the haircut, even though his efforts were appreciated the damage done by the young lady was irreparable.
Observing the other customers it appeared that the barbers in the place are skilled in their trade especially the gentleman who provided me with the hot shave and attempted to fix his colleague's wreckage.  My experience was not a positive one thanks to the young lady who cut my hair.
Very slow service and the burgers are disgusting

I really don't like sunrise restaurants. The food is never really that good and the worst part about it is that at every sunrise you go to the food always different, they don't have standardized recipes and they don't have any idea of consistency. 

Picture going to McDonald's and having your Big mac taste different every time you go. would you really want to take a chance and go to McDonald's.

For all those chocolate lovers out there, like me, you gotta try this place it's amazing!  The chocolate is high quality with many different flavour options.  The portions are huge.  Whether you like ice cream cones, chocolate bars or just assorted chocolate.  AND they give out free small samples. It's gonna be hard for me to stay away from this place!

Amazing Mexican food. Comfortable and casual atmosphere. The mojito was refreshing and not too sweet. Our table ordered 3 combos (sorry, can't remember what they were called) but all were delish!! Only down side was they didn't have any guacamole. BUT it should be noted that the reason for this was because the avocados were not good that day. So I appreciate them not serving something sub par. 

We had a total of 4 people for dinner and it was everyone's first visit and we will all be back. 

A must try!!!!

BEWARE OF OPTICAL DEPARTMENT!!! I ordered a pair of glasses in January.  Not cheap! I spent over $400 and was told the frames were high quality.  Within 2 months they started to chip and discolor. That's hardly the worst of it. After 4 months my eyes started to become very fatigued with blurry vision and twitching almost every night.  I went to an ophthalmologist and after a 10 minute examination was told it was my glasses.  Before I could even respond he said" Costco right?"  I was shocked to find out that this was a recurring problem he had seen with Costco Glasses. 
I returned to Costco and told them the story.  They were completely indifferent and simply said they could re-make the glasses. It has been almost 4 WEEKS! Still no glasses. If you care about your eyes or your sanity for that matter, DO NOT BUY YOUR GLASSES THERE

Just got back from halibut house made an order 2 specials poutine instead of fries. The lady tells me that they don't substitute on the special. I told the lady I always substitute the fries to a poutine and it's never a problem just an extra $2. She told me if I wanted cheese I would have to pay regular price.

From $6 to $14 over a handful of cheese?!
Stupid Pirates!

I used to visit Ajax often. I don't think that I have been back for half a year. I broke my streak today. 

I like the musical instruments section at this Best Buy. There is a nice selection of guitars and keyboards. I am thinking of getting a keyboard and learn how to play. I was fiddling with one and liked the sound and feel. 

Naturally, being a person who likes technology, I walked practically every aisle. I wanted to get a mesmerizing Jam strive Bluetooth speaker, but I have too many speakers to justify getting another one. 

The selection is decent here. Folks are friendly. 

(182)

I really enjoyed my visit to the Portly Piper! I wasn't expecting much being located in a strip mall in a Toronto suburb and it surpassed my expectations. Bloodies were pretty delicious and a recent beer selection. I had a basic BLT on wheat that was very good and just what I wanted. The bartender was excellent - juggling a pretty full bar (about 10-12 covers) and anywhere from 7-10 tables while I was there.

I have never walked into this place and 'not' been able to find what I came for.  Above and beyond books and magazines, they have a wonderful selection of 'other stuff', especially journals.  A great place for gift ideas... just have a wander around and let this place inspire you.  And as with most Chapters I've been to, the staff is friendly, courteous and helpful.

I haven't been here in years, but we had tickets to YukYuks and decided to grab dinner and drinks before. We ordered a martini that took 20 minutes to make and was the most awful drink we ever had. It was 2oz in a 4oz glass, so you feel like someone drank half your drink before it arrived. It was so terrible. We didn't touch it, but couldn't bother to complain, our server was so overwhelmed. She never asked if there was a problem when we asked for a different drink, and we charged for it. They were very busy, we seated ourselves and waited until someone realized we were there. They had tables reserved with no sign, so we repeatedly saw customers asked to move to none existent tables. Different servers bring food, drinks, condiments, so this had 3 tables in our area have the wrong order brought to them. No complaints of the food, but we would have ordered much more if we were impressed with our drinks.

No.  No.  No.  No.  No.

Please note the amount of reviews I have written on Yelp, not negative about much :).  I will have to say, you guys made me use Google Earth Map to confirm we are talking about the same spot you guys are reviewing so favourably lol

Horrible.  

What I asked for was fish n chips.  I got the thinnest piece of fish ever known to mankind (think the thickness of a classic I pod), surrounded by batter.  More batter than fish.  Nice.
 
Really this is what you are raving about?  Not for from there are Baromal, Jasper, Malt and Salt to try.  They have less exactly square looking pieces of fish which I am always concerned about.  Did you half a real piece of fish?  As opposed to fresh fish the way I want it: nice thick piece, dipped in light and tasty batter and fried just the right crispiness. 

I will not write bad reviews, cause what if I go back?  Not to happen here.

I think this place might be nostalgic to some people, and I respect that.  As for my thoughts on this place?  

The fish reminded me of the shape and inside of a hashbrown.  Eat it if you are into that sort of thing.

Do the owners care to know how the store is operating? We ordered 2 large chicken on the sticks on a Wednesday evening and the last to get it after complaining that we had been waiting for over 15 minutes. 

If you're not going to put at least 1 guy or girl who knows how to run the store, your employees will screw up and not know why. 

3 stars because I've never had a problem with the food. It'll change to 5 if they train their staff ways to be efficient and learn to track orders.

The wings and ribs were great! Very good customer service from both of the people behind the counter. They definitely treat customers well. Our burgers were undercooked and when we brought it to Naseef's attention he was very apologetic and refunded the burgers and gave up complimentary burgers that were cooked to perfection. I really appreciated his efforts and I'll definitely eat there again!!

I went to this restaurant for breakfast with a party of 14 with reservations. Arrived at 11am ordered.. Still waiting for the food now 1pm. Everyone else received food. Except our table. They don't seem to care about their guests, we made a complaint and spoke up however we were told half off the bill. Our food started to show up at our table at 1:50pm and I had to send my plate back because they didn't know how to cook crêpes and gave me pancakes instead. On top of that they actually had the gull to charge me $9 + (half off) for pancakes that I never ate because they were crap and I ordered crêpes. I asked everyone else at my table how they found the food. Nobody enjoyed their meal, they screwed up 95% of our orders, poached eggs, Sunnyside up, over medium, they just made scrambled eggs. This place actually charges $8 to $15 for breakfast meals that is crap. Not only is the food crap but for the money you pay, the food portions are very small. So thankfully the food is crap because there is less of it to eat. I don't usually say this as this is the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant, i felt sorry for the lady running this place. She honestly did not know how to run a restaurant, I will never go back to this place nor would I ever recommend anyone going to this restaurant. Your better off just cooking at home its way faster. We got out of this place at 2:30pm. 11am to 2:30pm it took about 3 hours to get our food. Its almost like they don't provide same day service. Anyway I had to go to McDonalds immediately afterwards to get breakfast however the breakfast menu was over so I grabbed a 1/4 pound meal with large fries & drink for $8.00 that resolved my hunger. I sincerely hope this place closes asap as it should not be in business.

It was my first time going to Retro Burger and the customer service and burgers here are amazing. The first thing i pay attention to when going to any burger restaurant is the size of the burger and the patty itself. The patty was nicely grilled and delicious. 
I HIGHLY recommend going here during 2-5PM if you want a delicious burger for a low cost. In my opinion, their poutine is better the Swiss Chalet's and for the same price, its uncomparable. 

I'm deffinately going back!!

Fast friendly service, fair prices and clean.

Best fast food in Ajax!

My chicken craving solved.
I was in the mood for some fried chicken and found myself here. 
Ordered a 10pc dark meat only.  Employee said it was cooking and it would be 10 min. Not a problem, I always consider fresh is best.
I sat down in the store to eat some for dinner and save the rest for the following days lunch.
Knowing it was fresh and hot , I took a couple pieces out to cool . 
Once I could safely eat....wow!
That was some good chicken.!
I will always insist on fresh!
My wife and I love this pub. The wings are great beer is reasonable lots of TVs and a great atmosphere. The manager is very friendly and always helps when things are busy.

I went on a Monday with some friends who are regulars and know that they have 1/2 price wings on that day (with a purchase of a drink). The wings did not disappoint. They were fresh and pretty big compared to your franchise Wild Wing or All Star Wings. I tried a couple flavours and the gar par dry rub was my fave. After 9pm they also have 1/2 appetizers and my friend raved about the potato skins... so we ordered them and they lived up to my expectations! At the end of the night we were full and my bill came under $10 (before tip)! Pretty sweet deal. The atmosphere was like your typical Irish pub.

I just called at 8:30 pm and asked how much for 3 pieces of halibut and 2 chips and it was $41.00 plus $5 for delivery. I called back and asked how much it was for just 3 pieces of halibut and she said $43.50...I asked the lady why is it more for just fish without the chips and she didn't know..I do not recommend Halibut house ! They seem to be making up prices.but that's just my opinion.

I have to say the food was decent however upon paying we had 40 in gc as a gift from Xmas (received 100 from a fellow business owner already used some up with no problems) anyways we left the gc and the rest cash to make up the bill,the waitress  followed us out and told us they no longer honor gc because of new owners they don't accept them anymore.. So we went in to talk to the manager and he wasn't there so we spoke to the cook very rude cook and basically told us that we could have made them off the computer ourselves .so needless to say we were offended. He also said that because it's new owners they will not accept them so we needed to pay the 40. No where did it say that it was new owners and in fact we were there 1 month ago and used the other gc with no issues. This is horrible business practice and I will not be back nor will I recommend this place to anyone.
This place generally has great food, but the customer service is absolutely terrible.

This is a regular place that I go to for a family meal, either eat-in or takeout. Great burgers, chicken and fish sandwiches. A simple place with a good range of food. They know what they are good at. I will say that they don't always listen that well at the burger toppings station. And the front door is always hard to open!

- spotted this place for Kingston road next to the pizza pizza 
- discovered this wonderful Italian deli with a non stop stream of people coming in for sandwiches and other goodies
- make sure you grab a canolli.  A must.

My wife Sara never knew she loved Mexican food until we started eating here.  My daughter loves it too.  They have the most delicious, savory fajitas I have had anywhere.  My favourite dish is the Tobacco - very flavourful and hearty serving size.  This is a family business, nice to see the owners taking pride in their cooking!

Ordered the 5oz cheese burger combo with fries and a chocolate shake. The flavour of the burger was very good, the fries are run of the mill nothing special, the milkshake was good and creamy. The price is pretty good but for a whole family of four the price does get up there. The atmosphere is very nice, and was quiet busy for the late afternoon lunch. 

Overall, I would say if your in the area and hungry it's a good place to eat, but I wouldn't make any special trips to Retro Burger.

This place is AMAZING.

I can't believe I lived in Pickering/Ajax for 10 years before discovering this hidden gem on Bayly. 

Great family sit down place or good for take out the staff here are the friendliest I have ever seen the owner is incredibly nice really gets to know his customers and always makes you feel welcome and the staff are the same way I have to say I am extremely impressed I hadn't seen the level of customer service I get at Retro Burger anywhere else.

The food is great, I have had their Philly Cheese Steak numerous times it is by far the best Philly I have ever had in Ontario, honestly eating a Philly at places near by like Kelseys, Shoeless Joes etc... those expensive chains Retro Burger's $8.00 Philly Cheese Steak puts these to SHAME! You have to try it with their hot sauce. My only complain about the philly is the the bun isn't the greatest it just can't handle all that philly and sauce so when I get home if I don't eat it quick enough it gets soggy but still good.

They have a burger special of $2.49 for a burger between 2-5 PM I believe and the burgers are great. 

I haven't had much else other than their poutine (also good) but I visit frequently. 

Keep up the excellent work! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Cameron

My wife and I have been going to the Portly Piper for about 7 years now and quite enjoy it.   It's not a perfect restaurant by any means but for the most part we enjoy it.  The food is good, everything we've eaten there has been good except I think a club with processed meat (one has fresh and the other has processed meat, I can't remember which is which).  The appetizers are good, the mains are good.   The service is really good 90% of the time and there is an occasional miss.  Once we ordered a Creemore beer and the waitress brought a really light colored beer (think Coors light).  We tried to send it back and explain Creemore is a darker beer but she refused to take it back and insisted it was Creemore.  (it wasn't).

The real drawback to the Piper is how loud it is.  If you go at dinner time for example it is really loud.  If you go on wing night and there is a sporting event on it is SUPER loud.  Don't expect to be able to hold a conversation with someone, it's literally that bad.  If people can't hear the game because of the chatter then they turn up the TV's, if the customers can't hear each other they talk louder and again they seem to turn up the TV's.  

My wife and I will continue to visit but only on off hours to avoid the crowds and noise.
Retro burger.  Not so much retro anymore.  Is that some type of coating on my fries?.  I think so.  Or, they changed the oil.  Either way, not as good as in the past.

When we arrived it took our waitress considerable time to bring us 2 diet cokes let alone even take our order. She kept walking by us and saying that she would be right with us, however it took her 20 minutes of backing and forthing to actually get to us and the restaurant wasn't even that busy later on a sunday evening. We decided to order calamari with tomato sauce. It was brought out in 35 minutes without tomato sauce. After asking for the tomato sauce, it took another 10 minutes to get it. But I have to say the calamari was probably the only decent thing about this night. We got our food shortly after. I ordered the goat cheese ravioli with smoked salmon. I'm 99% sure that there was little to no goat cheese in my ravioli as it had the taste and texture of ricotta cheese...something you'd pick up frozen at the grocery store. I also had to search for any pieces of smoked salmon as they were miniscule and few and far between. Overall, I've had store bought pasta much better than that. My boyfriend ordered the New York striploin which was supposed to come with tempura onion rings...there were none to be seen. The cut of the steak was completely wrong and the whole middle of the steak was all gristle. He also asked for sauce on the side and his steak was completely coated in it. It was disgusting and I actually felt bad watching him eat it and try to cut the thing. We then sat for 20 minutes waiting for the waitress to clear our plates and give us our bill. She would walk by us continuously and ignore us. We had a coupon for the restaurant which is another reason why we decided to try it, and both waitresses tried to short change us on the value of it, finally after telling them 3 times what needed to be done, they got it right.The service here was atrocious, the food was seriously lacking, especially for the price, the atmosphere was alright however it was freezing because it was cold and drafty.I'd never waste my time going here again and would warn other people about going there. I have no idea how this restaurant is still surviving in today's marketplace.

I love this place! The red sangria is delicious with lots of fruit. You always get greeted with homemade salsa and chips. . The sauces are all prepared on site and they are yummy! Want hotter ask :)
I normally get tacos but their edible taco bowl salad is also fabulous. ... no complaints from any guests yet except they ate too much

This Starbucks is inside the Chapters Indigo in Ajax. Whenever I visit this bookstore and want to hang out by reading a book, I tend to hit Starbucks for either a drink or something to munch on. 

I felt like a peanut butter cup cookie, which is essentially a peanut butter cup inside a yummy peanut butter cookie. So good! It was warmed up for me. 

The barista was cheerful and nice! I scanned my barcode from my app and all was good. I proceeded to the pick-up area. Moments later, my heated-up cookie was ready. I got another barista who as equally as nice and cheerful!

The cookie was yummy. I like how the chocolate oozes out after you bite into it. Heavenly!

The lineup can get long. I had two people in front of me who were so absorbed in their dull conversation that I actually had to tell them to walk over to the barista waving at them to come to the counter. Yikes! I guess they needed some caffeine badly!

(175)

Don't come here. They say they have the special for $8.95 that comes with a choice of a drink,fries, gravy or coleslaw. I ordered 2 of that and they charged me extra for gravy and pop we ordered which was suppose to come with it. when we asked, they told us it didn't come with the special but it clearly says on the menu that it did. I take responsibility for paying before looking over the bill (I even tipped them!) but they still shouldn't scam people like that. They weren't willing to give a refund on the extra they charged us wrongly. It was only a few dollars so I just let it go but I want to warn people who come here. CHECK YOUR BILL BEFORE PAYING.

Fish and chips are superb.  Big chunky fries.  Fresh, not frozen.  People behind the counter are very friendly.  

The decor is a little bland.  it doesn't have that old wooden style of many fish and chips shops.  But I always take out so not a problem.  A little pricey if buying one order, but a pretty good deal if you get the five fish and three chips.  And the chips are pretty healthy portions.  

They also have lunch specials, and specials on the haddock.  Don't like haddock and haven't had lunch there, but its good to know if you don't want a huge portion at lunch or like a cheaper fish.

The fish ( we get the halibut) is excellent.  Its pretty big and the better is crispy.  Batter is even,.  some places end yup with too much batter. 

This is now my favourite fish and chips place, and I've said goodbye to the two other places we used to frequent.

I also like the candy jar on the counter.  You know the small ones, wrapped in shiny paper.

It's not the best shawarma I've eaten but one of the most expensive for sure.  

Tasty beef shawarma with too much toppings even through I only ask for four.   It's a dripping mess to eat as the pita falls apart with so much sauce added.  

The medium hot sauce has a kick to it and is pretty good.  

Staff are not very friendly.  No talking to the customer.  Only to themselves.  

A mixed review and feeling for this place.  Not my favourite and I'd might come back if the atmosphere was better.  However I'd say once a year might be plenty to visit.

If you're a fan of old school KFC chicken, to me this is really really similar.  But what is better is that it comes with much better big fluffy crispy fries like you'd get at greasy spoon diners, and a cup-o gravy.  I've never been fans of KFC fries especially when back in the day they used off the shelf McCains fries.

Only issue with this place is there is minimal seating.  No tables and only one rail along the window, so this place is mostly a take-out.

Blah...
Too bad this place hasn't improved... not like they care when they are one of the only games in town.
This is your typical 70's scabby take out only dives.
The menu has about 100000 items of which 85% of it is exactly the same with a different name.

I ordered two items on a Wednesday evening and they couldn't be bothered to get them correct!?
When I called to let them know that hey the bbq pork from my "BBQ pork wonton soup" was missing, the owner argued with me to tell me that he made it and definitely put it in.  To only recant this when his wife yelled something in Chinese at him in the background. .likely something along the lines "here it is in the microwave" as the won tons were rubber.


I would avoid this place and go else where.  Fresh is not what you will get.
Food was delicious. Ordered the nachos, chorizo tacos and sangria. The diablo sauce is not to be messed with; I ordered it on the side and it was hot!
Amazing wings! My favorite ever by far! Juicy and huge with plenty of flavor! Tuesdays are 60 cents wing night!
Stopped in for the first time yesterday, the servings are immense. Great burgers! Music playing was CHUM (I think), didn't really compliment the atmosphere.

Good for all ages of people, and sizes of groups.  Lots of TVs and most booths have TVs built in them!
Have been here numerous times and always have a great experience. 
Fun on a weekend nights to drink and party with friends; or to go lunch with your parents :p Great good, great prices and big menu. 
I really like their wings and nachos! I've had lots of things on the menu and enjoyed everything so you really can't go wrong! It's good when you're going with people who have a lot of different tastes. 
Wish the actual bar was a bit bigger though ..

chicken on the rox is amazing!!

and reasonable price...the $9 size is a lot of food and can easily feed 2 people

I largely agreed with the Rae's comments about the service department at this dealership.
The sales person seemed to be very knowledgeable and friendly, which was the reason we decided to take our vehicle to be serviced there, little did we know that the service department operates under a completely different set of standards.

First you have to pre-pay for parts prior to scheduling an appointment-they don't tell you this-we found out by accident.

Secondly you need to know about cars and if there are any recalls-they will not inform you nor will they organize any replacement parts or reimbursements of any recall work-you must do your own due diligence or be caught paying for a repair that should be covered by warranty or recall or more importantly what needs to be fixed right away due to safety concerns-they will not tell you this either!

Thirdly-if your appointment is scheduled for the morning, do not expect that your car will be ready by closing-they do not have loaners nor do they respect your time-we had our car there ENTIRE day only to be told that it was not fixed and would need to return it the next day, they were not concerned that we had to significantly jiggle our day to accommodate this repair-BTW the repairs were not extensive and any reasonable mechanic would have only needed 3-4 hours to work on it!

Fourth-There is no one to address any concerns-asked to speak to someone and was forwarded to someone named "Paul" I left several messages that were never returned.  I asked for an email,  after putting my concerns in writing via an email messages, discovered that it bounced back as undeliverable-the email they provided me was no good.  To date no one has contacted me to discuss my concerns-a huge indication that they just don't care.

In short, if you are ok with inflated prices (which I would not mind if they had treated me with an once of respect) and are very car savvy and know exactly what your car needs and what the recent recalls are and are either retired or have a ton of time to waste-then this is not the place to take your car-the search for a good mechanic continues.....YIKES!
Killer! Tanzania dark chocolate dip is the way to go. Drinkable s'mores was great too.  Highly recommend visiting.

Located in a quiet strip plaza sandwiched between a variety of a different eateries and a packed parking lot we took our chances and gave this pub a try. It was a Friday night around 8:00pm and  to our surprise we found a bustling restaurant packed with patrons. They had all sorts of people here: large groups, intimate couples, families with small children, families with teens, elderly couples, middle aged, and teenagers you name they had it.

I checked in with the hostess and she told us it would be a 10 minute. Truly I didn't believe her but sure enough at the 10 minute mark she came over and led us to a large leather booth with a tv in the middle airing the Jays game. The restaurant is a bit a dated and surely has seen better days but it definitely had a lively upbeat atmosphere.

Our waitress came over and introduced herself and went over the specials for the day. Every week they have an additional menu of specials, I noted one of the specials of the day was an 8oz baseball steak and lobster for only $23 bucks! However I was more in the mood for some greasy food.

Thankfully our friendly waitress was very educated on the menu, she was so informative as I was torn between 3 entrees and she was soo good in helping me make a final decision.

Deli Reuben Sandwich- Shaved corned beef topped with sauerkraut, Russian dressing, Swiss cheese grilled to perfection on light rye bread
Stacked high with ample meat layered with that tangy kraut and a light coating of creamy Russian dressing with perfectly melted cheese held together with crispy toasted buttery rye it was perfectly done! Served with mustard on the side for good measure I adored this sandwich!
Oh and lets not forget about the side. I went with the onion rings. They were out of this world good! Thick cut super crispy golden exterior enclosing that tender sweet onion! Yum!
I can't believe how good they did two traditional items. I was quite impressed!

Overall I have to say I will definitely be returning to this spot! Great food with wide variety of items, friendly and attentive staff, and very affordable prices. I can see why this place is soo packed!

Driving Range - staff are always super friendly.  It is fun to hit some golf balls early in the season and meet up with these guys.  The range has new golf balls this year.  I don't mind hitting off the mats here.  If you pick the right ones, the yardage markers can be used as a guideline on the fairway.  Hit outside them you might be in trouble on the real course.

Had a Philly with poutine.  Sandwich was good.  If I had to criticize I would say a little too much sauce, but I don't so I won't.  Poutine was really good.  They use what seems to be real gravy and real curd.  Cashier was super friendly and her physical appearance only slightly distracted me from my tasty lunch (she was pretty).

My first visit to big mamas house was a very disappointing visit. 

I was meeting with my real estate agent I had half an hour to eat. I headed to big mamas house placed my order and had waited for over 45 minutes for a burger and a poutine. When I saw my poutine up and ready to go with no sign of a burger it was a major red flag. I had  seen that somebody was making a burger patty on the fly!

Although i I appreciate fresh quality food, 45 minutes for a poutine and god knows how log for a burger I cancelled my burger and just had the poutine. It wasn't good at all. 

Sad part was I wanted to open a restaurant on the same property that big mammas house is on but they beat me to it. 

I contacted the owner to discuss how dis satisfied with is business. Very nice guy. I hope he let's me know before he goes out of business so I can make a bid on that property.

Absolutely appalling customer service. Came in to pick up a large catering order and two women behind the counter walked by me for five minutes before helping me even though there was no one else in line. When I was finally helped, the woman who served me was extremely rude. Learn to treat your customers with some respect, especially when they're spending that much money in your store. Disgusted. And food is mediocre at best. Avoid this place.
Nice atmosphere, good food, good selection of Mexican beers.  Being of Mexican descent, I've been disappointed in Mexican restaurants out in the suburbs, but this one gets my vote

Really professional barbers. Well spoken, really nice and customize your experience. My brother and I got the hot towel shave and it was great. They take their time applying various creams and gels to south your skin.

Relaxing dining room to dine in. Friendly staff here as well. Fresh fries served in a fancy mini fryer basket container, real old-fashioned style. Nice, frosted glasses served for root beer. Free drink refills. Great place!
Great selection and delicious food. Always fresh and made the way wanted. Amazing customer service as well everyone is extremely friendly you feel like family

There are series of "Mexico Lindo" restaurants throughout Durham Region, all a little different. Someone once told me that they're all owned by cousins or some other family connection, but each does things a little differently. Of all of them, I think this one is my favourite. The service is prompt and very friendly, good portion sizes and delicious offerings, and you can almost forget you're in a non-descript strip mall of no particular import. 

We went with a craving for tacos and had a great meal. Definitely worth the trip.

disappointed...the entire family sits in the restaurant and eats...the food has no flavour

the one in oshawa is ten times better

My girlfriend chose this place and now I have the unpleasant task of trying to outdo her. The place was exceptional and the food was delicious. We ordered the butter chicken poutine and it was perfect, crispy waffle fries, good sized cheese curds and juicy butter chicken. We also ordered the suicide wings which were cooked just right - only caveat is they were really spicy (more than what we would have expected). However, I would still order these again but with a different flavour. 
Overall, this place is a must go the food is great, great customer service and the place is very welcoming. They have a lot of great deals and promos so that's always a win.

Customer service was soooo bad! Kids who are rushing to get you out the door. 
The menu was flashing on & off. You can't read the description of the burgers without it turning off. It was so annoying. 
One star for the ok Poutine. 
Burgers was ok nothing to come back for.

A location not in a mall! Yes! 

Very open with high ceilings and different levels. The gift section is very large; larger than the Starbucks! 

The selection is great and so are the staff. They can find anything and they are knowledgeable about books; they don't just work there. 

It's also less crowded than Chapters found at malls. These are usually entrances to the mall, but at this location, they are actual customers; not just people walking through or getting coffee.

I love Costco it is a great place to shop. Great PRICES AND huge savings. MY latest find was a singer heavy duty sewing machine what a great price and the thing is amazing !! The people are always very friendly. Try not to go on the weekends it can get very busy at this time but for great prices it is worth a a bit busy...

Came here on a Thursday evening.  Relatively quiet for a Costco.

Foodcourt was busy.  Ample seating for everyone.

Much like any other location, this location is clean and organized.

Wow, outstanding!!!This tastes like Mexico, the authentic home cooked stuff. I'm typing as I eat. The enchiladas are terrific, the refried beans have a lovely smoky flavour. The portions are huge. Yes I am coming back here and bringing the wife. 
Oh and the diablo sauce is actually hot.

Mexico Lindo serves up delicious home-style Mexican food. I would highly recommend this place for anyone who wants to experience the closest thing to authentic Mexican dining within Durham Region.

On this particular visit, we ordered a taco salad to share as an appetizer (the deep-fried bowl that it comes in is SO good), a chicken chimichanga, and a chicken quesadilla. On top of this, they also provide you with complimentary chips and homemade salsa. We both thoroughly enjoyed our meals and it kept us sustained for the entire rest of the night. The flavours are impeccable and definitely taste like homemade recipes!

Upon arrival, you will find that the atmosphere is colourful and festive which only adds to the dining experience. The service is quick and straight-to-the-point, which I enjoyed for that type of atmosphere. I was also happy to discover that they do take-out! I will definitely be back one day to try more of their delicious selections :)

Great wings at a great value they have really good specials every week one of the best pub style places in Durham 

Fantastic value and my go to pub in Durham area.

If there was zero stars - I would provide that.
- dreadful nuked food (microwave) and from boxed typed preparation
- wonton soup like dishwater heated up
- every dish also tastes the same - can't tell the difference between a gravy and their black bean sauce.

If you want good Chinese Kings Wok is good - skip this place  - save your money and save your taste buds.  DREADFUL food....I have no idea how this place still stays open

This is one of my favorite Chapters locations. Love going here during my break, grabbing a coffee and checking out books.
The staff is friendly and always smiling. 
I like the cool products they have been carrying from home decor to little gift items. 
Nice to see people still read and buy books!

Mexico Lindo has become one of my family's favorite restaurants in Ajax. The staff is very friendly, the service is great, the food is outstanding and the portions are slightly intimidating. (That's a good thing!) This place is a jewel in an otherwise seedy-looking strip mall.

You'll probably wait for seats on a Saturday night, but it'll be worth it.

I love that I can call and order ahead of time before I pick up. What's even better is that the wait wasn't that long. I ordered for 3 people so I expected about a 30 minute wait. It was only 10 which was nice. Service was great.

The burgers were pretty good. Nice thick patties which were cooked to perfection. My son had the bacon poutine and he said he never thought bacon poutine would have so much bacon haha. I guess it was a thumbs up from the little dude. Price was reasonable. THese days paying an arm and a leg for burgers seems pretty common nowadays anyway...

It's not the greatest burger I've ever had...in fact there are no burgers which stand out for me right now. But I will admit it was a tasty burger!! I would get a burger from here again, but next time I want to try their 'real' milkshake.

Moving is always an adventure, and my move was anything but standard, but Rockbrune and United made it pretty amazingly simple.

Back in December 2009 I had the opportunity to move from Ontario to Nova Scotia for a new job.  Having a condo in Ontario, and free temporary accommodations in Nova Scotia with family, I tried to rent my place furnished, but it didn't work out - so I sold some furniture, loaded two carloads of the essentials, and stored the rest.

Fast forward to February 2011 and we were getting ready to finally make the move complete.  Based on the fact they offer Air Miles and some good feedback from friends, I called United Van Lines - actually, I emailed them.  After a great telephone conversation and email exchange with Emilie Mercier, one of their sales people, I made my short list and flew back to Ontario to meet the prospective candidates and make my decision.  Meeting at my storage facility, Emilie gave me lots of great info and made clear that she wanted the business, and would give me the most competitive quote possible.

Compared to the other candidates, well, she was just brilliant, so I agreed to give them the business.  They went, packed up everything, and brought it all here, and the service was basically perfect.  They made a complicated process pretty simple, and for that I'm happy to recommend them.

There's so many parts to Costco that it's a hard to give it an overall rating. That being said I'm looking at a 2.5 rating.

I hit up the cafe at the back for a Polish sausage first. Can't really beat $1.50 for a large dog and full size fountain drink! The soft steamed buns are a really nice touch. I also appreciate that there are pumps for the ketchup, mustard, and relish so there's no fussing about with opening packets or gaming with bottles. 

I ordered a custom calendar from the photo centre as a gift which was poorly done. I provided 12 photos for the calendar and they were all printed with the top of the heads cut off so everyone was missing a good half of their forehead. I would have hoped that someone could have moved the pictures down or resized them. I didn't wind up gifting it since it wasn't up to par.

I'd definitely be down to get some Costco got food but I'm going to stay away from the photo services.

They have a good lunch deal $10 for halibut and fries as opposed to about $15 per meal. The halibut was fried well and the tar tar sauce always makes a fish and chips meal delicious. The restaurant itself is classic looking - typical booths, family friendly & clean. 

Good if you're craving fish and chips! The fish size was smaller in comparison to other places that I've tried which is why I knocked off 2 stars and I've also seen better deals in Ajax. 

Overall good!

Frick.. this damn pub is true to it's name.  The piper is calling and the portly (namly me) is coming.  His evil tunes becons and I must obey!

It's a very good fairly low key traditional sports pub in Ajax.  There are plently of TVs abound, but some of them have already seen its better days.  

The service has always been top notch, and for the most part, the servers are there when you need them.  

But what really brings us back over and over is the food.  Their Chicken and Rib weekend special is just so darn good!  Really nicely done ribs that are perfectly cooked.  Good wings with even some choices of various flavour aside from mild or hot (of which I can't name off the top of my head right now).  The Fajitas are top notch, except we always need more tortillas (an additional charge of $1.50 for 3).  

My friends and I usually do it family style where we order a bunch of food and do the communal sharing thing.  You get the best of all worlds!  Why we don't do more communal sharing at other resturants I don't know?  Maybe it's just the Asian in me.  
 
We've recently done the Chicken-Rib combo, 2 for 1 Fajitas, and an order of Chilli Nachos for two (tip: get the Chilli on the side because it goes great with the Fajitas as well!).  For 4 people, we barely manage to finish and it works out to be about $20 per person including a drink for each.  

It's a pretty sweet little deal.. except.. well.. we're all a little more Portly now.
Service is fast and very friendly. A little bit expensive for bar food but not as bad as some other places. The butter chicken poutine is really good.

Haven't had much but poutine and Greek fries but do far pretty amazing. They give you a great portion for a reasonable price and good home food that fills you right up.I'm looking forward to trying a veggie burger, veggie Philly as well as the sweet potato fries.Perfect customer service
One of the best Mexican spots in the east end! Love the taco salad and their burritos. Will be going back for more!

This place is so delicious. The pastries, baked goods, sandwiches, and deli meats and cheeses are delicious. My favorite things would have to be the cannolis and the rice balls, although the tirimisu is delicious as well. Definitely a hidden gem in ajax!

Rockbrune messed up my mom's move to her new condo. Their quotes are undervalued because the estimator doesn't know how to provide accurate estimates. Furthermore, he scheduled the move for Tuesday, September 12, but the the movers incorrectly showed up on Saturday, September 9th. The contract is very complex and the fine print is not even legible. They quoted one price, but then ended up charging another price. They were not able to deliver all her stuff on the day of the move within building security guidelines. Building security never had any issues with other movers in the past. Rockbrune movers had to come back to finish, 2 days later, but held my mom's stuff (including medication) during that time. My mom had to pay the elevator deposit again and the movers wanted $450 more. My mom tried to refuse to pay, but they packed up the truck and threatened to leave. They left my mom no other choice but to pay $450 more! This unsatisfactory experience leads us not to recommend Rockbrune.

My friend and I biked nearly 3 hours from downtown Toronto to Ajax specifically to try this place out. The bike ride was not easy as we faced elevations of over 100 meters through busy roads. The sweat and pain was so worth it. I had been craving their delicious dipped hazelnut kooky cone since seeing pictures of it on Yelp several weeks ago. The dark chocolate dip was so thick (I couldn't break it with a plastic spoon-thick!) and perfectly sweet. I've had dipped cones at La Diperie/Dairy Queen and this was a thousand times better. My friend and I also ordered a s'mores milkshake but they accidentally gave us a caramel pecan milkshake instead. They quickly made us a large s'mores milkshake and let us keep the caramel milkshake. The milkshake was so delightful and creamy! I was in heaven the whole time I was there and would highly recommend this place to anyone with a sweet tooth.

Gave this place a second chance and was even more disappointed. Unfriendly staff. Food is no better then fast food. My burrito had been sitting under a heat lamp or something so long the melted cheese had dried up. Salsa that comes with the chips tastes like nothing.  No third chance happening here.

Great shop. The guys in here are super chill, friendly and knowledgeable. They're more than happy to share information and teach you a thing or two.  Great selection of juice. Hardware selection is good. Can find just about any popular starter kit, or upgrade. Decent selection of mech mods and other hardware too. Overall, one of my favourite shops in Durham region. When I do get time to just hang out at a shop, this is my spot. I love that it's a more mature vape crowd that goes here (for the most part).
I came back today for the second time. Much better service, no wait and chicken on the rocks with salad was awesome. I was hoping the first visit was just them working out the kinks and it was!
staff is very friendly and the ice cream chocolate toppings are so good...i just wished they had more ice cream flavours

Great taste, great value and huge potions so you better go hungry. This place is always busy no matter what time or what day of the week we go. The service is great and you never feel rushed. When you're really hungry, try the rib and wing combo with choice of side and slaw...you won't be disappointed!

I SHOULD HAVE LOGGED ON TO YELP BEFORE I WENT HERE BUT I WAS IN A RUSH! BECAUSE IT SEEMS IM NOT THE ONLY ONE WHO EXPERIENCED THE GREASE.

Let me start off by saying I was not expecting to have a healthy lunch. I knew what I was getting into. HOWEVER, I just spent 10 minutes trying to soak the grease out of my fish and chips after it made a MESS in my car from just being in the bag the grease was leaking out of the bag. I have had greasy food before but this is not EATABLE. 

The french fries were HARD AS A ROCK over fried and they must have taken them out of the fryer and put them back in a few times.

not to mention I saw the gentlemen who was taking care of my fish drain the water out of my fish using his BARE HANDS??????? I did not even see him washing him before that.

I have never wanted my money back in my life for food. but its lunch time and I could not eat my food.

This is a relatively new business that my husband and I recently discovered. We were first there for breakfast and really enjoyed the food and the bright sunny feel inside. The only downfall is its very hollow and a tad echo ridden but if you dont have a kids birthday beside you, its fine. Nice and clean, staff super nice, and the owner seems to really be trying to have good old fashioned food on the menu (I finally found a good chicken salad sandwich and didnt have to have a wrap!). The breakfast was great and we really liked the home fries, not soggy like other places and not crowded with all sorts of other stuff and spices. The plates for breakfast lunch and dinner are all really well priced and there are also daily specials. I had the soup of the day and it was a fabulous chicken rice with great seasoning and fillings, very well home made!
We are looking forward to this now becoming our favorite "go to spot" when you just want something good to eat without the fuss and flare and prices that go along with it!
We are hoping Daddy's Little Grill sticks around for a long time! Good work guys.
The bathrooms were spotless ladies.

It's actually now called Mother's Kitchen.  Found out about this place in the Snap'd newspaper.  Went one afternoon because I was craving liver.  I know...lol.  Server was friendly & food was served fast & hot.  Large serving size which most will like.  I love the Mom & Pop shops for home cooked meals.  The liver was great, cooked perfectly & served with onions & bacon.  The mashed potatoes were the bomb.  Really good.  The only reason why I'm not giving this review 4 stars is because of one issue.  Apparently the waitress was finished her shift during our meal.  She wanted us to cash out in the middle of our dinner.  This is a no no.  I don't know if this is a trust issue she has with the restaurant or what, but I can't even remember the last time I've been asked to do that, if ever.
