Very comfortable place to shop.  I like having the chairs and benches to sit down to peruse a stack of books to decide on purchases.  A good selection of specialty-topic books and diverse magazines available here, too.  I also love the Clearance shelves.  If you're looking for a gift, there are bags and wrap available as well as giftables which aren't books for those who love decor or gourmet foods.

The best spot is the attached Starbucks. Post-purchase you can curl up with a latte and read away an afternoon.

For me Big Mamma's is a little bit of a drive so I don't pass by here often. However from what I have experienced, I will continue going back for years.

There's many various options for burgers, and I would recommend (my favs) The Big Spice & The Big Mushroom (see below) though most of their menu items are pretty good. The flavour is there, and they got that beef bacon which I love so much.

The Big Spice (grilled jalapenos, spicy smoked sausage, melted monterey jack jalapeno, chipotle mayo, onions, pickles, lettuce, smoked spicy bbq sauce, hot banana peppers).

The Big Mushroom (sauteed mushrooms, melted smoked provolone cheese, smoked Canadian beef strips, sauteed red onions, lettuce, mayo).

One issue I have is that sometimes it can take a while to prepare the burgers so be prepared to wait; especially if it's busy. Though the restaurant (and booths) are fairly small, and the place can get quite busy, the food makes up for most shortfalls. Even the Classic burger is good (tip: if you want something simple but not boring, get a Classic burger with melted smoked provolone cheese and smoked beef strips added). And if you don't like it, get out of Big Mamma's House.

I stand by each of those 5 stars. Without a doubt, it's one of the best Chinese/Thai/Caribbean takeout places I've order from. Food is great, prices are fair, and portions are spot-on.

My favourite dishes are Chilli Beef, Beef Pad Thai, and General Tao Chicken (though it can be a little too sweet). All are good lunch choices!
This is my go-to coffee fix on the way to work as it sports a rare drive-thru.  Always fast & always fresh coffee.  The orders always on the mark.

First time eating here after trying to dine at least three times!  I had the fish Tacos. Yummy!  Sasha and Connor had the Chicken Chimichanga. Wow!  My husband and the Chicken Burrito. Everything was great!

Came here for lunch and I like the food here.  I had the falafel special and the rice is tasty along with the falafel.

I like how you can do half and half which means half rice half fries on your meal but the portion is more like 1/4 fries and the rest is rice.

Still a great place for some good Mediterranean food.

Good fish and chips restaurant, the mood is nice and old. Friendly service and decent food. The price is a little high but overall acceptable. I won't mind coming here again if in in the area and feel like having fish & chips.

I used to visit this Chapters indigo often when I visited Ajax every other weekend. I'm surprised that I have not got around to doing a review until now!

Things have changed a bit since my last visit. The washrooms have been renovated and are a definite improvement from the past!

Each store tends to have a technology section these days. I like looking at the fitness trackers and Kobo readers. I have two of each, so it takes great willpower to not buy anything!

Naturally, I am pleased to visit Starbucks. Seats are taken whenever I am there, so I tend to carry my drink around as I browse. 

I bought a cute Mr. Men / Little Miss nail book. It brings back great childhood memories. It is also a practical book on doing my nails! It was on sale for $5. I saved $10. 

You can get free WiFi when you are there. I wasn't there long enough the last time I was there to do any browsing. 

The cashier cashing my out was friendly and cheerful. I liked the Yummy World taco pillows at the counter. She advised that their eyes were different. I checked them out and she was correct!

I like this store. It is comfortable and has everything that I am looking for. 

(152)

They make an amazing curry goat dinner. VERY tasty and tender. I got the"value meal" size and that was quite filling and satisfying for only$8.99. I liked it so much I came back 2 days in a row. The staff was friendly. I will be back time and time again. This locations food is so much better than the Jane & Finch location.

Nothing special!

There were stuff I was able to find cheaper at Target, which is at next plaza over Costco. I did not really see anything here which is "bulk is cheaper". Just different brand that you would not find, but you can find similar brand which will be cheaper everwhere else.

Ordered a spicy philly chicken steak and poutine. Both were MASSIVE. The price of the poutine was a steal, though I wish I had a little more cheese. The gravy was pretty good as well though a little watery. Philly chicken steak was stuffed generously with green peppers, mushroom, chicken, onions and cheese. Apparently, you can add whatever extras you like from their toppings? I asked for extra hot peppers at the end. My only complaint about the philly was their bun. The bread is too soft to hold all the toppings that it comes with so before the sandwich was finished, it had either become grossly soggy, or split at the seam dropping all the toppings. That aside, oh man... it was so good. Definitely need to go back for more.

Great pub food and a variety of beers on tap. Wait staff are super friendly.  Great kids menu too.  Typical pub fare like wings, burgers etc but they also have daily specials that are worth going off the menu for.

Unlike most Best Buy stores this one does cell phone repairs. I called before I went in to ensure someone was there who would be able to repair my horribly cracked phone. Here I was extremely excited that the screen was finally going to get fixed what I failed to ask was how long it was going to take - my fault completely OR the rep on the phone could have offered that information to me. I figured i would take my Macbook in as well and get some more memory added. Got there at around 8:00pm on a Monday where there were 2 Geek Squad reps working only to find out that my phone would take over an hour to repair. However they were really helpful in showing me which memory I had to purchase. I was told that I should return the next morning to have my phone fixed and the memory installed so off my husband went to get this done for me and again he was turned away because there was 1 person working and was told to come back AGAIN. Wednesday I returned (this time at 6:45pm) to try and have this finally done and I'm sure you can guess what happened...yup turned away because once again because whoever was the genius that creates a schedule failed miserably that week. I was told there would be 3 people on staff on Friday and someone would be able to help me for sure. Annoyed and frustrated but knowing I needed to have my phone screen repaired and my memory installed I went back. I definitely struck luck! My memory was installed within 15 mins of being there and my phone was fixed within an hour! YAY to the guys that were able to finally help. The store itself it setup much like the other locations I've visited. The only other thing I found is that many of the reps are too wrapped up in socializing instead of doing what they were hired for.

Reasonably good lunch.

The rights of keys for really well done. The jerk chicken taste great. Unfortunately I got pieces of chicken with lots of Bones so it was not a lot of meat.

The hot sauce is really good here and has a good kick.

Unfortunately for $15 I could get a more rewarding lunch anywhere.

And most of the competitors in the area or Toronto are significantly less expenses. I typically pay 7 to $10 for a similar lunch elsewhere.

But I won't put the food down and the service was great. next time I'm in the area I'll try something else like the fish or goat.

I have been looking for a nice pub to replace my go too for a good meal close to home since my original pub has new owners and they have changed the menu in a not so very good way.  The Portly Piper has most likely filled this order.

Happened upon it because i was attending a comedy show in the same mall later in the evening and it was conveniently located there.  Soon as i entered i was impressed by the decor and layout. We were seated quickly and the waitress was not long in coming by the table afterwards to get drink orders and drop off the menus.  She was extremely helpful with recommending an appetizer and my girlfriend's main dish.  

Our food was fantastic.  Can't wait to go back and try more items on the menu.

Ive been to the portly piper on many occasions, and i have to say although their food is nothing spectacular, but they do have very generous portions. This is very very busy place over the evenings and weekends, so come early, or have a reservation. 

Im a huge fan of their 1/2 price wings and a pint of beer, which is a great price for a night out with friends and coworkers without breaking the bank. Only downside is that since this is a sports bar, it tends to get quite loud, making conversations very hard unless you speak up.

The cannolis, the cannolis!!!

It's like making love in your mouth.... Okay I'm exaggerating a tad bit, but wow cannolis here are amazing. They were gone in a jiffy! 

Great local family run Italian bakery with very welcoming staff. Tons of food, if anything you must walk out with a cannoli.

Pretty much the same as any Costco however this location doesn't have nearly the selection of clothing as the Markham location.

The gas station 'cattle lineup' is reminiscent of a boarder crossing but considering how busy it gets, it needs to be. Pick a line and stick with it but be prepared for a wait.

If you don't feel like waiting, other gas stations in the area tend to compete in price so it all comes down to how much you feel your time is worth.

I used to go here as a young girl and learned how to golf on this course because it's short and easy to play. Since I played when I was young on it, I thought it would be a great starter course for my son. I called the course and the owner answered the phone and I asked what the age was for children to be able to start golfing in this course. He asked how old my son was and I told him 6. He said "what on earth is a 6 year old doing with golf clubs?!?! And he laughed in my face. Well sir-my son is better then most ADULTS that I know...THATS why he has golf clubs. I believe some
Of the best golfers in the world started young too and I definitely won't be back to your golf course with anyone! My son LOVES golfing, chose to play on his own, and is probably better then you sir :) the end.
Great food with a great selection . Was very pleased with the service . Will be back very shortly. 5 stars and would recommend to friends and family.

We came here for lunch and ordered the authentic Greek souvlaki sticks feast which comes with 8 skewers (pork or chicken), two sides (we got salad and rice), pita bread, a tub of tzatziki sauce and we added an order with Greek fries. Everything was BOMB! Best Greek food I've had in the GTA. The souvlaki was well seasoned and their fries were sooo good with the perfect amount of feta and lemon. The rice was well seasoned and my mother in law wanted to ask the owner for the recipe after eliminating rice from her diet for a while. There were 5 of us and there was not a trace of food left. The food was all made fresh to order and I couldn't help but notice how good the pita (Greek Freak Pita) looked!! Their pitas were huge and are loaded with souvlaki or gyro, fries and tzatziki. They also have gyro and whole chickens on their menu. Definitely coming back soon to try their pork gyro and to get some more of everything! The staff are super friendly so this place is a 5 star!!

This is a sports bar meets English pub. They have screens everywhere and even by the tables if you're eating at a booth. We came on a Saturday night when the Leafs we're playing and it packed! It's loud. Not good for dates or if you're trying to have a nice conversation with someone! It's probably a great atmosphere during playoff tho!

So we ate the munch platter. Best parts of it was the wings and onion rings. We also got a side of Greek salad and it was actually really good! If they make a side salad that tasty then I'm pretty hopeful the other menu items taste good too! Servings for any dish are large so it's ideal for sharing. We'll probably come back here and try the other menu items.

The service here is not so exceptional. Although I am a bulldog nutrition athlete, I find myself time to time at Popeyes because they carry a few brands that bulldog doesn't. Which is kudos for them. Everything is very organized and they've got tons of supps for every diet, every athlete. 

They also have good deals every now and then! Up to 50% off of items. 

I don't think a lot of the associates here are genuinely nice, especially the females. It's a very fake kind of retail store nice, and the overall attitude was not great. After I rejected making an account there, she turned very unfriendly and cold. Also did not give me my Popeye's dollars which I qualified for because I spent enough $, and when I asked, she said you can't get them unless you're a Popeye's member. Which is not true because I've collected many Popeye's dollars from different stores. Definitely lied because she didn't want to deal with me anymore, so ew I definitely left very unpleasantly. 

Every fucking Durham chick working in a supps store thinks she's almighty because she's a fucking bikini competitor and tbh I'm not going back to this location anymore because I'm salty af because they're sour af. 

Ps. Send me my damn Popeye's dollars to my address.

Wow I didn't realize how many cool food places Ajax has nowadays especially this new chocolate place.

They have ice cream dipped cones with many flavoured dips and you get to try the flavoured dip before you order which is great.

Prices are also pretty reasonable.  If you have a sweet tooth then this is the place to be.

I had a craving for Mexican food and decided to try this place on a whim. We arrived at 730 on a Friday night, the place was full! It looked like a couple of tables were ready to leave so we waited. No one greeted us at the door the whole 25 minutes we were there. When the waitress cleaned off a table we actually had to go and ask if we can take it instead of them inviting us to sit. It's a very small place with maybe about 15 tables (all were full) so maybe they were too busy to be friendly. 

I ordered the chimichanga and my boyfriend ordered the chorizo tacos. The chimichanga was pretty disappointing, just meat and blobs of cheese stuffed into a tortilla and deep-fried. The meat wasn't very flavourful. The chorizo tacos were absolutely delicious on the other hand and I would recommend trying that. The diablo habanero sauce is amazing but not for the faint hearted. 

I would come here again when it wasn't so busy as the service was quite lacking and we had to wait a long time to get our order taken and our food.

Whenever I am out this way I usually pop in to browse.  I think I like this location the best because it's never crowded and I can usually find what I want here - no disappointment about things being sold out.

I find this location also has one of the bigger selection of bargain books.  How can you go wrong with book for under $10?! 

Over the years Chapters has really expanded and offers way more than reading material for your bathroom!  Home decor (picture frames, knick knacks, candles); glassware; perfumes/soaps; jewelry and accessories- the lust goes on!

This is one location where I've also seen them carry the Honor brand - the Jessica Alba brand of products.

The staff are always friendly- asking me if they can help me and just by being on the floor.  I never have to look very long if I do need help.

Came in for my usual chicken on sticks with little spice and extra garlic sauce. The location is bigger than the Scarborough one, there is a seating area and also a washroom!  the service was friendly and the place was very clean.

It's awesome that Ajax has an Osmow's now!

We were welcomed by the staff with a smile and once they found out it was our first visit, they walked us through everything in the store. 

Once we got our iceCream and Gelato, we were offered nuts and sprinkles as additional topping. 

We sat there and devoured the desserts on their comfortable and cute setup. 

We finished off the visit by purchasing their chocolate packs which were on sale.

Overall, it was a good experience and their iceCream was delicious.

Two words: JUST GO! 

I was so excited that Chocolats Favoris opened in Ajax, because the other closest location to me is Aurora, which is not even close. This is probably the best ice-cream shop I've ever been to! 

The servers were kind and the service was really good. They were patient and really kind. Our server made two mistakes and the second time we felt bad so we didn't want to say anything, however she remembered and kept apologizing (with cones/cups). The shop itself is really clean and a cute spot to catch up with family or friends and crave your sweet tooth.

They have a variety of items, however they specialize in ice-cream. You get to choose your base ice-cream, the dip and toppings. I personally got the classic milk kooky cup (decided not to get it in a cone) and it was so good! I loved it! I also got to try some of the dulce de leche kooky cup which was also amazing, but a bit too sweet for my taste.

Highly recommend this place!

I'm not sure if it's a franchise thing or just poor management. But every single time I come here to order just basic menu items the cooks are always in the weeds. 

It's like they don't know how to read their ordering system chronologically. Like get your ish together. Hire competent cooks that know what the hell they're doing. It's painful watching these people. 

If there was a direct competitor to Osmow's, it would be Halal Guys. They should take some pointers from their setup.

This is the second time I've eaten here, and I have to say it's been consistently amazing!!!  The food was great but more importantly, the staff is friendly not to mention attentive to your needs. The gyro was the best I've tasted in a long time, again, attention to detail comes through. A definite recommendation and regular place for me to get my Greek Freak on !
Quantities are much smaller than other Osmow locations. For the price you pay they really hold back on the meat.
Tasty Mexican food was good washed down with a corona. Good portions and fair prices.  Relaxed environment, dimly lit and slightly loud music
